Definition
Note

) ON MAIN_DATA
go

ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition

ACTIVE_VEHICLE
Definition A laundry list of vehicles that are in use (pull out) or scheduled.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE ACTIVE_VEHICLE(
     VEHICLE_ID                numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     TRIP_TYPE_ID              numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     IN_USE_TRANSIT_DIV_ID     numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 1 NULL,
     STAGING_AREA_ID           numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     STATUS_IND                varchar(1)         NULL,
     LEAVING_SERVICE_SEC       numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     NEXT_LAYOVER_TIME         numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKACTIVE_VEHICLE PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (VEHICLE_ID)
     ON DAILYLOG_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKTRANSIT_DIV_ACTIVE_VEH FOREIGN KEY (IN_USE_TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
     REFERENCES TRANSIT_DIVISION(TRANSIT_DIV_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKVEHICLE_ACTIVE_VEHICLE FOREIGN KEY (VEHICLE_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE(VEHICLE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/437] FOREIGN KEY (TRIP_TYPE_ID)
     REFERENCES TRIP_TYPE(TRIP_TYPE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT waiting FOREIGN KEY (STAGING_AREA_ID)
     REFERENCES STAGING_AREA(STAGING_AREA_ID)
) ON DAILYLOG_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
VEHICLE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TRIP_TYPE_ID numeric(3, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
IN_USE_TRANSIT_DIV_ID numeric(3, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
STAGING_AREA_ID numeric(5, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
STATUS_IND varchar(1) YES The current status of the active vehicle. Ex.
In charter service (Logon)
In training service (Logon)
Leaving service within \"x\" minutes (Schedule)
Layover within \"x\" minutes (Schedule)
Staged Vehicles by area (Logon & Location)
Assigned but not in service yet (Roster)
In Service (Logon & Schedule)

LEAVING_SERVICE_SEC numeric(10, 0) YES The vehicle is leaving service in 'x' seconds.
NEXT_LAYOVER_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES The vehicle is approaching a layover point within 'x' seconds.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKACTIVE_VEHICLE PrimaryKey VEHICLE_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
TRANSIT_DIVISION ACTIVE_VEHICLE Non-Identifying IN_USE_TRANSIT_DIV_ID
VEHICLE ACTIVE_VEHICLE Identifying VEHICLE_ID
TRIP_TYPE ACTIVE_VEHICLE Non-Identifying TRIP_TYPE_ID
STAGING_AREA ACTIVE_VEHICLE Non-Identifying STAGING_AREA_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP DAILYLOG_DATA

ADHERENCE_ZONE
Definition A set of parameters that can be individually associated with a geographical node. The arrival or departure zone is used to calculate schedule adherence.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE ADHERENCE_ZONE(
     ZONE_ID      numeric(3, 0)     NOT NULL,
     DISTANCE     numeric(7, 2)     NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKADHERENCE_ZONE PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (ZONE_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
ZONE_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
DISTANCE numeric(7, 2) YES The distance prior to (arrival) or beyond (departure) a scheduled stop.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKADHERENCE_ZONE PrimaryKey ZONE_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys

ADHERENCE_ZONE GEO_NODE Non-Identifying GEO_NODE_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

ALARM_STATUS
Definition This table contains a list of statuses that can be assigned to a scheduled block.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE ALARM_STATUS(
     ALARM_STATUS_ID       numeric(3, 0)     NOT NULL,
     ALARM_STATUS_TEXT     varchar(100)      NOT NULL,
     DISPLAY_ORDER         numeric(3, 0)     NULL,
     DEACTIVATION_DATE     datetime          NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKALARM_STATUS PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (ALARM_STATUS_ID)
     ON DAILYLOG_INDX
) ON DAILYLOG_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
ALARM_STATUS_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each row.
ALARM_STATUS_TEXT varchar(100) NO The alarm status text that is displayed to the user. Ex. Late login, late start, late pullin, late pullout.
DISPLAY_ORDER numeric(3, 0) YES Override the display order of this item for a list.
DEACTIVATION_DATE datetime YES The date that an item is removed from display within the system (ie. logical delete).

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKALARM_STATUS PrimaryKey ALARM_STATUS_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
ALARM_STATUS DAILY_PULLOUT Non-Identifying PULLOUT_ID

Storage

FILEGROUP DAILYLOG_DATA

     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition

FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

ANNOUNCEMENT
Definition The internal and external audio and visual announcements that can be utilized on a route. Announcements can be defined at several levels. The hierarchy for which announcement is actually invoked is:

Geo Node (highest priority)
Geo Node Interval
Route Geo Node Xref
Trip Pattern Xref
Trip
Pattern (least priority)
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE ANNOUNCEMENT(
     ANNOUNCE_ID       numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     GROUP_ID          int               NULL,
     ANNOUNCE_DESC     varchar(255)      NOT NULL,
     RESERVED          smallint          NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKANNOUNCEMENT PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (ANNOUNCE_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKANNOUNCE_GRP_ANNOUNCE FOREIGN KEY (GROUP_ID)
     REFERENCES ANNOUNCE_GROUP(GROUP_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
ANNOUNCE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
GROUP_ID int YES The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ANNOUNCE_DESC varchar(255) NO The text description of the announcement that is displayed to the user.
RESERVED smallint YES

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKANNOUNCEMENT PrimaryKey ANNOUNCE_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
ANNOUNCE_GROUP ANNOUNCEMENT Non-Identifying GROUP_ID
ANNOUNCEMENT AUDIO Identifying ANNOUNCE_ID
ANNOUNCEMENT PATTERN_GEO_NODE_XREF Non-Identifying PATTERN_ID
ANNOUNCEMENT PATTERN_GEO_NODE_XREF Non-Identifying PATTERN_ID
ANNOUNCEMENT TRIP_PATTERN_XREF Non-Identifying TRIP_ID
ANNOUNCEMENT TRIP_PATTERN_XREF Non-Identifying TRIP_ID
ANNOUNCEMENT GEO_NODE Non-Identifying GEO_NODE_ID
ANNOUNCEMENT GEO_NODE_INTERVAL Non-Identifying INTERVAL_ID
ANNOUNCEMENT MDT_FILE Non-Identifying BLOCK_ID
ANNOUNCEMENT MDT_FILE Non-Identifying BLOCK_ID
ANNOUNCEMENT PATTERN Non-Identifying PATTERN_ID
ANNOUNCEMENT TRIP Non-Identifying TRIP_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

AUDIO
Definition
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE AUDIO(
     ANNOUNCE_ID        numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     SEQUENCE_INDEX     int               NOT NULL,
     FNAME              varchar(255)      NULL,
     SILENCE_BEFORE     int               NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKAUDIO PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (ANNOUNCE_ID,SEQUENCE_INDEX)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKANNOUNCE_ANNOUNCE_AUDIO FOREIGN KEY (ANNOUNCE_ID)
     REFERENCES ANNOUNCEMENT(ANNOUNCE_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
ANNOUNCE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
SEQUENCE_INDEX int NO A sequential number to make a unique key.
FNAME varchar(255) YES The directory and file name on the operating system where the audio is stored.
SILENCE_BEFORE int YES

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKAUDIO PrimaryKey ANNOUNCE_ID,SEQUENCE_INDEX

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
ANNOUNCEMENT AUDIO Identifying ANNOUNCE_ID
AUDIO VISUAL Identifying ANNOUNCE_ID,SEQUENCE_INDEX

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition

N2RTX_MAXIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES Nothing to Radio TX Maximum

BCM2RTX_MAXIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES Both covert mics to Radio TX Maximum

HSM2OPA_MAXIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES Hand set mic to outside PA Maximum
NO2DS_DEFAULT numeric(2, 0) YES Nothing out to driver speaker Default
NO2DS_MINIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES Nothing out to driver speaker Minimum
NO2DS_MAXIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES Nothing out to driver speaker Maximum
CPUB2DS_DEFAULT numeric(2, 0) YES CPU beep to driver speaker Default
CPUB2DS_MINIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES CPU beep to driver speaker Minimum
CPUB2DS_MAXIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES CPU beep to driver speaker Maximum
RRX2DS_DEFAULT numeric(2, 0) YES Radio RX to driver speaker Default
RRX2DS_MINIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES Radio RX to driver speaker Minimum
RRX2DS_MAXIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES Radio RX to driver speaker Maximum
RRXCPUB2DS_DEFAULT numeric(2, 0) YES Radio RX and CPU beep to driver speaker Default
RRXCPUB2DS_MINIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES Radio RX and CPU beep to driver speaker Minimum
RRXCPUB2DS_MAXIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES Radio RX and CPU beep to driver speaker Maximum
AC2DS_DEFAULT numeric(2, 0) YES Audio card to driver speaker Default
AC2DS_MINIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES Audio card to driver speaker Minimum
AC2DS_MAXIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES Audio card to driver speaker Maximum
ACCPUB2DS_DEFAULT numeric(2, 0) YES Audio card and CPU beep to driver speaker Default
ACCPUB2DS_MINIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES Audio card and CPU beep to driver speaker Minimum
ACCPUB2DS_MAXIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES Audio card and CPU beep to driver speaker Maximum
N2HSS_DEFAULT numeric(2, 0) YES Nothing to hand set speaker Default
N2HSS_MINIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES Nothing to hand set speaker Minimum
N2HSS_MAXIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES Nothing to hand set speaker Maximum
CPUB2HSS_DEFAULT numeric(2, 0) YES CPU beep to hand set speaker Default
CPUB2HSS_MINIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES CPU beep to hand set speaker Minimum
CPUB2HSS_MAXIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES CPU beep to hand set speaker Maximum
RRX2HSS_DEFAULT numeric(2, 0) YES Radio RX to hand set speaker Default
RRX2HSS_MINIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES Radio RX to hand set speaker Minimum
RRX2HSS_MAXIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES Radio RX to hand set speaker Maximum
RRXCPUB2HSS_DEFAULT numeric(2, 0) YES Radio RX and CPU beep to hand set speaker Default
RRXCPUB2HSS_MINIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES Radio RX and CPU beep to hand set speaker Minimum
RRXCPUB2HSS_MAXIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES Radio RX and CPU beep to hand set speaker Maximum

ACCPUB2HSS_MINIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES Audio card and CPU beep to hand set speaker Minimum
ACCPUB2HSS_MAXIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES Audio card and CPU beep to hand set speaker Maximum

CPUB3_MX029_MINIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES CPU beep out of 3rd MX029 Minimum
CPUB3_MX029_MAXIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES CPU beep out of 3rd MX029 Maximum

CPUB3_MX029_RRX_MINIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES CPU beep out of 3rd MX029, mixed with Radio RX Minimum
CPUB3_MX029_RRX_MAXIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES CPU beep out of 3rd MX029, mixed with Radio RX Maximum

CPUB3_MX029_AC_MINIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES CPU beep out of 3rd MX029, mixed with audio card Minimum
CPUB3_MX029_AC_MAXIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES CPU beep out of 3rd MX029, mixed with audio card Maximum

RRXD2M_CA_MINIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES Radio RX data to modem - coarse amp Minimum
RRXD2M_CA_MAXIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES Radio RX data to modem - coarse amp Maximum

AGC_1MIC_2MAGC_MAXIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES 1st AGC mic to muxed AGC Maximum
AGC_2MIC_2MAGC_DEFAULT numeric(2, 0) YES 2nd AGC mic to muxed AGC Default
AGC_2MIC_2MAGC_MINIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES 2nd AGC mic to muxed AGC Minimum
AGC_2MIC_2MAGC_MAXIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES 2nd AGC mic to muxed AGC Maximum
AGC_3MIC_2MAGC_DEFAULT numeric(2, 0) YES 3rd AGC mic to muxed AGC Default
AGC_3MIC_2MAGC_MINIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES 3rd AGC mic to muxed AGC Minimum
AGC_3MIC_2MAGC_MAXIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES 3rd AGC mic to muxed AGC Maximum

HSM2CPUMI_MINIMUM numeric(2, 0) YES Hand set mic to CPU mic input Minimum

BASE_FLEET
Definition This table is used by a database trigger to validate a fleet as one that can be tied to a vehicle as a base fleet.
Note

     FLEET_ID     numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKBASE_FLEET PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (FLEET_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Key Name Key Type Keys

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

BLOCK
Definition Each entry defines the work of a vehicle from the time it leaves the vehicle base until its next return.

This is what a bus does all day; the total path it traverses from
garage pull out to pull in. It may include \"deadhead\" sections to get
to/from garage and start of a route trip or between trips on different
routes. But basically it is a collection of trips. The term comes from
\"blocking\" which is the process of grouping/assigning route trips from the
public schedule into chunks that can be performed sequentially by a
vehicle.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE BLOCK(
     BLOCK_ID                  numeric(10, 0)     NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_GROUP_ID            numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID     numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     VEHICLE_ID                numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     TRANSIT_DIV_ID            numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 1 NULL,
     PULL_OUT_LOC_ID           numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     PULL_IN_LOC_ID            numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     BLOCK_ABBR                varchar(20)        NOT NULL,
     PULL_OUT_TIME             numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     PULL_IN_TIME              numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     SERVICE_TYPE_ID           numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     VEHICLE_TYPE_ID           numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     REMARK                    varchar(2000)      NULL,
     LOGON_ROUTE               numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     LOGON_BLOCK               numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKBLOCK PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (BLOCK_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKROUTE_GROUP_BLOCK FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_GROUP_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE_GROUP(ROUTE_GROUP_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKSERVICE_TYPE_BLOCK FOREIGN KEY (SERVICE_TYPE_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_TYPE(SERVICE_TYPE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTRANSIT_DIV_BLOCK FOREIGN KEY (TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
     REFERENCES TRANSIT_DIVISION(TRANSIT_DIV_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTT_VERSION_BLOCK FOREIGN KEY (TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
     REFERENCES TIME_TABLE_VERSION(TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKVEHICLE_BASE_BLOCK1 FOREIGN KEY (PULL_OUT_LOC_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE_BASE(VEHICLE_BASE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKVEHICLE_BASE_BLOCK2 FOREIGN KEY (PULL_IN_LOC_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE_BASE(VEHICLE_BASE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKVEHICLE_BLOCK FOREIGN KEY (VEHICLE_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE(VEHICLE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKVEHICLE_TYPE_BLOCK FOREIGN KEY (VEHICLE_TYPE_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE_TYPE(VEHICLE_TYPE_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
BLOCK_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ROUTE_GROUP_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The route group (line group) associated with a block. Used for inquiry.
TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique number associated with the concepts, messages and parts of a schedule including all the messages associated with the scheduling business area.
VEHICLE_ID numeric(5, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TRANSIT_DIV_ID numeric(3, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
PULL_OUT_LOC_ID numeric(3, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
PULL_IN_LOC_ID numeric(3, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
BLOCK_ABBR varchar(20) NO An alpha-numeric identifier used to associate a sequence of trips to a transit vehicle.
PULL_OUT_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES The time at which a vehicle pulls out of its storage facility (vehicle base) in order to arrive at the first timepoint of its scheduled revenue service.

This is a denormalized, calculated attribute.
PULL_IN_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES The time at which a transit vehicle arrives at its storage facility (vehicle base) after deadheading from the last time point of its scheduled revenue service.

This is a denormalized, calculated attribute.
SERVICE_TYPE_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
VEHICLE_TYPE_ID numeric(3, 0) YES Specifies a particular type of vehicle that is required to run this route. For example, must have a wheelchair lift, certain length, articulated, etc.
REMARK varchar(2000) YES A free-form text field to record general information about a block.
LOGON_ROUTE numeric(3, 0) YES MDT logon route.
LOGON_BLOCK numeric(3, 0) YES MDT logon block.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKBLOCK PrimaryKey BLOCK_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
ROUTE_GROUP BLOCK Non-Identifying ROUTE_GROUP_ID
SERVICE_TYPE BLOCK Non-Identifying SERVICE_TYPE_ID
TRANSIT_DIVISION BLOCK Non-Identifying TRANSIT_DIV_ID
TIME_TABLE_VERSION BLOCK Non-Identifying TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID
VEHICLE_BASE BLOCK Non-Identifying PULL_OUT_LOC_ID
VEHICLE_BASE BLOCK Non-Identifying PULL_IN_LOC_ID
VEHICLE BLOCK Non-Identifying VEHICLE_ID
VEHICLE_TYPE BLOCK Non-Identifying VEHICLE_TYPE_ID
BLOCK BLOCK_SUBSTITUTION Identifying CALENDAR_ID
BLOCK DAILY_BLOCK_CANCELLATION Identifying CALENDAR_ID
BLOCK DAILY_PULLOUT Non-Identifying PULLOUT_ID
BLOCK MDT_FILE Identifying BLOCK_ID
BLOCK MDT_TRANSFER Non-Identifying TRANSFER_OFFSET_ID
BLOCK TRIP Non-Identifying TRIP_ID
BLOCK SCHEDULE_ADHERENCE Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
BLOCK SCHEDULE_DEVIATION Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
BLOCK PULL_IN_OUT_SUMMARY Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

BLOCK_SUBSTITUTION
Definition Scheduled vehicle substitution for a specific service day.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE BLOCK_SUBSTITUTION(
     CALENDAR_ID     numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     BLOCK_ID        numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     VEHICLE_ID      numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKBLOCK_SUBSTITUTION PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (CALENDAR_ID,BLOCK_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKBLOCK_BLOCK_SUBSTITUTION FOREIGN KEY (BLOCK_ID)
     REFERENCES BLOCK(BLOCK_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKSERVICE_CAL_BLOCK_SUBST FOREIGN KEY (CALENDAR_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_CALENDAR(CALENDAR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKVEHICLE_BLOCK_SUBSTITUTION FOREIGN KEY (VEHICLE_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE(VEHICLE_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
CALENDAR_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
BLOCK_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
VEHICLE_ID numeric(5, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.

Foreign Keys

BREAD_CRUMB
Definition This table contains \"bread crumb\" trails of recorded lat long readings created during the Route Generation survey process.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE BREAD_CRUMB(
     TRAIL_ID       numeric(10, 0)     NOT NULL,
     TRAIL_NAME     varchar(100)       NOT NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKBREAD_CRUMB PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (TRAIL_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
TRAIL_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TRAIL_NAME varchar(100) NO The user description for this bread crumb trail.

FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

BREAD_CRUMB_POINT
Definition A collection of survey points that comprise a \"bread crumb\" trail or route.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE BREAD_CRUMB_POINT(
     TRAIL_ID                  numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     UNIQUE_ID                 numeric(5, 0)      NOT NULL,
     LATITUDE                  numeric(12, 0)     NULL,
     LONGITUDE                 numeric(12, 0)     NULL,
     DIFFERENTIAL_VALIDITY     varchar(1)         NULL,
     NUM_OF_SATELLITES         numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     NUM_SURVEY_POINTS         numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     DISTANCE                  numeric(7, 2)      NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKBREAD_CRUMB_POINT PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (TRAIL_ID,UNIQUE_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKBREAD_CRUMB_BREAD_CRUMB_PT FOREIGN KEY (TRAIL_ID)
     REFERENCES BREAD_CRUMB(TRAIL_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
TRAIL_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
UNIQUE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
LATITUDE numeric(12, 0) YES The latitude reading.
LONGITUDE numeric(12, 0) YES The longitude reading.
DIFFERENTIAL_VALIDITY varchar(1) YES Value of 0, 1, or 2.
NUM_OF_SATELLITES numeric(3, 0) YES Number of satellites used to survey this point.
NUM_SURVEY_POINTS numeric(3, 0) YES The number of DGPS positions collected for point surveying, usually a number between 1 and 20.
DISTANCE numeric(7, 2) YES

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKBREAD_CRUMB_POINT PrimaryKey TRAIL_ID,UNIQUE_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
BREAD_CRUMB BREAD_CRUMB_POINT Identifying TRAIL_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

COMMUNICATION_SUMMARY
Definition
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE COMMUNICATION_SUMMARY(
     CALENDAR_ID      numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     OPERATOR_ID      numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     VEHICLE_ID       numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_ID         numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     COVERT_ALARM     int                NULL,
     OVERT_ALARM      int                NULL,
     PRTT             int                NULL,
     RTT              int                NULL,
     LIFT_CYCLED      int                NULL,
     CONSTRAINT [R/517] FOREIGN KEY (VEHICLE_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE(VEHICLE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/518] FOREIGN KEY (OPERATOR_ID)
     REFERENCES OPERATOR(OPERATOR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/519] FOREIGN KEY (CALENDAR_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_CALENDAR(CALENDAR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/525] FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE(ROUTE_ID)
) ON REPORTING_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
CALENDAR_ID numeric(10, 0) NO Service day.
OPERATOR_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The driver that logged the message.
VEHICLE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The vehicle that logged the message.
ROUTE_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The logon route for the message.
COVERT_ALARM int YES Count of messages logged.
OVERT_ALARM int YES Count of messages logged.
PRTT int YES Count of messages logged.
RTT int YES Count of messages logged.
LIFT_CYCLED int YES Count of messages logged.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys

OPERATOR COMMUNICATION_SUMMARY Non-Identifying OPERATOR_ID
SERVICE_CALENDAR COMMUNICATION_SUMMARY Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
ROUTE COMMUNICATION_SUMMARY Non-Identifying ROUTE_ID

     CONSTRAINT FKSERVICE_CAL_CURRENT_VERSION FOREIGN KEY (CALENDAR_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_CALENDAR(CALENDAR_ID),

     REFERENCES TIME_TABLE_VERSION(TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA

     ON MAIN_INDX,

     REFERENCES BLOCK(BLOCK_ID),

     REFERENCES SERVICE_CALENDAR(CALENDAR_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA

DAILY_MESSAGE_TEXT
Definition Reporting. This table is sourced from MT_DISPATCHFREETEXT (#53) messages in the TMdailylog..logged_message table.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE DAILY_MESSAGE_TEXT(
     CALENDAR_ID                numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID     int                DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP          datetime           NULL,
     OPERATOR_ID                numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     MESSAGE_INFO_ID            numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     TEXT_MESSAGE               varchar(255)       NULL,
     CONSTRAINT [R/460] FOREIGN KEY (OPERATOR_ID)
     REFERENCES OPERATOR(OPERATOR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/478] FOREIGN KEY (CALENDAR_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_CALENDAR(CALENDAR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/480] FOREIGN KEY (TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID)
     REFERENCES LOGGED_MESSAGE(TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/482] FOREIGN KEY (MESSAGE_INFO_ID)
     REFERENCES MESSAGE_INFO(MESSAGE_INFO_ID)
) ON REPORTING_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
CALENDAR_ID numeric(10, 0) NO The service day that this message was logged.
TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID int NO The message id.
MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP datetime YES The date and time that the message was recorded in the logged_message table.
OPERATOR_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The operator associated with the message.
MESSAGE_INFO_ID numeric(5, 0) YES Link to the message_info table in the TMmain database.
TEXT_MESSAGE varchar(255) YES Free form text message.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XIE1DAILY_MESSAGE_TEXT Index MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
OPERATOR DAILY_MESSAGE_TEXT Non-Identifying OPERATOR_ID
SERVICE_CALENDAR DAILY_MESSAGE_TEXT Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
LOGGED_MESSAGE DAILY_MESSAGE_TEXT Non-Identifying TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID
MESSAGE_INFO DAILY_MESSAGE_TEXT Non-Identifying MESSAGE_INFO_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP REPORTING_DATA

DAILY_PULLOUT
Definition The block-based daily schedule of pullouts. Rows are added at the beginning of each operation day and updated as actual information becomes available.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE DAILY_PULLOUT(
     PULLOUT_ID                 numeric(10, 0)     NOT NULL,
     BLOCK_ID                   numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     CALENDAR_ID                numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     SCHEDULED_VEHICLE_ID       numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     SCHEDULED_PULLOUT_TIME     numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     SCHEDULED_PULLIN_TIME      numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     ACTUAL_VEHICLE_ID          numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     ACTUAL_PULLOUT_TIME        numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     ACTUAL_PULLIN_TIME         numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     ALARM_STATUS_ID            numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     OVERLOAD_FLAG              numeric(1, 0)      NOT NULL,
     TIME_OFFSET                numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKDAILY_PULLOUT PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (PULLOUT_ID)
     ON DAILYLOG_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKALARM_STATUS_DAILY_PULLOUT FOREIGN KEY (ALARM_STATUS_ID)
     REFERENCES ALARM_STATUS(ALARM_STATUS_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKBLOCK_DAILY_PULLOUT FOREIGN KEY (BLOCK_ID)
     REFERENCES BLOCK(BLOCK_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKSERVICE_CAL_DAILY_PO FOREIGN KEY (CALENDAR_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_CALENDAR(CALENDAR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKVEHICLE_DAILY_PULLOUT1 FOREIGN KEY (SCHEDULED_VEHICLE_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE(VEHICLE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKVEHICLE_DAILY_PULLOUT2 FOREIGN KEY (ACTUAL_VEHICLE_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE(VEHICLE_ID)
) ON DAILYLOG_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
PULLOUT_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
BLOCK_ID numeric(10, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
CALENDAR_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
SCHEDULED_VEHICLE_ID numeric(5, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
SCHEDULED_PULLOUT_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES The planned, or scheduled pullout time for this block.
SCHEDULED_PULLIN_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES The planned, or scheduled pullin time for this block.
ACTUAL_VEHICLE_ID numeric(5, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ACTUAL_PULLOUT_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES The actual time the vehicle pulled out as recorded/transmitted by the MDT.
ACTUAL_PULLIN_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES The actual time the vehicle pulled out as recorded/transmitted by the MDT.
ALARM_STATUS_ID numeric(3, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each row.
OVERLOAD_FLAG numeric(1, 0) NO Indicates if this is an overload block.

0 = no
1 = yes
TIME_OFFSET numeric(3, 0) YES The time offset in minutes from schedule for overload blocks. Maximum is 500
minutes.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKDAILY_PULLOUT PrimaryKey PULLOUT_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
ALARM_STATUS DAILY_PULLOUT Non-Identifying ALARM_STATUS_ID
BLOCK DAILY_PULLOUT Non-Identifying BLOCK_ID
SERVICE_CALENDAR DAILY_PULLOUT Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
VEHICLE DAILY_PULLOUT Non-Identifying SCHEDULED_VEHICLE_ID
VEHICLE DAILY_PULLOUT Non-Identifying ACTUAL_VEHICLE_ID
DAILY_PULLOUT DAILY_TRIP Non-Identifying DAILY_TRIP_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP DAILYLOG_DATA

DAILY_RUN
Definition The run-based daily schedule of operator logons. Rows are added at the beginning of each operation day and updated as actual information becomes available.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE DAILY_RUN(
     DAILY_RUN_ID              numeric(10, 0)     NOT NULL,
     OPERATOR_ID               numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     CALENDAR_ID               numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     RUN_ID                    numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     REPLACED_DAILY_RUN_ID     numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKDAILY_RUN PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (DAILY_RUN_ID)
     ON DAILYLOG_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKDAILY_RUN_DAILY_RUN FOREIGN KEY (REPLACED_DAILY_RUN_ID)
     REFERENCES DAILY_RUN(DAILY_RUN_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKRUN_DAILY_RUN FOREIGN KEY (RUN_ID)
     REFERENCES RUN(RUN_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKSERVICE_CAL_DAILY_RUN FOREIGN KEY (CALENDAR_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_CALENDAR(CALENDAR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/449] FOREIGN KEY (OPERATOR_ID)
     REFERENCES OPERATOR(OPERATOR_ID)
) ON DAILYLOG_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
DAILY_RUN_ID numeric(10, 0) NO The unique, system-assigned identifier for each row.
OPERATOR_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The unique, system-assigned identifier for an operator record.
CALENDAR_ID numeric(10, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
RUN_ID numeric(10, 0) YES Identifies the piece of work for an operator on a given day type or within a particular schedule.
REPLACED_DAILY_RUN_ID numeric(10, 0) YES This is a replacement run and specifies the daily run that was replaced.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKDAILY_RUN PrimaryKey DAILY_RUN_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
DAILY_RUN DAILY_RUN Non-Identifying REPLACED_DAILY_RUN_ID
RUN DAILY_RUN Non-Identifying RUN_ID
SERVICE_CALENDAR DAILY_RUN Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
OPERATOR DAILY_RUN Non-Identifying OPERATOR_ID
DAILY_RUN DAILY_RUN Non-Identifying DAILY_RUN_ID
DAILY_RUN DAILY_WORK_PIECE Non-Identifying DAILY_WORK_PIECE_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP DAILYLOG_DATA

DAILY_TRIP
Definition
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE DAILY_TRIP(
     DAILY_TRIP_ID           numeric(10, 0)     NOT NULL,
     TRIP_ID                 numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     DAILY_WORK_PIECE_ID     numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     PULLOUT_ID              numeric(10, 0)     NOT NULL,
     SCHED_TIME_BEGIN        numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     SCHED_TIME_END          numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     CANCELLED_FLAG          numeric(1, 0)      NOT NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKDAILY_TRIP PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (DAILY_TRIP_ID)
     ON DAILYLOG_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKDAILY_PULLOUT_DAILY_TRIP FOREIGN KEY (PULLOUT_ID)
     REFERENCES DAILY_PULLOUT(PULLOUT_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKDAILY_WORKPIECE_DAILY_TRIP FOREIGN KEY (DAILY_WORK_PIECE_ID)
     REFERENCES DAILY_WORK_PIECE(DAILY_WORK_PIECE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/454] FOREIGN KEY (TRIP_ID)
     REFERENCES TRIP(TRIP_ID)
) ON DAILYLOG_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
DAILY_TRIP_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TRIP_ID numeric(10, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
DAILY_WORK_PIECE_ID numeric(10, 0) YES
PULLOUT_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
SCHED_TIME_BEGIN numeric(10, 0) YES The scheduled begin time for a trip. This is a computed value that is derived from the time_point_crossing table.
SCHED_TIME_END numeric(10, 0) YES The scheduled end time for a trip. This is a computed value that is derived from the time_point_crossing table.
CANCELLED_FLAG numeric(1, 0) NO Indicates if this trip has been cancelled.

0 = no
1 = yes

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKDAILY_TRIP PrimaryKey DAILY_TRIP_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
DAILY_PULLOUT DAILY_TRIP Non-Identifying PULLOUT_ID
DAILY_WORK_PIECE DAILY_TRIP Non-Identifying DAILY_WORK_PIECE_ID
TRIP DAILY_TRIP Non-Identifying TRIP_ID
DAILY_TRIP TIME_POINT_CROSSING Identifying DAILY_TRIP_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP DAILYLOG_DATA

DAILY_WORK_PIECE
Definition The work pieces for a daily run.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE DAILY_WORK_PIECE(
     DAILY_WORK_PIECE_ID       numeric(10, 0)     NOT NULL,
     DAILY_RUN_ID              numeric(10, 0)     NOT NULL,
     WORK_PIECE_ID             numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     SCHEDULED_LOGON_TIME      numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     SCHEDULED_LOGOFF_TIME     numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     ACTUAL_LOGON_TIME         numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     ACTUAL_LOGOFF_TIME        numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKDAILY_WORK_PIECE PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (DAILY_WORK_PIECE_ID)
     ON DAILYLOG_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKDAILY_RUN_DAILY_RUN_LOGON FOREIGN KEY (DAILY_RUN_ID)
     REFERENCES DAILY_RUN(DAILY_RUN_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/455] FOREIGN KEY (WORK_PIECE_ID)
     REFERENCES WORK_PIECE(WORK_PIECE_ID)
) ON DAILYLOG_DATA
go

ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition

DAILY_RUN_ID numeric(10, 0) NO The unique, system-assigned identifier for each row.
WORK_PIECE_ID numeric(10, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record..
SCHEDULED_LOGON_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES The scheduled operator logon time.
SCHEDULED_LOGOFF_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES The scheduled operator logoff time.
ACTUAL_LOGON_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES The actual driver logon time
ACTUAL_LOGOFF_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES The actual driver logoff time

DB_ROW_COUNT
Definition A repository of database table row counts over time to be used for database administration and capacity planning.
Note

     COUNT_DATE     datetime          NOT NULL,
     TABLE_NAME     varchar(20)       NOT NULL,
     ROW_COUNT      numeric(7, 0)     NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKDB_ROW_COUNT PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (COUNT_DATE,TABLE_NAME)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
COUNT_DATE datetime NO The date the count was recorded.
TABLE_NAME varchar(20) NO The name of the database table.
ROW_COUNT numeric(7, 0) YES The number of rows in the database table.

Foreign Keys

FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

DISPATCH_DOCUMENT
Definition Collection of text files created by a dispatcher or supervisor that will be viewed by any dispatcher or supervisor. Examples: School pass procedure, Fare structure info, etc. The Documents may be associated with a specific route.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE DISPATCH_DOCUMENT(
     DOCUMENT_ID       numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     DOCUMENT_NAME     varchar(255)      NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_DESC        varchar(14)       NULL,
     KEYWORDS          varchar(1024)     NULL,
     DOCUMENT_TEXT     text              NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKDISPATCH_DOCUMENT PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (DOCUMENT_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
DOCUMENT_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
DOCUMENT_NAME varchar(255) NO A unique file name for the document. No duplicates allowed, unless records are related to different routes.
ROUTE_DESC varchar(14) YES Optional textual identifier of a route (note: cannot make it a route_id because documents should exist independent of time_table_versions).
KEYWORDS varchar(1024) YES Optional number of keywords for search purposes.
DOCUMENT_TEXT text YES Data block holding up to 50 pages (ca 200KB) of text.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XAK1DISPATCH_DOCUMENT Index DOCUMENT_NAME,ROUTE_DESC
XPKDISPATCH_DOCUMENT PrimaryKey DOCUMENT_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

     FIRST_NAME        varchar(20)       NULL,

) ON MAIN_DATA

LAST_NAME varchar(20) YES The surname of the dispatch staff member.

DRIVER_LOGON
Definition Reportings. Sourced from mt_logon (#9) messages in the tmdailylog..logged_message table.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE DRIVER_LOGON(
     CALENDAR_ID          numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     OPERATOR_ID          numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     VEHICLE_ID           numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     LOGON_DATE_TIME      datetime           NULL,
     LOGOFF_DATE_TIME     datetime           NULL,
     CONSTRAINT [R/511] FOREIGN KEY (CALENDAR_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_CALENDAR(CALENDAR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/512] FOREIGN KEY (OPERATOR_ID)
     REFERENCES OPERATOR(OPERATOR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/513] FOREIGN KEY (VEHICLE_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE(VEHICLE_ID)
) ON REPORTING_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
CALENDAR_ID numeric(10, 0) NO Service day.
OPERATOR_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The operator that logged on.
VEHICLE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The vehicle that logged the message.
LOGON_DATE_TIME datetime YES Logon date and time.
LOGOFF_DATE_TIME datetime YES Logoff date and time.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
SERVICE_CALENDAR DRIVER_LOGON Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
OPERATOR DRIVER_LOGON Non-Identifying OPERATOR_ID
VEHICLE DRIVER_LOGON Non-Identifying VEHICLE_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP REPORTING_DATA

DRIVER_VIOLATION
Definition Reporting. Sourced from mt_driverviolation (#20) messages in the tmdailylog..logged_message table.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE DRIVER_VIOLATION(
     CALENDAR_ID               numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     OPERATOR_ID               numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     VEHICLE_ID                numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     SPEEDING                  int                NULL,
     NOLOGON                   int                NULL,
     WHEELCHAIRNOTCYCLED       int                NULL,
     OFFROUTE                  int                NULL,
     RESYNC                    int                NULL,
     NO_LOW_AIR_PRESS_TEST     int                NULL,
     VEHICLE_STOPPED           int                NULL,
     CONSTRAINT [R/514] FOREIGN KEY (CALENDAR_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_CALENDAR(CALENDAR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/515] FOREIGN KEY (OPERATOR_ID)
     REFERENCES OPERATOR(OPERATOR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/516] FOREIGN KEY (VEHICLE_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE(VEHICLE_ID)
) ON REPORTING_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
CALENDAR_ID numeric(10, 0) NO Service day.
OPERATOR_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The operator that logged the messages.
VEHICLE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The vehicle that logged the messages.
SPEEDING int YES Count of messages logged.
NOLOGON int YES Count of messages logged.
WHEELCHAIRNOTCYCLED int YES Count of messages logged.
OFFROUTE int YES Count of messages logged.
RESYNC int YES Count of messages logged.
NO_LOW_AIR_PRESS_TEST int YES Count of messages logged.
VEHICLE_STOPPED int YES Count of messages logged.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
SERVICE_CALENDAR DRIVER_VIOLATION Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
OPERATOR DRIVER_VIOLATION Non-Identifying OPERATOR_ID
VEHICLE DRIVER_VIOLATION Non-Identifying VEHICLE_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP REPORTING_DATA

EQUIPMENT_PROFILE
Definition Each record represents a configuration profile pertaining to equipment installed on a vehicle.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE EQUIPMENT_PROFILE(
     EQUIP_PROFILE_ID              numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     PROFILE_NAME                  varchar(100)      NULL,
     GPS_TYPE                      varchar(20)       NULL,
     ODOMETER_TYPE                 varchar(20)       NULL,
     HEADING_REF_TYPE              varchar(20)       NULL,
     PASSENGER_CTR_TYPE            varchar(20)       NULL,
     ANNUNCIATOR_TYPE              varchar(20)       NULL,
     FARE_COLLECT_TYPE             varchar(20)       NULL,
     SMART_CARD_TYPE               varchar(20)       NULL,
     DIFF_CORR_SRC                 varchar(20)       NULL,
     RADIO_TYPE                    varchar(20)       NULL,
     RADIO_MODEL                   varchar(20)       NULL,
     MAX_CHANNELS                  numeric(7, 0)     NULL,
     ENGINE_CONTROL_TYPE           varchar(20)       NULL,
     GOOSENECK_FOOT_SWITCH_IND     varchar(1)        NULL,
     DR500_INSTALLED_IND           varchar(1)        NULL,
     WHEEL_CHAIR_LIFT_IND          varchar(1)        NULL,
     PALM_MIC_IND                  varchar(1)        NULL,
     LUM_HEAD_SIGN_CTRL            varchar(20)       NULL,
     LVA_INSTALLED                 varchar(20)       NULL,
     INSIDE_LVA_REPEATS            numeric(7, 0)     NULL,
     OUTSIDE_LVAR_REPEATS          numeric(7, 0)     NULL,
     AGC_MICS_FLAGS                numeric(1, 0)     NULL,
     LUM_INSIDE_SIGN_CTRL          varchar(20)       NULL,
     UPDATE_TIMESTAMP              datetime          NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKEQUIPMENT_PROFILE PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (EQUIP_PROFILE_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
EQUIP_PROFILE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
PROFILE_NAME varchar(100) YES The text description, or user-assigned identifier for a profile.
GPS_TYPE varchar(20) YES MPE or Jupiter (eeprom.h 300)
ODOMETER_TYPE varchar(20) YES None or Dixon 2PPR (eeprom.h 301)
HEADING_REF_TYPE varchar(20) YES None or KVH C-100 (eeprom.h 302)
PASSENGER_CTR_TYPE varchar(20) YES None or Red Pines RS232 (eeprom.h 303)
ANNUNCIATOR_TYPE varchar(20) YES None or Digital Recorders J1708 (eeprom.h 304)
FARE_COLLECT_TYPE varchar(20) YES None (eeprom.h 305)
SMART_CARD_TYPE varchar(20) YES None (eeprom.h 306)
DIFF_CORR_SRC varchar(20) YES (eeprom.h 307)
RADIO_TYPE varchar(20) YES Motorola=0, Ericsson=1 (eeprom.h 308)
RADIO_MODEL varchar(20) YES (Spectra=1,GM300=2,Maxtrac=3,MDX=4,Johnson=5) (eeprom.h 309)
MAX_CHANNELS numeric(7, 0) YES The max channels available. (eeprom.h 310)
ENGINE_CONTROL_TYPE varchar(20) YES 0=None, 1=DDEC, 2=CELECT, 3=CELECTPLUS (eeprom.h 311)
GOOSENECK_FOOT_SWITCH_IND varchar(1) YES True/False (eeprom.h 312)
DR500_INSTALLED_IND varchar(1) YES True/False (eeprom.h 313)
WHEEL_CHAIR_LIFT_IND varchar(1) YES True/False (eeprom.h 314)
PALM_MIC_IND varchar(1) YES True/False (eeprom.h 315)
LUM_HEAD_SIGN_CTRL varchar(20) YES Number of COM port to which headsign is attached. 0 implies none. (eeprom.h 316)
LVA_INSTALLED varchar(20) YES Number of COM port to which LVA is attached. 0 implies none. (eeprom.h 317)
INSIDE_LVA_REPEATS numeric(7, 0) YES Number of times to make inside aural announcement. If LVA Installed, limit to 0 to 5. 0 & 1 will imply 1. (eeprom.h 318)
OUTSIDE_LVAR_REPEATS numeric(7, 0) YES Number of times to make outside aural announcement. If LVA Installed, limit to 0 to 5. 0 & 1 will imply 1. (eeprom.h 318)
AGC_MICS_FLAGS numeric(1, 0) YES 1=mic1, 2=mic2, 4=mic3
LUM_INSIDE_SIGN_CTRL varchar(20) YES
UPDATE_TIMESTAMP datetime YES

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKEQUIPMENT_PROFILE PrimaryKey EQUIP_PROFILE_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
EQUIPMENT_PROFILE VEHICLE Non-Identifying VEHICLE_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

FARE_ZONE
Definition Each entry defines a type of fare zone.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE FARE_ZONE(
     FARE_ZONE_ID       numeric(3, 0)     NOT NULL,
     FARE_ZONE_NAME     varchar(100)      NOT NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKFARE_ZONE PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (FARE_ZONE_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
FARE_ZONE_ID numeric(3, 0) NO An unique number used to reference a geographic area with which a specified fare is associated. (The fare may be based on trips between two fare zones or as a fixed value at Stop Points contained in the zone.)
FARE_ZONE_NAME varchar(100) NO The text translation of the fare zone code.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKFARE_ZONE PrimaryKey FARE_ZONE_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
FARE_ZONE PATTERN_GEO_NODE_XREF Non-Identifying PATTERN_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

FLEET
Definition The master list of fleet designations that can be assigned to a vehicle.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE FLEET(
     FLEET_ID              numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     FLEET_TEXT            varchar(100)      NULL,
     DISPLAY_ORDER         numeric(3, 0)     NULL,
     DEACTIVATION_DATE     datetime          NULL,
     NT_GROUP_ID           numeric(3, 0)     NULL,
     OPERATING_MODE_ID     numeric(3, 0)     NULL,
     LOW_LOGON_ROUTE       varchar(10)       NULL,
     LOW_LOGON_BLOCK       varchar(10)       NULL,
     HIGH_LOGON_ROUTE      varchar(10)       NULL,
     HIGH_LOGON_BLOCK      varchar(10)       NULL,
     BASE_FLEET_FLAG       numeric(1, 0)     NOT NULL,
     LOGON_FLEET_FLAG      numeric(1, 0)     NOT NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKFLEET PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (FLEET_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKMDT_OPER_MODE_FLEET FOREIGN KEY (OPERATING_MODE_ID)
     REFERENCES MDT_OPERATING_MODE(OPERATING_MODE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKNT_GROUP_FLEET FOREIGN KEY (NT_GROUP_ID)
     REFERENCES NT_GROUP(NT_GROUP_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
FLEET_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
FLEET_TEXT varchar(100) YES The text that is displayed to the user for the name of the fleet.

Ex. Fixed Route, ParaTransit, Supervisory, Maintenance.
DISPLAY_ORDER numeric(3, 0) YES Override the display order of this item for a list.
DEACTIVATION_DATE datetime YES The date that an item is removed from display within the system (ie. logical delete).
NT_GROUP_ID numeric(3, 0) YES The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
OPERATING_MODE_ID numeric(3, 0) YES Defines the mode to use when logged in to each fleet.
LOW_LOGON_ROUTE varchar(10) YES Logon range attribute entered on the MDT when logging in to this fleet.
LOW_LOGON_BLOCK varchar(10) YES Logon range attribute entered on the MDT when logging in to this fleet.
HIGH_LOGON_ROUTE varchar(10) YES Logon range attribute entered on the MDT when logging in to this fleet.
HIGH_LOGON_BLOCK varchar(10) YES Logon range attribute entered on the MDT when logging in to this fleet.
BASE_FLEET_FLAG numeric(1, 0) NO Specifies if this fleet can be assigned to a vehicle as a base fleet.

0 - False
1 - True
LOGON_FLEET_FLAG numeric(1, 0) NO Specifies if this fleet can be used by a vehicle for logon.

0 - False
1 - True

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKFLEET PrimaryKey FLEET_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
MDT_OPERATING_MODE FLEET Non-Identifying OPERATING_MODE_ID
NT_GROUP FLEET Non-Identifying NT_GROUP_ID
FLEET FLEET_TRANSITION_XREF Identifying BASE_FLEET_ID
FLEET FLEET_TRANSITION_XREF Identifying BASE_FLEET_ID
FLEET INCIDENT Non-Identifying INCIDENT_ID
FLEET OPERATOR_FLEET_XREF Identifying OPERATOR_ID
FLEET WORK_ASSIGNMENT_DEFAULT Non-Identifying CONFIGURATION_ID
FLEET WA_ROLE_FLEET_XREF Identifying CONFIGURATION_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

FLEET_TRANSITION_XREF
Definition This table identifies the valid logon fleet(s) for a base fleet.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE FLEET_TRANSITION_XREF(
     BASE_FLEET_ID      numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     LOGON_FLEET_ID     numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKFLEET_TRANSITION_XREF PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (BASE_FLEET_ID,LOGON_FLEET_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKFLEET_FLEET_TRANS_XREF1 FOREIGN KEY (BASE_FLEET_ID)
     REFERENCES FLEET(FLEET_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKFLEET_FLEET_TRANS_XREF2 FOREIGN KEY (LOGON_FLEET_ID)
     REFERENCES FLEET(FLEET_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
BASE_FLEET_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
LOGON_FLEET_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.

Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys

FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

FORM_SELECTION
Definition This table identifies the incident report form to be used based on the incident type, incident sub type, and message type (optional) selected by the user.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE FORM_SELECTION(
     FORM_SELECTION_ID       numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     INCIDENT_TYPE_ID        numeric(5, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     INCIDENT_SUBTYPE_ID     numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     MESSAGE_TYPE_ID         numeric(3, 0)     NULL,
     FORM_ID                 numeric(7, 0)     NULL,
     PRIORITY                numeric(3, 0)     NULL,
     SEVERITY                numeric(3, 0)     NULL,
     DEACTIVATION_DATE       datetime          NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKFORM_SELECTION PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (FORM_SELECTION_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKINCIDENT_RPT_FORM_FORM_SEL FOREIGN KEY (FORM_ID)
     REFERENCES INCIDENT_REPORT_FORM(FORM_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKINCIDENT_SUBTYPE_FORM_SEL FOREIGN KEY (INCIDENT_SUBTYPE_ID)
     REFERENCES INCIDENT_SUBTYPE(INCIDENT_SUBTYPE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKINCIDENT_TYPE_FORM_SEL FOREIGN KEY (INCIDENT_TYPE_ID)
     REFERENCES INCIDENT_TYPE(INCIDENT_TYPE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKMSG_TYPE_FORM_SELECTION FOREIGN KEY (MESSAGE_TYPE_ID)
     REFERENCES MESSAGE_TYPE(MESSAGE_TYPE_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
FORM_SELECTION_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
INCIDENT_TYPE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The selected incident type.
INCIDENT_SUBTYPE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The selected incident sub type.
MESSAGE_TYPE_ID numeric(3, 0) YES The selected message type.
FORM_ID numeric(7, 0) YES The report form that is associated with this key combination.
PRIORITY numeric(3, 0) YES The default relative priority level to be assigned to a report created for this form type.
SEVERITY numeric(3, 0) YES The default relative severity level to be assigned to a report created for this form type.
DEACTIVATION_DATE datetime YES The date that an item is removed from display within the system (ie. logical delete).

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XAK1FORM_SELECTION Index INCIDENT_TYPE_ID,INCIDENT_SUBTYPE_ID,MESSAGE_TYPE_ID
XPKFORM_SELECTION PrimaryKey FORM_SELECTION_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
INCIDENT_REPORT_FORM FORM_SELECTION Non-Identifying FORM_ID
INCIDENT_SUBTYPE FORM_SELECTION Non-Identifying INCIDENT_SUBTYPE_ID
INCIDENT_TYPE FORM_SELECTION Non-Identifying INCIDENT_TYPE_ID
MESSAGE_TYPE FORM_SELECTION Non-Identifying MESSAGE_TYPE_ID
FORM_SELECTION INCIDENT Non-Identifying INCIDENT_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

GEO_INTERVAL_TOD_XREF
Definition Average speed declarations for each segment based on the time of day.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE GEO_INTERVAL_TOD_XREF(
     INTERVAL_ID          numeric(5, 0)      NOT NULL,
     TIME_OF_DAY_ID       numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     RUNNING_TIME         numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     AVERAGE_SPEED        numeric(9, 4)      NULL,
     UPDATE_TIMESTAMP     datetime           NULL,
     SOURCE_IND           varchar(1)         NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKGEO_INTERVAL_TOD_XREF PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (INTERVAL_ID,TIME_OF_DAY_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKGEO_NODE_I_GEO_INTRV_TOD_X FOREIGN KEY (INTERVAL_ID)
     REFERENCES GEO_NODE_INTERVAL(INTERVAL_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTOD_GEO_INTRVL_TOD_X FOREIGN KEY (TIME_OF_DAY_ID)
     REFERENCES TIME_OF_DAY(TIME_OF_DAY_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
INTERVAL_ID numeric(5, 0) NO Identifies a unique path between two time points.
TIME_OF_DAY_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
RUNNING_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES The time (number of seconds) required to travel this segment.
AVERAGE_SPEED numeric(9, 4) YES The average speed that a vehicle can reasonably be expected to travel this segment based on posted speed limit and traffic conditions.
UPDATE_TIMESTAMP datetime YES
SOURCE_IND varchar(1) YES Identifies the source of the running time and average speed values.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKGEO_INTERVAL_TOD_XREF PrimaryKey INTERVAL_ID,TIME_OF_DAY_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
GEO_NODE_INTERVAL GEO_INTERVAL_TOD_XREF Identifying INTERVAL_ID
TIME_OF_DAY GEO_INTERVAL_TOD_XREF Identifying TIME_OF_DAY_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

GEO_NODE
Definition Each entry defines a point at which time is measured to create trips.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE GEO_NODE(
     GEO_NODE_ID                  numeric(10, 0)     NOT NULL,
     DEPARTURE_ZONE_ID            numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     ARRIVAL_ZONE_ID              numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     INTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID     numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     GEO_NODE_ABBR                varchar(8)         NULL,
     GEO_NODE_NAME                varchar(100)       NOT NULL,
     INTERFACE_ALIAS              varchar(20)        NULL,
     TRANSIT_DIV_ID               numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 1 NOT NULL,
     LATITUDE                     numeric(12, 0)     NULL,
     LONGITUDE                    numeric(12, 0)     NULL,
     ALTITUDE                     numeric(7, 0)      NULL,
     TRANSFER_POINT_IND           varchar(1)         NULL,
     DETOUR_IND                   varchar(1)         NULL,
     DETOUR_LATITUDE              numeric(12, 0)     NULL,
     DETOUR_LONGITIUDE            numeric(12, 0)     NULL,
     REMARK                       varchar(2000)      NULL,
     DIFFERENTIAL_VALIDITY        varchar(1)         NULL,
     NUM_OF_SATELLITES            numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     ACTIVATION_DATE              datetime           NULL,
     DEACTIVATION_DATE            datetime           NULL,
     MAP_LATITUDE                 numeric(12, 0)     NULL,
     MAP_LONGITUDE                numeric(12, 0)     NULL,
     NUM_SURVEY_POINTS            numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     ANNOUNCEMENT_ZONE_ID         numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKGEO_NODE PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (GEO_NODE_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKADH_ZONE_GEO_NODE1 FOREIGN KEY (ARRIVAL_ZONE_ID)
     REFERENCES ADHERENCE_ZONE(ZONE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKADH_ZONE_GEO_NODE2 FOREIGN KEY (DEPARTURE_ZONE_ID)
     REFERENCES ADHERENCE_ZONE(ZONE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKANNOUNCEMENT_GEO_NODE FOREIGN KEY (INTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID)
     REFERENCES ANNOUNCEMENT(ANNOUNCE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKANNOUNCEMENTZ_GEO_NODE FOREIGN KEY (ANNOUNCEMENT_ZONE_ID)
     REFERENCES ANNOUNCEMENT_ZONE(ANNOUNCEMENT_ZONE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTRANSIT_DIV_GEO_NODE FOREIGN KEY (TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
     REFERENCES TRANSIT_DIVISION(TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
GEO_NODE_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
DEPARTURE_ZONE_ID numeric(3, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ARRIVAL_ZONE_ID numeric(3, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
INTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
GEO_NODE_ABBR varchar(8) YES An alpha-numeric identifier of a location at which time is measured.
GEO_NODE_NAME varchar(100) NO The common, or public name for a geographic location on a route.
INTERFACE_ALIAS varchar(20) YES An alternate identification for a node. This will be used to correlate a node with one in another scheduling system, such as Trapeze.
TRANSIT_DIV_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
LATITUDE numeric(12, 0) YES Location identification.
LONGITUDE numeric(12, 0) YES Location identification.
ALTITUDE numeric(7, 0) YES Location identification.
TRANSFER_POINT_IND varchar(1) YES Identifies a geographical location as a transfer point, or not.
DETOUR_IND varchar(1) YES Indicates if this node should be included in a detour pattern. For example, this node may be temporarily inaccessible due to road construction.
DETOUR_LATITUDE numeric(12, 0) YES The temporary latitude for a node that is moved due to a detour.
DETOUR_LONGITIUDE numeric(12, 0) YES The temporary longitude for a node that is moved due to a detour.
REMARK varchar(2000) YES Free-form text area to store a comment regarding a node.
DIFFERENTIAL_VALIDITY varchar(1) YES Value of 0, 1, or 2.
NUM_OF_SATELLITES numeric(3, 0) YES Number of satellites used to survey this point.
ACTIVATION_DATE datetime YES The date a node is activated.
DEACTIVATION_DATE datetime YES The date a node is deactivated (logical delete). The row can be physically deleted only if it is not referenced by other related tables.
MAP_LATITUDE numeric(12, 0) YES The latitude of this node on the map in Route Generator.
MAP_LONGITUDE numeric(12, 0) YES The longitude of this node on the map in Route Generator.
NUM_SURVEY_POINTS numeric(3, 0) YES The number of DGPS positions collected for point surveying, usually a number between 1 and 20.
ANNOUNCEMENT_ZONE_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The announcement zone time/distance settings for this location.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKGEO_NODE PrimaryKey GEO_NODE_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
ADHERENCE_ZONE GEO_NODE Non-Identifying ARRIVAL_ZONE_ID
ADHERENCE_ZONE GEO_NODE Non-Identifying DEPARTURE_ZONE_ID
ANNOUNCEMENT GEO_NODE Non-Identifying INTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID
ANNOUNCEMENT_ZONE GEO_NODE Non-Identifying ANNOUNCEMENT_ZONE_ID
TRANSIT_DIVISION GEO_NODE Non-Identifying TRANSIT_DIV_ID
GEO_NODE GEO_NODE_INTERVAL Non-Identifying INTERVAL_ID
GEO_NODE GEO_NODE_INTERVAL Non-Identifying INTERVAL_ID
GEO_NODE GEO_NODE_OVERRIDE Identifying GEO_NODE_ID
GEO_NODE GEO_NODE_OVERRIDE Non-Identifying GEO_NODE_ID
GEO_NODE GEO_NODE_SET Non-Identifying GEO_NODE_SET_ID
GEO_NODE GEO_NODE_TIME_PT_XREF Identifying GEO_NODE_ID
GEO_NODE GEO_NODE_TYPE_XREF Identifying GEO_NODE_ID
GEO_NODE MDT_FILE Non-Identifying BLOCK_ID
GEO_NODE MDT_NODE Non-Identifying NODE_OFFSET_ID
GEO_NODE MDT_TRANSFER Non-Identifying TRANSFER_OFFSET_ID
GEO_NODE RTE_GEO_NODE_XREF Identifying ROUTE_ID
GEO_NODE PATTERN_GEO_NODE_XREF Identifying PATTERN_ID
GEO_NODE STOP_FEATURE_XREF Identifying GEO_NODE_ID
GEO_NODE TIME_POINT_CROSSING Non-Identifying DAILY_TRIP_ID
GEO_NODE ROUTE_DEVIATION Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
GEO_NODE SCHEDULE_DEVIATION Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

GEO_NODE_INTERVAL
Definition Each entry defines a segment between two time points.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE GEO_NODE_INTERVAL(
     INTERVAL_ID                   numeric(5, 0)      NOT NULL,
     EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID      numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     INTERVAL_DESIGNATOR           varchar(20)        NULL,
     START_POINT_ID                numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     END_POINT_ID                  numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_CLASS                   varchar(20)        NULL,
     TRANSIT_DIV_ID                numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 1 NOT NULL,
     DISTANCE_BETWEEN_MAP          numeric(7, 2)      NULL,
     DISTANCE_BETWEEN_MEASURED     numeric(7, 2)      NULL,
     COMPASS_DIRECTION             numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     DISTANCE_SOURCE_FLAG          numeric(1, 0)      NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKGEO_NODE_INTERVAL PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (INTERVAL_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKANNOUNCEMENT_GN_INTRVL FOREIGN KEY (EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID)
     REFERENCES ANNOUNCEMENT(ANNOUNCE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKGEO_NODE_GEO_NODE_INTERV1 FOREIGN KEY (END_POINT_ID)
     REFERENCES GEO_NODE(GEO_NODE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKGEO_NODE_GEO_NODE_INTERV2 FOREIGN KEY (START_POINT_ID)
     REFERENCES GEO_NODE(GEO_NODE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTRANSIT_DIV_GN_INTRVL FOREIGN KEY (TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
     REFERENCES TRANSIT_DIVISION(TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
INTERVAL_ID numeric(5, 0) NO Identifies a unique path between two time points.
EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
INTERVAL_DESIGNATOR varchar(20) YES An alpha-numeric identifier of the interval (link) between two time points.
START_POINT_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
END_POINT_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ROUTE_CLASS varchar(20) YES A class of messages that assigns a location reference to route features.
TRANSIT_DIV_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
DISTANCE_BETWEEN_MAP numeric(7, 2) YES The distance between the two points, as determined using a map.
DISTANCE_BETWEEN_MEASURED numeric(7, 2) YES The distance between the two points, as determined using measurement equipment.
COMPASS_DIRECTION numeric(3, 0) YES The compass direction the bus is traveling through the segment.
DISTANCE_SOURCE_FLAG numeric(1, 0) YES

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKGEO_NODE_INTERVAL PrimaryKey INTERVAL_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
ANNOUNCEMENT GEO_NODE_INTERVAL Non-Identifying EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID
GEO_NODE GEO_NODE_INTERVAL Non-Identifying END_POINT_ID
GEO_NODE GEO_NODE_INTERVAL Non-Identifying START_POINT_ID
TRANSIT_DIVISION GEO_NODE_INTERVAL Non-Identifying TRANSIT_DIV_ID
GEO_NODE_INTERVAL GEO_INTERVAL_TOD_XREF Identifying INTERVAL_ID
GEO_NODE_INTERVAL SHAPE_POINT Identifying INTERVAL_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

GEO_NODE_OVERRIDE
Definition A record of detoured geo nodes. A detoured geo node is assumed to be detoured for all routes. If this is not true, then a new geo node must be established for the non-detoured route.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE GEO_NODE_OVERRIDE(
     GEO_NODE_ID              numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     ACTIVATION_DATE          datetime           NOT NULL,
     OVERRIDE_GEO_NODE_ID     numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     DEACTIVATION_DATE        datetime           NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKGEO_NODE_OVERRIDE PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (GEO_NODE_ID,ACTIVATION_DATE)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKGEO_NODE_GEO_NODE_OVER1 FOREIGN KEY (GEO_NODE_ID)
     REFERENCES GEO_NODE(GEO_NODE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKGEO_NODE_GEO_NODE_OVER2 FOREIGN KEY (OVERRIDE_GEO_NODE_ID)
     REFERENCES GEO_NODE(GEO_NODE_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
GEO_NODE_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ACTIVATION_DATE datetime NO The operational date for which this override should occur. No time portion.
OVERRIDE_GEO_NODE_ID numeric(10, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
DEACTIVATION_DATE datetime YES The last day that this override is scheduled. No time portion.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKGEO_NODE_OVERRIDE PrimaryKey GEO_NODE_ID,ACTIVATION_DATE

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
GEO_NODE GEO_NODE_OVERRIDE Identifying GEO_NODE_ID
GEO_NODE GEO_NODE_OVERRIDE Non-Identifying OVERRIDE_GEO_NODE_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

GEO_NODE_SET
Definition A logical progression of a set of geographical nodes. This can be used as a \"scratch pad\" listing for developing routes.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE GEO_NODE_SET(
     GEO_NODE_SET_ID     numeric(5, 0)      NOT NULL,
     SET_SEQUENCE        numeric(7, 0)      NOT NULL,
     GEO_NODE_ID         numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKGEO_NODE_SET PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (GEO_NODE_SET_ID,SET_SEQUENCE)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKGEO_NODE_GEO_NODE_SET FOREIGN KEY (GEO_NODE_ID)
     REFERENCES GEO_NODE(GEO_NODE_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
GEO_NODE_SET_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The unique, system-assigned identifier for a set of geographical locations.
SET_SEQUENCE numeric(7, 0) NO The order of the geographical locations within the set.
GEO_NODE_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKGEO_NODE_SET PrimaryKey GEO_NODE_SET_ID,SET_SEQUENCE

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

GEO_NODE_TIME_PT_XREF
Definition An association between a physical geographical node and a logical time point. This association can change if a pattern is changed.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE GEO_NODE_TIME_PT_XREF(
     GEO_NODE_ID       numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     TIME_POINT_ID     numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKGEO_NODE_TIME_PT_XREF PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (GEO_NODE_ID,TIME_POINT_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKGEO_NODE_GEO_NODE_TPX FOREIGN KEY (GEO_NODE_ID)
     REFERENCES GEO_NODE(GEO_NODE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTIME_PT_GEO_NODE_TIME_PT_X FOREIGN KEY (TIME_POINT_ID)
     REFERENCES TIME_POINT(TIME_POINT_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition

GEO_NODE_TYPE
Definition The types of geographical locations on a transit route.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE GEO_NODE_TYPE(
     GEO_NODE_TYPE_CODE     varchar(8)       NOT NULL,
     GEO_NODE_TYPE_TEXT     varchar(100)     NOT NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKGEO_NODE_TYPE PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (GEO_NODE_TYPE_CODE)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
GEO_NODE_TYPE_CODE varchar(8) NO Unique, alphanumeric code to identify each type of geo node.

GEO_NODE_TYPE_TEXT varchar(100) NO Text description for a geo node type that is seen by the user.

Ex. Time Point, Stop, Annunciation Point, Speed Change, Shape Point

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKGEO_NODE_TYPE PrimaryKey GEO_NODE_TYPE_CODE

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
GEO_NODE_TYPE GEO_NODE_TYPE_XREF Identifying GEO_NODE_ID

FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

GEO_NODE_TYPE_XREF
Definition Each node is categorized by one or more types to delineate the node's usage within the system.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE GEO_NODE_TYPE_XREF(
     GEO_NODE_ID            numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     GEO_NODE_TYPE_CODE     varchar(8)         NOT NULL,

     REFERENCES GEO_NODE(GEO_NODE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKGEO_NODE_TYP_GEO_NODE_TYP_X FOREIGN KEY (GEO_NODE_TYPE_CODE)
     REFERENCES GEO_NODE_TYPE(GEO_NODE_TYPE_CODE)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

GEO_REGION
Definition Rectangular sections defined by 4 latitude/longitude designations.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE GEO_REGION(
     GEO_REGION_ID         numeric(5, 0)      NOT NULL,
     GEO_REGION_TEXT       varchar(100)       NULL,
     DISPLAY_ORDER         numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     DEACTIVATION_DATE     datetime           NULL,
     LATITUDE_UL           numeric(12, 0)     NULL,
     LONGITUDE_UL          numeric(12, 0)     NULL,
     LATITUDE_LR           numeric(12, 0)     NULL,
     LONGITUDE_LR          numeric(12, 0)     NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKGEO_REGION PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (GEO_REGION_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
GEO_REGION_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
GEO_REGION_TEXT varchar(100) YES The text that is displayed to the user.
DISPLAY_ORDER numeric(3, 0) YES Override the display order of this item for a list.
DEACTIVATION_DATE datetime YES The date that an item is removed from display within the system (ie. logical delete).
LATITUDE_UL numeric(12, 0) YES Latitude - upper left-hand corner of the rectangle.
LONGITUDE_UL numeric(12, 0) YES Longitude - upper left-hand corner of the rectangle.
LATITUDE_LR numeric(12, 0) YES Latitude - lower right-hand corner of the rectangle.
LONGITUDE_LR numeric(12, 0) YES Longitude - lower right-hand corner of the rectangle.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKGEO_REGION PrimaryKey GEO_REGION_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
GEO_REGION WA_ROLE_GEO_REGION_XREF Identifying CONFIGURATION_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

INCIDENT
Definition Data pertaining to an incident that has occurred during a run.
Note Source: GEN1 database
DDL Code CREATE TABLE INCIDENT(
     INCIDENT_ID               numeric(10, 0)     NOT NULL,
     FORM_SELECTION_ID         numeric(5, 0)      NOT NULL,
     LOG_DATE_TIME             datetime           NULL,
     DISPATCHER_ID             numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     DISPATCHER_NAME           varchar(65)        NULL,
     INCIDENT_STATUS           smallint           NULL,
     OPERATOR_ID               numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     VEHICLE_ID                numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     FLEET_ID                  numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     VEHICLE_BASE_ID           numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     PASSENGER_COUNT           numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     SPECIAL_ROUTE             numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     ROUTE_ID                  numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     BLOCK_NUM                 numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     LOCATION                  varchar(60)        NULL,
     PRIORITY                  numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     SEVERITY                  numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     ADHERENCE                 numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     DIRECTION                 varchar(100)       NULL,
     MECHANICAL_ALARMS         varbinary(10)      NULL,
     REQUESTED_911_FLAG        numeric(1, 0)      NULL,
     RESPONDER_911             varchar(60)        NULL,
     INJURIES                  smallint           NULL,
     DAMAGE                    smallint           NULL,
     MAINTENANCE_SENT_FLAG     numeric(1, 0)      NULL,
     TIME_CONTACT              datetime           NULL,
     TIME_CANCELLED            datetime           NULL,
     TIME_CALLED               datetime           NULL,
     TIME_RTT                  datetime           NULL,
     TIME_ACKNOWLEDGED         datetime           NULL,
     REPL_VEHICLE_ID           numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     REPL_OPERATOR_ID          numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     OTHER_LOCATION            varchar(60)        NULL,
     NON_REVENUE_MILES         numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     TIME_DOWN                 datetime           NULL,
     TIME_RESUMED              datetime           NULL,
     TIME_LOST                 numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     MILES_LOST                numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     TEMPERATURE               numeric(5, 2)      NULL,
     PRECIPITATION_TYPE        varchar(30)        NULL,
     VISIBILITY                numeric(7, 0)      NULL,
     COMMENTS                  text               NULL,
     CHANGE_HISTORY            text               NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKINCIDENT PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (INCIDENT_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKDISPATCHER_INCIDENT FOREIGN KEY (DISPATCHER_ID)
     REFERENCES DISPATCHER(DISPATCHER_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKFLEET_INCIDENT FOREIGN KEY (FLEET_ID)
     REFERENCES FLEET(FLEET_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKFORM_SEL_INCIDENT FOREIGN KEY (FORM_SELECTION_ID)
     REFERENCES FORM_SELECTION(FORM_SELECTION_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKOPERATOR_INCIDENT FOREIGN KEY (OPERATOR_ID)
     REFERENCES OPERATOR(OPERATOR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKOPERATOR_INCIDENT2 FOREIGN KEY (REPL_OPERATOR_ID)
     REFERENCES OPERATOR(OPERATOR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKROUTE_INCIDENT FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE(ROUTE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKVEH_BASE_INCIDENT FOREIGN KEY (VEHICLE_BASE_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE_BASE(VEHICLE_BASE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKVEHICLE_INCIDENT FOREIGN KEY (VEHICLE_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE(VEHICLE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKVEHICLE_INCIDENT2 FOREIGN KEY (REPL_VEHICLE_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE(VEHICLE_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
INCIDENT_ID numeric(10, 0) NO Unique, system-assigned identifier for each incident report record.
FORM_SELECTION_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The report form selected for this report. Identifies the relevant columns for formatting the report.
LOG_DATE_TIME datetime YES The date and time that the incident is being recorded.
DISPATCHER_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The dispatcher currently assigned to this incident report.
DISPATCHER_NAME varchar(65) YES The current NT workstation user login identifier.
INCIDENT_STATUS smallint YES The status of the incident report.

0 - Open
1 - Closed

Examples from the TCIP standard are:

1 - Reported, not verified
2 - Verified, no response applied
3 - Verified, response en route
4 - Verified, response on scene
5 - Being responded to
6 - Cleared
OPERATOR_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The operator involved in the incident.
VEHICLE_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The vehicle involved in the incident.
FLEET_ID numeric(5, 0) YES FK stores a primary key of the FLEET table for the vehicle associated with the incident.
VEHICLE_BASE_ID numeric(3, 0) YES FK stores a primary key of the VEHICLE_BASE table for the vehicle associated with the incident.
PASSENGER_COUNT numeric(3, 0) YES Passenger count at the time of the incident.
SPECIAL_ROUTE numeric(3, 0) YES The system defined identifier when there is no route identifier available that is related to a primary key of the ROUTE table (i.e. Paratransit, Supervisor, etc).
ROUTE_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The route being traveled when the incident occurred.
BLOCK_NUM numeric(10, 0) YES The block associated with the incident report.
LOCATION varchar(60) YES This is the location where the incident occurred. This is a text field and is expressed in terms of distance past a timepoint.
PRIORITY numeric(3, 0) YES The relative priority level assigned to this record.
SEVERITY numeric(3, 0) YES The relative severity level assigned to this record.
ADHERENCE numeric(5, 0) YES See Dayton RFP, 32.6.3.0-1. This is the +2 minutes type value.
DIRECTION varchar(100) YES A freeform text area for the dispatcher to enter a remark about the direction the vehicle was traveling.
MECHANICAL_ALARMS varbinary(10) YES The mechanical alarms in effect on the vehicle at the time of the incident.
REQUESTED_911_FLAG numeric(1, 0) YES Flag indicating whether a 911 agency was requested for the incident.

0 - no
1 - yes
RESPONDER_911 varchar(60) YES Text description of the 911 agency that responded to the 911 request.
INJURIES smallint YES Numerical value representing the type of injuries reported in the incident.
DAMAGE smallint YES Numerical value representing the type of damage reported in the incident.
MAINTENANCE_SENT_FLAG numeric(1, 0) YES
TIME_CONTACT datetime YES The date and time of the 911 agency contact.
TIME_CANCELLED datetime YES The time of cancellation for an emergency alarm incident report.
TIME_CALLED datetime YES The date and time at which the 911 agency was called.
TIME_RTT datetime YES The date and time at which the Request-To-Talk was initiated.
TIME_ACKNOWLEDGED datetime YES The date and time at which the Request-To-Talk was acknowledged.
REPL_VEHICLE_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The change-out replacement vehicle.
REPL_OPERATOR_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The change-out replacement driver.
OTHER_LOCATION varchar(60) YES The text representation of a secondary location attributed to the incident.
NON_REVENUE_MILES numeric(5, 0) YES The miles traveled that are attributed to the change-out incident.
TIME_DOWN datetime YES The date and time at which the vehicle involved in the incident ceased operation.
TIME_RESUMED datetime YES The date and time at which the vehicle resumed operation.
TIME_LOST numeric(5, 0) YES Amount of time (minutes) the vehicle involved was unavailable.
MILES_LOST numeric(5, 0) YES The miles lost due to the incident.
TEMPERATURE numeric(5, 2) YES The ambient air temperature (Fahrenheit or Celsius).
PRECIPITATION_TYPE varchar(30) YES A description of the type of precipitation
defined by the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA).
VISIBILITY numeric(7, 0) YES The amount of linear atmospheric visibility (feet or meters).
COMMENTS text YES A free form text field to enter details about the incident.
CHANGE_HISTORY text YES

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKINCIDENT PrimaryKey INCIDENT_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
DISPATCHER INCIDENT Non-Identifying DISPATCHER_ID
FLEET INCIDENT Non-Identifying FLEET_ID
INCIDENT_FORM_CONFIG INCIDENT Non-Identifying FORM_SELECTION_ID
OPERATOR INCIDENT Non-Identifying OPERATOR_ID
OPERATOR INCIDENT Non-Identifying REPL_OPERATOR_ID
ROUTE INCIDENT Non-Identifying ROUTE_ID
VEHICLE_BASE INCIDENT Non-Identifying VEHICLE_BASE_ID
VEHICLE INCIDENT Non-Identifying VEHICLE_ID
VEHICLE INCIDENT Non-Identifying REPL_VEHICLE_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

Note

     CONSTRAINT XPKINCIDENT_REPORT_FORM PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (FORM_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

0 - Generic
1 - Weather
2 - Generic Vehicle
3 - Accident/Injury
4 - Change Out
5 - Coach Dispute
6 - Emergency Alarm
7 - Mechanical Alarm

1 Accident
2 Agency's own public transit vehicle
3 Assault on driver

INCIDENT_TYPE
Definition Inventory of incident types, one of which is attached to each incident report.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE INCIDENT_TYPE(
     INCIDENT_TYPE_ID       numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     INCIDENT_TYPE_TEXT     varchar(100)      NOT NULL,
     DISPLAY_ORDER          numeric(3, 0)     NULL,
     DEACTIVATION_DATE      datetime          NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKINCIDENT_TYPE PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (INCIDENT_TYPE_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
INCIDENT_TYPE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
INCIDENT_TYPE_TEXT varchar(100) NO The text description for a type of incident. Examples from the TCIP standard are:

1 Accident
2 Construction
3 Crime
4 Disturbance
5 Equipment problem
6 Fatality
7 Fire
8 Heavy traffic volume
9 Injury
10 Medical emergency
11 Observed incident (does not involve a PTV)
12 Passenger Volume
13 Relief
14 Service delay
15 Silent alarm
16 Street blockage
17 Traffic signal failure
18 Transit vehicle in water
DISPLAY_ORDER numeric(3, 0) YES Override the display order of this item for a list.
DEACTIVATION_DATE datetime YES The date that an item is removed from display within the system (ie. logical delete).
