FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

KEY_CONTROL
Definition This table keeps track of primary key assignments. This is used as a database \"independent\" solution instead of an \"identity\" column (SQL Server) or a sequence object (Oracle).
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE KEY_CONTROL(
     TABLE_NAME           varchar(30)        NOT NULL,
     LAST_KEY_USED        numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     UPDATE_TIMESTAMP     datetime           NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKKEY_CONTROL PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (TABLE_NAME)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
TABLE_NAME varchar(30) NO The name of the table that the key pertains to.
LAST_KEY_USED numeric(10, 0) YES The last key used for this table.
UPDATE_TIMESTAMP datetime YES

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKKEY_CONTROL PrimaryKey TABLE_NAME

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

LOGGED_MESSAGE
Definition Messages communicated between the vehicle MDT, operator, dispatch, garage, etc.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE LOGGED_MESSAGE(
     TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID     int              NOT NULL,
     CALENDAR_ID                int              DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     MESSAGE_TYPE_ID            smallint         DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     LATITUDE                   int              NULL,
     LONGITUDE                  int              NULL,
     ADHERENCE                  smallint         NULL,
     ODOMETER                   smallint         NULL,
     VALIDITY                   smallint         NULL,
     SOURCE_CLASS               varchar(1)       NULL,
     SOURCE_HOST                smallint         NULL,
     DESTINATION_CLASS          varchar(1)       NULL,
     DESTINATION_HOST           smallint         NULL,
     ROUTE_VERSION              int              NULL,
     MESSAGES_VERSION           int              NULL,
     ROUTE_OFFSET               smallint         NULL,
     DIRECTION                  smallint         NULL,
     TIME_POINT_OFFSET          smallint         NULL,
     STOP_OFFSET                smallint         NULL,
     CLOCK_TIME                 int              NULL,
     QUANTITY                   smallint         NULL,
     FLAG32                     int              NULL,
     EFFECTIVE_SERVICE          smallint         NULL,
     MINUTE_OFFSET              smallint         NULL,
     LOGON_BLOCK                int              NULL,
     MDT_TIMESTAMP              int              NULL,
     MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP          datetime         NULL,
     PASSENGER_COUNT_ON         smallint         NULL,
     PASSENGER_COUNT_OFF        smallint         NULL,
     ST_MDT_VERSION             smallint         NULL,
     TOD_YEAR                   smallint         NULL,
     TOD_MONTH                  smallint         NULL,
     TOD_DAY                    smallint         NULL,
     CANNED_MSG_CODE            smallint         NULL,
     SYSPARAM_FLAG              int              NULL,
     TR_REQUEST_ID              smallint         NULL,
     VOICE_MSG_ID               smallint         NULL,
     MSG_CALL_TYPE              smallint         NULL,
     CHANNEL                    smallint         NULL,
     AUDIO_PATH                 smallint         NULL,
     MSG_GROUP                  int              NULL,
     ACCEPTED                   smallint         NULL,
     LV_SEQUENCE                smallint         NULL,
     TYPE_ACKNOWLEDGING         smallint         NULL,
     ROUTE_BLOCK                int              NULL,
     CAT_1                      smallint         NULL,
     CAT_2                      smallint         NULL,
     CAT_3                      smallint         NULL,
     CAT_4                      smallint         NULL,
     CAT_5                      smallint         NULL,
     CAT_6                      smallint         NULL,
     CAT_7                      smallint         NULL,
     CAT_8                      smallint         NULL,
     CAT_9                      smallint         NULL,
     CAT_10                     smallint         NULL,
     LOWER32                    int              NULL,
     UPPER32                    int              NULL,
     CURRENT_MDT                smallint         NULL,
     CURRENT_DRIVER             int              NULL,
     FREE_TEXT_MSG              varchar(255)     NULL,
     LOCAL_TIMESTAMP            datetime         NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKLOGGED_MESSAGE PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID)
     ON DAILYLOG_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKMSG_TYPE_TRANSMIT_MSG FOREIGN KEY (MESSAGE_TYPE_ID)
     REFERENCES MESSAGE_TYPE(MESSAGE_TYPE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/475] FOREIGN KEY (CALENDAR_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_CALENDAR(CALENDAR_ID)
) ON DAILYLOG_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID int NO The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
CALENDAR_ID int YES Service day.
MESSAGE_TYPE_ID smallint NO The message type associated with this message.
LATITUDE int YES The MDT will cast the PLGR latitude and longitude to a long integer and multiply the values by 10,000,000. i.e. Latitude = ( long ) ( ( lat ) * 10,000,000 ). Dispatch will divide the latitude and longitude received by 10,000,000 for use by the DDS map engine software.

This is not an updated vehicle position.

If the latitude and longitude are invalid, the latitude will be set to 100 and the longitude will contain the odometer value.
LONGITUDE int YES
ADHERENCE smallint YES
ODOMETER smallint YES An unsigned integer that is multiplied by 100 at the MDT. Mileage is in hundredths of miles. It is set to zero on MDT startup or reboot, so the count restarts each day. Unit of measure is .01 miles.
VALIDITY smallint YES The message validity. 5 flags collapsed into 1 column.

1st digit - position flag ( 1 = valid, 0 = not valid )
2nd digit - schedule adherence flag ( 1 = valid, 0 = not valid )
3rd digit - odometer flag ( 1 = valid, 0 = not valid )
4th digit - differential mode flag ( 1 = on, 0 = off )
5th digit - figure of merit flag (values are 1 through 9 )
SOURCE_CLASS varchar(1) YES The source of the message to specify timeliness. Ex. RF link vs. from on-board system storage.
SOURCE_HOST smallint YES If source class = V, then this (host) is the vehicle (MDT ID). This corresponds to the RNET_ADDRESS column in the VEHICLE table.
DESTINATION_CLASS varchar(1) YES
DESTINATION_HOST smallint YES If destination class = V, then this (host) is the vehicle (MDT ID).
ROUTE_VERSION int YES Version number of the route database. Source: MDT Started message - inbound.
MESSAGES_VERSION int YES Version number of the messages database. Source: MDT Started message - inbound.
ROUTE_OFFSET smallint YES Route the vehicle logged into.

Used by: MT_TRANSFERREQUEST
DIRECTION smallint YES Direction the vehicle is traveling.

Used by: MT_TRANSFERREQUEST
TIME_POINT_OFFSET smallint YES This is the index into the timepoint description file.

Used by: MT_TRANSFERREQUEST
STOP_OFFSET smallint YES This is the index into a block (.mdt) file.

Source: MT_TRANSFERHOLD and MT_TIMEPOINTCROSSING message

CLOCK_TIME int YES Current time from the Dispatch PC clock. Source: Dispatch Initialize Vehicle Settings - outbound.

Used by: MT_TRANSFERREQUEST
MT_INITVEHICLE
QUANTITY smallint YES Used by: MT_TRANSFERREQUEST
FLAG32 int YES Source: MT_MECHANICAL, MT_ENABLEMECHANICAL and MT_DRIVERVIOLATION message
EFFECTIVE_SERVICE smallint YES Used by:
MT_LOGONVERIFICATION
MTR_BLOCKSCHEDULE
MT_INITVEHICLE

Also:

Stores FIA_VERSION for the MT_MDTSTARTED message.
MINUTE_OFFSET smallint YES Used by: MT_LOGONVERIFICATION and MT_TIMEPOINTOFFSET message
LOGON_BLOCK int YES Used by: MT_LOGONVERIFICATION and MT_IMPROPER_LOGON message
MDT_TIMESTAMP int YES The message date and time as recorded by the MDT.
MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP datetime YES The UTC timestamp that the message was recorded by TMLogger (not necessarily the date and time that the record was added to the database).
PASSENGER_COUNT_ON smallint YES Populated by MDT Passenger Count message.
PASSENGER_COUNT_OFF smallint YES Populated by MDT Passenger Count message.
ST_MDT_VERSION smallint YES Version number of the MDT software. Source: MDT Started message - inbound.
TOD_YEAR smallint YES Source: MT_DGPSTIMEOFDAY message
TOD_MONTH smallint YES Source: MT_DGPSTIMEOFDAY message
TOD_DAY smallint YES
CANNED_MSG_CODE smallint YES Source: MT_MDTCANNEDMSG message
SYSPARAM_FLAG int YES Source: MT_SYSTEMPARAMS message
TR_REQUEST_ID smallint YES Source: MT_TRANSFERREQUEST and MT_TRANSFERACCEPTANCE message
VOICE_MSG_ID smallint YES Used by: MT_STVC, MT_ACK_VOICE, and MT_LIFTEDHANDSET, and MT_INDCALLCOMPLETE message
MSG_CALL_TYPE smallint YES Used by: MT_STVC message
CHANNEL smallint YES Used by: MT_STVC and MT_CALLVEHICLETOVEHICLE message
AUDIO_PATH smallint YES Used by: MT_STVC message
MSG_GROUP int YES Used by: MT_STVC message
ACCEPTED smallint YES Used by: MT_LOGONVERIFICATION message
LV_SEQUENCE smallint YES Used by: MT_LOGONVERIFICATION message
TYPE_ACKNOWLEDGING smallint YES Used by: MT_ALARMACKNOWLEDGED message
ROUTE_BLOCK int YES Used by: MTR_BLOCKSCHEDULE message
CAT_1 smallint YES Used by: MT_PASSENGERCOUNT and MT_PARA_FARECOUNT
CAT_2 smallint YES Used by: MT_PASSENGERCOUNT and MT_PARA_FARECOUNT
CAT_3 smallint YES Used by: MT_PASSENGERCOUNT and MT_PARA_FARECOUNT
CAT_4 smallint YES Used by: MT_PASSENGERCOUNT and MT_PARA_FARECOUNT
CAT_5 smallint YES Used by: MT_PASSENGERCOUNT and MT_PARA_FARECOUNT
CAT_6 smallint YES Used by: MT_PASSENGERCOUNT and MT_PARA_FARECOUNT
CAT_7 smallint YES Used by: MT_PASSENGERCOUNT and MT_PARA_FARECOUNT
CAT_8 smallint YES Used by: MT_PASSENGERCOUNT and MT_PARA_FARECOUNT
CAT_9 smallint YES Used by: MT_PASSENGERCOUNT and MT_PARA_FARECOUNT
CAT_10 smallint YES Used by: MT_PASSENGERCOUNT and MT_PARA_FARECOUNT
LOWER32 int YES Used by: MT_ENGINE_CONTROL_INFO message

Also:

Stores DENIAL_FLAGS for the MT_LOGONVERIFICATION message.
UPPER32 int YES Used by: MT_ENGINE_CONTROL_INFO message
CURRENT_MDT smallint YES Used by: MT_IMPROPER_LOGON message
CURRENT_DRIVER int YES Used by: MT_IMPROPER_LOGON message
FREE_TEXT_MSG varchar(255) YES Used by: MT_DISPATCHFREETEXT and MT_DGPSCORRECTION message
LOCAL_TIMESTAMP datetime YES The local date and time that the message is recorded by the system.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKLOGGED_MESSAGE PrimaryKey TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
MESSAGE_TYPE LOGGED_MESSAGE Non-Identifying MESSAGE_TYPE_ID
SERVICE_CALENDAR LOGGED_MESSAGE Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
LOGGED_MESSAGE DAILY_MESSAGE_TEXT Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
LOGGED_MESSAGE MDT_SOFTWARE_VERSION_RPT Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
LOGGED_MESSAGE ROUTE_DEVIATION Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
LOGGED_MESSAGE PASSENGER_COUNT Non-Identifying PASSENGER_COUNT_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP DAILYLOG_DATA

LOGGED_MESSAGE_PARA
Definition Logged messages for paratransit. Not used for reporting.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE LOGGED_MESSAGE_PARA(
     CALENDAR_ID                  int              NULL,
     MESSAGE_TYPE_ID              smallint         NOT NULL,
     LATITUDE                     int              NULL,
     LONGITUDE                    int              NULL,
     ADHERENCE                    smallint         NULL,
     ODOMETER                     int              NULL,
     VALIDITY                     smallint         NULL,
     MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP            datetime         NULL,
     MDT_TIMESTAMP                int              NULL,
     SOURCE_CLASS                 varchar(1)       NULL,
     SOURCE_HOST                  smallint         NULL,
     DESTINATION_CLASS            varchar(1)       NULL,
     DESTINATION_HOST             smallint         NULL,
     SCHED_DIST                   smallint         NULL,
     CAT_1                        smallint         NULL,
     CAT_2                        smallint         NULL,
     CAT_3                        smallint         NULL,
     CAT_4                        smallint         NULL,
     CAT_5                        smallint         NULL,
     CAT_6                        smallint         NULL,
     CAT_7                        smallint         NULL,
     CAT_8                        smallint         NULL,
     CAT_9                        smallint         NULL,
     CAT_10                       smallint         NULL,
     PARA_EVENT_ID                int              NULL,
     PARA_TRIP_STATUS             smallint         NULL,
     PARA_ACTIVITY                smallint         NULL,
     PARA_LOAD_TIME               int              NULL,
     PARA_SCHEDULED_TIME          int              NULL,
     PARA_ESTIMATED_TIME          int              NULL,
     PARA_FARE_AMOUNT             int              NULL,
     PARA_CLIENT_ID               int              NULL,
     PARA_CLIENT_NAME_SIZE        int              NULL,
     PARA_CLIENT_ADDRESS_SIZE     int              NULL,
     PARA_COMMENT_SIZE            int              NULL,
     PARA_MOBILITY_AID_SIZE       int              NULL,
     PARA_PASSENGER_INFO_SIZE     int              NULL,
     PARA_BLOCK                   int              NULL,
     MDT_MSG_DATE                 int              NULL,
     MDT_MSG_TIME                 int              NULL,
     FREE_TEXT_MSG                varchar(255)     NULL,
     CURRENT_DRIVER               int              NULL
) ON DAILYLOG_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
CALENDAR_ID int YES %AttDef
MESSAGE_TYPE_ID smallint NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
LATITUDE int YES The MDT will cast the PLGR latitude and longitude to a long integer and multiply the values by 10,000,000. i.e. Latitude = ( long ) ( ( lat ) * 10,000,000 ). Dispatch will divide the latitude and longitude received by 10,000,000 for use by the DDS map engine software.

This is not an updated vehicle position.

If the latitude and longitude are invalid, the latitude will be set to 100 and the longitude will contain the odometer value.
LONGITUDE int YES
ADHERENCE smallint YES
ODOMETER int YES An unsigned integer that is multiplied by 100 at the MDT. Mileage is in hundredths of miles. It is set to zero on MDT startup or reboot, so the count restarts each day. Unit of measure is .01 miles.
VALIDITY smallint YES The message validity. 5 flags collapsed into 1 column.

1st digit - position flag ( 1 = valid, 0 = not valid )
2nd digit - schedule adherence flag ( 1 = valid, 0 = not valid )
3rd digit - odometer flag ( 1 = valid, 0 = not valid )
4th digit - differential mode flag ( 1 = on, 0 = off )
5th digit - figure of merit flag (values are 1 through 9 )
MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP datetime YES The date and time this message is recorded in the database.
MDT_TIMESTAMP int YES The message date and time as recorded by the MDT.
SOURCE_CLASS varchar(1) YES The source of the message to specify timeliness. Ex. RF link vs. from on-board system storage.
SOURCE_HOST smallint YES If source class = V, then this (host) is the vehicle (MDT ID).
DESTINATION_CLASS varchar(1) YES
DESTINATION_HOST smallint YES If destination class = V, then this (host) is the vehicle (MDT ID).
SCHED_DIST smallint YES Used by: MT_HEADWAY_PROBLEM message
CAT_1 smallint YES Used by: MT_PASSENGERCOUNT and MT_PARA_FARECOUNT
CAT_2 smallint YES Used by: MT_PASSENGERCOUNT and MT_PARA_FARECOUNT
CAT_3 smallint YES Used by: MT_PASSENGERCOUNT and MT_PARA_FARECOUNT
CAT_4 smallint YES Used by: MT_PASSENGERCOUNT and MT_PARA_FARECOUNT
CAT_5 smallint YES Used by: MT_PASSENGERCOUNT and MT_PARA_FARECOUNT
CAT_6 smallint YES Used by: MT_PASSENGERCOUNT and MT_PARA_FARECOUNT
CAT_7 smallint YES Used by: MT_PASSENGERCOUNT and MT_PARA_FARECOUNT
CAT_8 smallint YES Used by: MT_PASSENGERCOUNT and MT_PARA_FARECOUNT
CAT_9 smallint YES Used by: MT_PASSENGERCOUNT and MT_PARA_FARECOUNT
CAT_10 smallint YES Used by: MT_PASSENGERCOUNT and MT_PARA_FARECOUNT
PARA_EVENT_ID int YES Used by: MT_DISPATCHPARATRIP
PARA_TRIP_STATUS smallint YES Used by: MT_DISPATCHPARATRIP
PARA_ACTIVITY smallint YES Used by: MT_DISPATCHPARATRIP
PARA_LOAD_TIME int YES Used by: MT_DISPATCHPARATRIP
PARA_SCHEDULED_TIME int YES Used by: MT_DISPATCHPARATRIP
PARA_ESTIMATED_TIME int YES Used by: MT_DISPATCHPARATRIP
PARA_FARE_AMOUNT int YES Used by: MT_DISPATCHPARATRIP
PARA_CLIENT_ID int YES Used by: MT_DISPATCHPARATRIP
PARA_CLIENT_NAME_SIZE int YES Used by: MT_DISPATCHPARATRIP
PARA_CLIENT_ADDRESS_SIZE int YES Used by: MT_DISPATCHPARATRIP
PARA_COMMENT_SIZE int YES Used by: MT_DISPATCHPARATRIP
PARA_MOBILITY_AID_SIZE int YES Used by: MT_DISPATCHPARATRIP
PARA_PASSENGER_INFO_SIZE int YES Used by: MT_DISPATCHPARATRIP
PARA_BLOCK int YES Used by: MT_MDTPARATRIP
MDT_MSG_DATE int YES Used by: MT_MDTPARATRIP
MDT_MSG_TIME int YES Used by: MT_MDTPARATRIP
FREE_TEXT_MSG varchar(255) YES Used by: MT_DISPATCHFREETEXT and MT_DGPSCORRECTION message
CURRENT_DRIVER int YES The driver that is logged into the MDT when this message is transmitted.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP DAILYLOG_DATA

LOGGED_MESSAGE_SHORT
Definition Logged messages for location and return-to-network. HIGH volume and not used for reporting.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE LOGGED_MESSAGE_SHORT(
     CALENDAR_ID           int            DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     MESSAGE_TYPE_ID       smallint       DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     LATITUDE              int            NULL,
     LONGITUDE             int            NULL,
     ADHERENCE             smallint       NULL,
     ODOMETER              int            NULL,
     VALIDITY              smallint       NULL,
     MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP     datetime       NULL,
     MDT_TIMESTAMP         int            NULL,
     SOURCE_CLASS          varchar(1)     NULL,
     SOURCE_HOST           smallint       NULL,
     DESTINATION_CLASS     varchar(1)     NULL,
     DESTINATION_HOST      smallint       NULL,
     CONSTRAINT [R/483] FOREIGN KEY (MESSAGE_TYPE_ID)
     REFERENCES MESSAGE_TYPE(MESSAGE_TYPE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/484] FOREIGN KEY (CALENDAR_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_CALENDAR(CALENDAR_ID)
) ON DAILYLOG_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
CALENDAR_ID int YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
MESSAGE_TYPE_ID smallint YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
LATITUDE int YES
LONGITUDE int YES
ADHERENCE smallint YES
ODOMETER int YES
VALIDITY smallint YES
MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP datetime YES
MDT_TIMESTAMP int YES
SOURCE_CLASS varchar(1) YES The source of the message to specify timeliness. Ex. RF link vs. from on-board system storage.
SOURCE_HOST smallint YES
DESTINATION_CLASS varchar(1) YES
DESTINATION_HOST smallint YES

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys

MAINT_TASK_ITEM
Definition The checklist of work for each maintenance task.

Ex. The Standard Checkup task may contain: \"Check fluid levels, check tire pressure, check tire treads, and check air filter.\"
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE MAINT_TASK_ITEM(
     MAINT_TASK_ID              numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     UNIQUE_ID                  numeric(10, 0)     NOT NULL,
     MAINT_ITEM_DESCRIPTION     varchar(20)        NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKMAINT_TASK_ITEM PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (MAINT_TASK_ID,UNIQUE_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKMAINT_TASK_MAINT_TASK_ITEM FOREIGN KEY (MAINT_TASK_ID)
     REFERENCES MAINTENANCE_TASK(MAINT_TASK_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
MAINT_TASK_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The unique, system-assigned identifier for each general maintenance task.
UNIQUE_ID numeric(10, 0) NO This attribute is a sequential, system-assigned number to create a unique key within the maintenance milestone.
MAINT_ITEM_DESCRIPTION varchar(20) YES A short description, or \"tickler\" to instruct the mechanic.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKMAINT_TASK_ITEM PrimaryKey MAINT_TASK_ID,UNIQUE_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
MAINTENANCE_TASK MAINT_TASK_ITEM Identifying MAINT_TASK_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

MAINTENANCE_LOG
Definition A record of the maintenance history for every vehicle.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE MAINTENANCE_LOG(
     MAINT_LOG_ID            numeric(10, 0)     NOT NULL,
     VEHICLE_ID              numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     ACTUAL_START_DATE       datetime           NULL,
     ACTUAL_END_DATE         datetime           NULL,
     VEHICLE_ODOMETER        numeric(7, 0)      NULL,
     GENERAL_INFORMATION     varchar(2000)      NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKMAINTENANCE_LOG PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (MAINT_LOG_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKVEHICLE_MAINTENANCE_LOG FOREIGN KEY (VEHICLE_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE(VEHICLE_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
MAINT_LOG_ID numeric(10, 0) NO The unique, system-assigned identifier for each maintenance event for a vehicle.
VEHICLE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ACTUAL_START_DATE datetime YES This is the date the maintenance actually began.
ACTUAL_END_DATE datetime YES This is the date the maintenance actually ended.
VEHICLE_ODOMETER numeric(7, 0) YES The vehicle odomotor reading at the time the maintenance is completed.
GENERAL_INFORMATION varchar(2000) YES Free-form text area for comment regarding the maintenance order.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKMAINTENANCE_LOG PrimaryKey MAINT_LOG_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
VEHICLE MAINTENANCE_LOG Non-Identifying VEHICLE_ID
MAINTENANCE_LOG MECHANIC_ACTION Identifying MAINT_LOG_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

MAINTENANCE_SCHEDULE
Definition Defines the preventative, or regular maintenance that should be performed for each type of vehicle owned by a property.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE MAINTENANCE_SCHEDULE(
     MFG_MODEL_SERIES_ID        numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     UNIQUE_ID                  numeric(10, 0)     NOT NULL,
     MAINT_TASK_ID              numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     ODOMETER                   numeric(7, 0)      NULL,
     OPERATION_DAY_INTERVAL     numeric(7, 0)      NULL,
     OPERATION_MILES            numeric(7, 0)      NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKMAINTENANCE_SCHEDULE PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (MFG_MODEL_SERIES_ID,UNIQUE_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKMAINT_TASK_MAINT_SCHEDULE FOREIGN KEY (MAINT_TASK_ID)
     REFERENCES MAINTENANCE_TASK(MAINT_TASK_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKMFG_MODL_SERIES_MAINT_SCH FOREIGN KEY (MFG_MODEL_SERIES_ID)
     REFERENCES MFG_MODEL_SERIES(MFG_MODEL_SERIES_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
MFG_MODEL_SERIES_ID numeric(3, 0) NO The unique code that defines a vehicle manufacturer, model, and series.
UNIQUE_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A system assigned sequential number that serves only to form a unique primary key.
MAINT_TASK_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The unique, system-assigned identifier for each general maintenance task.
ODOMETER numeric(7, 0) YES The odometer reading at which this maintenance should be performed.
OPERATION_DAY_INTERVAL numeric(7, 0) YES The frequency for this work expressed in operating days.
OPERATION_MILES numeric(7, 0) YES The frequency for this work expressed in operating miles.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKMAINTENANCE_SCHEDULE PrimaryKey MFG_MODEL_SERIES_ID,UNIQUE_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
MAINTENANCE_TASK MAINTENANCE_SCHEDULE Non-Identifying MAINT_TASK_ID
MFG_MODEL_SERIES MAINTENANCE_SCHEDULE Identifying MFG_MODEL_SERIES_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

MAINTENANCE_TASK
Definition A general maintenance event commonly performed to keep vehicles in good working condition.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE MAINTENANCE_TASK(
     MAINT_TASK_ID               numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     TASK_INTERPRETATION_ID      numeric(3, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     TASK_DESCRIPTION            varchar(100)      NOT NULL,
     DEFAULT_ODOMETER            numeric(7, 0)     NULL,
     DEFAULT_OPERATION_DAYS      numeric(7, 0)     NULL,
     DEFAULT_OPERATION_MILES     numeric(7, 0)     NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKMAINTENANCE_TASK PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (MAINT_TASK_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKTASK_INTERP_MAINT_TASK FOREIGN KEY (TASK_INTERPRETATION_ID)
     REFERENCES TASK_INTERPRETATION(TASK_INTERPRETATION_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
MAINT_TASK_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The unique, system-assigned identifier for each general maintenance task.
TASK_INTERPRETATION_ID numeric(3, 0) NO The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TASK_DESCRIPTION varchar(100) NO The short text description of the maintenance task.
DEFAULT_ODOMETER numeric(7, 0) YES The default, or generally accepted odometer reading at which this work should be performed.
DEFAULT_OPERATION_DAYS numeric(7, 0) YES The default, or generally accepted number of operation day interval at which this work should be performed.
DEFAULT_OPERATION_MILES numeric(7, 0) YES The default, or generally accepted number of operation miles interval at which this work should be performed.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKMAINTENANCE_TASK PrimaryKey MAINT_TASK_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
TASK_INTERPRETATION MAINTENANCE_TASK Non-Identifying TASK_INTERPRETATION_ID
MAINTENANCE_TASK MAINTENANCE_SCHEDULE Non-Identifying MFG_MODEL_SERIES_ID
MAINTENANCE_TASK MAINT_TASK_ITEM Identifying MAINT_TASK_ID
MAINTENANCE_TASK MECHANIC_ACTION Non-Identifying MAINT_LOG_ID
MAINTENANCE_TASK VEH_MAINT_EXCEPTION Identifying VEHICLE_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

MDT_FILE
Definition
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE MDT_FILE(
     BLOCK_ID                     numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     MDT_FILE_ID                  numeric(5, 0)      NOT NULL,
     GEO_NODE_ID                  numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_ID                     numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID           numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     INTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID     numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID     numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     TRIP_ID                      numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     DISTANCE                     numeric(7, 2)      NULL,
     COMPASS_DIRECTION            numeric(3, 0)      NULL,
     TIME_POINT_TIME              numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     NODE_TYPE_TEXT               varchar(100)       NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKMDT_FILE PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (BLOCK_ID,MDT_FILE_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKANNOUNCEMENT_MDT_FILE1 FOREIGN KEY (EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID)
     REFERENCES ANNOUNCEMENT(ANNOUNCE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKANNOUNCEMENT_MDT_FILE2 FOREIGN KEY (INTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID)
     REFERENCES ANNOUNCEMENT(ANNOUNCE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKBLOCK_MDT_FILE FOREIGN KEY (BLOCK_ID)
     REFERENCES BLOCK(BLOCK_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKGEO_NODE_MDT_FILE FOREIGN KEY (GEO_NODE_ID)
     REFERENCES GEO_NODE(GEO_NODE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKROUTE_DIR_MDT_FILE FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE_DIRECTION(ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKROUTE_MDT_FILE FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE(ROUTE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTRIP_MDT_FILE FOREIGN KEY (TRIP_ID)
     REFERENCES TRIP(TRIP_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
BLOCK_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
MDT_FILE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO
GEO_NODE_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ROUTE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
INTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TRIP_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
DISTANCE numeric(7, 2) YES
COMPASS_DIRECTION numeric(3, 0) YES
TIME_POINT_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES
NODE_TYPE_TEXT varchar(100) YES

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKMDT_FILE PrimaryKey BLOCK_ID,MDT_FILE_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
ANNOUNCEMENT MDT_FILE Non-Identifying EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID
ANNOUNCEMENT MDT_FILE Non-Identifying INTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID
BLOCK MDT_FILE Identifying BLOCK_ID
GEO_NODE MDT_FILE Non-Identifying GEO_NODE_ID
ROUTE_DIRECTION MDT_FILE Non-Identifying ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID
ROUTE MDT_FILE Non-Identifying ROUTE_ID
TRIP MDT_FILE Non-Identifying TRIP_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

MDT_OPERATING_MODE
Definition Preloaded and not exposed in TMConfiguration.

0 - Unused
1 - Fixed Route
2 - Paratransit
3 - Fixed Route Supervisor
4 - Paratransit Supervisor
5 - Charter
6 - Training
7 - Maintenance
8 - Special
9 - Staged
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE MDT_OPERATING_MODE(
     OPERATING_MODE_ID     numeric(3, 0)     NOT NULL,
     DESCRIPTION           varchar(100)      NOT NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKMDT_OPERATING_MODE PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (OPERATING_MODE_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
OPERATING_MODE_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique identifier for each record.
DESCRIPTION varchar(100) NO The text description that is displayed in the application.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKMDT_OPERATING_MODE PrimaryKey OPERATING_MODE_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
MDT_OPERATING_MODE FLEET Non-Identifying FLEET_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

MDT_SOFTWARE_VERSION_RPT
Definition Reporting. This table is sourced from MT_MDTSTARTED (#1) messages in the TMdailylog..logged_message table.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE MDT_SOFTWARE_VERSION_RPT(
     CALENDAR_ID                numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID     int                DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP          datetime           NULL,
     VEHICLE_ID                 numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     ROUTE_VERSION              int                NULL,
     MESSAGES_VERSION           int                NULL,
     FIA_VERSION                int                NULL,
     MDT_SOFTWARE_VERSION       int                NULL,
     CONSTRAINT [R/479] FOREIGN KEY (CALENDAR_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_CALENDAR(CALENDAR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/481] FOREIGN KEY (TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID)
     REFERENCES LOGGED_MESSAGE(TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/491] FOREIGN KEY (VEHICLE_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE(VEHICLE_ID)
) ON REPORTING_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
CALENDAR_ID numeric(10, 0) NO Service day.
TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID int NO The message id.
MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP datetime YES Message date and time.
VEHICLE_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The vehicle that generated the message.
ROUTE_VERSION int YES Copied from the logged message.
MESSAGES_VERSION int YES Copied from the logged message.
FIA_VERSION int YES Copied from the logged message.
MDT_SOFTWARE_VERSION int YES Copied from the logged message.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XIE1MDT_SOFTWARE_VERSION_RPT Index MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
SERVICE_CALENDAR MDT_SOFTWARE_VERSION_RPT Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
LOGGED_MESSAGE MDT_SOFTWARE_VERSION_RPT Non-Identifying TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID
VEHICLE MDT_SOFTWARE_VERSION_RPT Non-Identifying VEHICLE_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP REPORTING_DATA

MDT_TRANSFER
Definition
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE MDT_TRANSFER(
     TRANSFER_OFFSET_ID     numeric(5, 0)      NOT NULL,
     GEO_NODE_ID            numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_ID               numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID     numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     TIME_POINT_TIME        numeric(10, 0)     NOT NULL,
     BLOCK_ID               numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     SERVICE_TYPE_ID        numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     CONSTRAINT FKBLOCK_MDT_TRANSFER FOREIGN KEY (BLOCK_ID)
     REFERENCES BLOCK(BLOCK_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKGEO_NODE_MDT_TRANSFER FOREIGN KEY (GEO_NODE_ID)
     REFERENCES GEO_NODE(GEO_NODE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKROUTE_MDT_TRANSFER FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE(ROUTE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKRTE_DIR_MDT_TRANSFER FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE_DIRECTION(ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKSERV_TYPE_MDT_TRANSFER FOREIGN KEY (SERVICE_TYPE_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_TYPE(SERVICE_TYPE_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
TRANSFER_OFFSET_ID numeric(5, 0) NO
GEO_NODE_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ROUTE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TIME_POINT_TIME numeric(10, 0) NO
BLOCK_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
SERVICE_TYPE_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.

Key Name Key Type Keys

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys

MECHANIC
Definition A list of transit staff employed to repair and maintain fleet vehicles.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE MECHANIC(
     MECHANIC_ID     numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     FIRST_NAME      varchar(20)       NULL,
     MIDDLE_NAME     varchar(20)       NULL,
     LAST_NAME       varchar(20)       NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKMECHANIC PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (MECHANIC_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
MECHANIC_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The unique, system-assigned identifier for each mechanic.
FIRST_NAME varchar(20) YES The mechanic's first name.
MIDDLE_NAME varchar(20) YES The mechanic's middle name or initial.
LAST_NAME varchar(20) YES The mechanic's last name.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKMECHANIC PrimaryKey MECHANIC_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
MECHANIC MECHANIC_ACTION Identifying MAINT_LOG_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

MECHANIC_ACTION
Definition The details of a maintenance event for a vehicle. This can span several days and involve more than one mechanic.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE MECHANIC_ACTION(
     MAINT_LOG_ID            numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     MECHANIC_ID             numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     MECHANIC_ACTION_SEQ     numeric(7, 0)      NOT NULL,
     MAINT_TASK_ID           numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     LOG_TIMESTAMP           datetime           NULL,
     GENERAL_INFORMATION     varchar(2000)      NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKMECHANIC_ACTION PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (MAINT_LOG_ID,MECHANIC_ID,MECHANIC_ACTION_SEQ)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKMAINT_LOG_MECHANIC_ACT FOREIGN KEY (MAINT_LOG_ID)
     REFERENCES MAINTENANCE_LOG(MAINT_LOG_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKMAINT_TASK_MECHANIC_ACT FOREIGN KEY (MAINT_TASK_ID)
     REFERENCES MAINTENANCE_TASK(MAINT_TASK_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKMECHANIC_MECHANIC_ACTION FOREIGN KEY (MECHANIC_ID)
     REFERENCES MECHANIC(MECHANIC_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
MAINT_LOG_ID numeric(10, 0) NO The unique, system-assigned identifier for each maintenance event for a vehicle.
MECHANIC_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The unique, system-assigned identifier for each mechanic.
MECHANIC_ACTION_SEQ numeric(7, 0) NO The sequence in which the maintenance items were performed.
MAINT_TASK_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The unique, system-assigned identifier for each general maintenance task.
LOG_TIMESTAMP datetime YES The date and time that the mechanic performed the maintenance.
GENERAL_INFORMATION varchar(2000) YES Free-form text to be entered by the mechanic to record.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKMECHANIC_ACTION PrimaryKey MAINT_LOG_ID,MECHANIC_ID,MECHANIC_ACTION_SEQ

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
MAINTENANCE_LOG MECHANIC_ACTION Identifying MAINT_LOG_ID
MAINTENANCE_TASK MECHANIC_ACTION Non-Identifying MAINT_TASK_ID
MECHANIC MECHANIC_ACTION Identifying MECHANIC_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

MECHANICAL_WARNING
Definition Summary message data for message type 19 (mt_mechanical) messages. This table is sourced from the TMDailylog..logged_message table.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE MECHANICAL_WARNING(
     CALENDAR_ID        numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     OPERATOR_ID        numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     VEHICLE_ID         numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_ID           numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     AIR_PRESSURE       int                NULL,
     CNG                int                NULL,
     COVERT_FAULT       int                NULL,
     ENGINE_COOLANT     int                NULL,
     ENGINE_HOT         int                NULL,
     OIL_PRESSURE       int                NULL,
     CONSTRAINT [R/466] FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE(ROUTE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/467] FOREIGN KEY (VEHICLE_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE(VEHICLE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/468] FOREIGN KEY (OPERATOR_ID)
     REFERENCES OPERATOR(OPERATOR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/493] FOREIGN KEY (CALENDAR_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_CALENDAR(CALENDAR_ID)
) ON REPORTING_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
CALENDAR_ID numeric(10, 0) NO Service day.
OPERATOR_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The operator that logged the messages.
VEHICLE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The vehicle that logged the messages.
ROUTE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The logon route.
AIR_PRESSURE int YES Count of messages logged.
CNG int YES Count of messages logged.
COVERT_FAULT int YES Count of messages logged.
ENGINE_COOLANT int YES Count of messages logged.
ENGINE_HOT int YES Count of messages logged.
OIL_PRESSURE int YES Count of messages logged.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
ROUTE MECHANICAL_WARNING Non-Identifying ROUTE_ID
VEHICLE MECHANICAL_WARNING Non-Identifying VEHICLE_ID
OPERATOR MECHANICAL_WARNING Non-Identifying OPERATOR_ID
SERVICE_CALENDAR MECHANICAL_WARNING Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID

MESSAGE_INFO
Definition Pre-defined messages loaded in the MDT.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE MESSAGE_INFO(
     MESSAGE_INFO_ID              numeric(5, 0)      NOT NULL,
     MESSAGE_VERSION_ID           numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     MESSAGE_INDEX                numeric(7, 0)      NULL,
     MESSAGE_TEXT                 varchar(512)       NULL,
     DEFAULT_INCIDENT_TYPE_ID     numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     MESSAGE_CAT_ID               numeric(5, 0)      NOT NULL,
     MESSAGE_DATA                 numeric(18, 0)     NULL,
     ACTION_PLAN_ID               numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKMESSAGE_INFO PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (MESSAGE_INFO_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKACTION_PLAN_MESSAGE_INFO FOREIGN KEY (ACTION_PLAN_ID)
     REFERENCES ACTION_PLAN(ACTION_PLAN_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKINCIDENT_TYPE_CAN_MSG FOREIGN KEY (DEFAULT_INCIDENT_TYPE_ID)
     REFERENCES INCIDENT_TYPE(INCIDENT_TYPE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKMSG_SUB_CAT_MSG_INFO FOREIGN KEY (MESSAGE_CAT_ID)
     REFERENCES MESSAGE_CATEGORY(MESSAGE_CAT_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKMSG_VERSION_CAN_MSG FOREIGN KEY (MESSAGE_VERSION_ID)
     REFERENCES MESSAGE_VERSION(MESSAGE_VERSION_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
MESSAGE_INFO_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
MESSAGE_VERSION_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
MESSAGE_INDEX numeric(7, 0) YES Values 1 - 15. Defined by the application.
MESSAGE_TEXT varchar(512) YES The text that is displayed to the user.
DEFAULT_INCIDENT_TYPE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
MESSAGE_CAT_ID numeric(5, 0) NO
MESSAGE_DATA numeric(18, 0) YES
ACTION_PLAN_ID numeric(10, 0) YES

Key Name Key Type Keys

MESSAGE_TYPE
Definition A list of message types that can be recognized by the system.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE MESSAGE_TYPE(
     MESSAGE_TYPE_ID       numeric(3, 0)     NOT NULL,
     MESSAGE_TYPE_TEXT     varchar(100)      NOT NULL,
     DISPLAY_ORDER         numeric(3, 0)     NULL,
     DEACTIVATION_DATE     datetime          NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKMESSAGE_TYPE PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (MESSAGE_TYPE_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
MESSAGE_TYPE_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
MESSAGE_TYPE_TEXT varchar(100) NO Text translation of the message type.

MDT Started message - inbound
Dispatch Time Point offsets - outbound
Dispatch Initialize Vehicle Settings - outbound
Dispatch system parameters - outbound
MDT Shutdown message - inbound
MDT Return to Network message - inbound
DGPS TOD message - internal
DGPS Correction message - outbound
MDT Logon/logoff message - inbound
DGPS Health message - internal
DGPS Status message - internal
MDT Location message - inbound
MDT Transfer request - inbound
Dispatch Transfer Request Accept/Deny - outbound
Dispatch Transfer Hold - outbound
MDT Timepoint Crossing - inbound
MDT Canned Message - inbound
MDT High Priority Canned Message - inbound
Dispatch Canned Message - outbound
MDT predefined mechanical - inbound
MDT Driver Violation - inbound
MDT Covert alarm message - inbound
MDT Overt alarm message - inbound
MDT RTT (request to talk) - inbound
MDT PRTT (priority request to talk) - inbound
Dispatch Enable Covert Microphone - outbound
Dispatch Switch to Voice channel - outbound
MDT Acknowledge Voice Communications - inbound
Dispatch Logon Verification - outbound
Dispatch Alarm Acknowledge - outbound
MDT Individual Call Complete - inbound
Dispatch Block Schedule - outbound
MDT Block Schedule - inbound
MDT Wheelchair Cycled - inbound
Map Display Message - Track Vehicle
Map Display Message - Show Route
Map Display Message - Zoom to Route
Map Display Message - Zoom to Map
TDMA Status Report
Adjust TDMA Roster
Data Select
Data Backup Select
Voice Fall Back Select
Request Current System Mode
Request RNC Transceiver Status
Station Health
Passenger Count
Dispatch - Enable Mechanical Alarm
Dispatch - Adjust Transfer Parameters
Call Vehicle to Vehicle
Vehicle Call confirm/deny
TDMA Request Remote List
TDMA Remote List Report
TDMA Request A Remote Info
TDMA Action Report
System Error
Automatic Passenger Count
DISPLAY_ORDER numeric(3, 0) YES Override the display order of this item for a list.
DEACTIVATION_DATE datetime YES The date that an item is removed from display within the system (ie. logical delete).

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKMESSAGE_TYPE PrimaryKey MESSAGE_TYPE_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
MESSAGE_TYPE FORM_SELECTION Non-Identifying FORM_SELECTION_ID

MESSAGE_TYPE LOGGED_MESSAGE Non-Identifying TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID
MESSAGE_TYPE VEH_MALFUNCTION_FILTER Identifying VEHICLE_ID
MESSAGE_TYPE LOGGED_MESSAGE_SHORT Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID

MESSAGE_VERSION
Definition Version control for messages. Each record represents a set of messages.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE MESSAGE_VERSION(
     MESSAGE_VERSION_ID       numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     MESSAGE_VERSION_TEXT     varchar(100)      NOT NULL,
     ACTIVATION_DATE          datetime          NULL,
     DEACTIVATION_DATE        datetime          NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKMESSAGE_VERSION PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (MESSAGE_VERSION_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
MESSAGE_VERSION_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
MESSAGE_VERSION_TEXT varchar(100) NO The free-form text description for this set of messages.
ACTIVATION_DATE datetime YES The date this set of messages is activated.
DEACTIVATION_DATE datetime YES The date this set of messages is deactivated.

MFG_MODEL_SERIES
Definition The make, model, and series of a vehicle.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE MFG_MODEL_SERIES(
     MFG_MODEL_SERIES_ID     numeric(3, 0)     NOT NULL,
     MFG_MODEL_ID            numeric(3, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     SERIES                  varchar(20)       NULL,
     SEATING_CAPACITY        numeric(3, 0)     NULL,
     TOTAL_CAPACITY          numeric(3, 0)     NULL,
     WEIGHT                  numeric(5, 0)     NULL,
     LENGTH                  numeric(7, 2)     NULL,
     DISPLAY_ORDER           numeric(3, 0)     NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKMFG_MODEL_SERIES PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (MFG_MODEL_SERIES_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKMFG_MODEL_MFG_MODL_SERIES FOREIGN KEY (MFG_MODEL_ID)
     REFERENCES MFG_MODEL(MFG_MODEL_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
MFG_MODEL_SERIES_ID numeric(3, 0) NO The unique code that defines a vehicle manufacturer, model, and series.
MFG_MODEL_ID numeric(3, 0) NO The unique code that defines a model within a manufacturer.
SERIES varchar(20) YES The specific series of a model from a manufacturer.
SEATING_CAPACITY numeric(3, 0) YES The maximum number of seated passengers.
TOTAL_CAPACITY numeric(3, 0) YES The maximum number of passengers.
WEIGHT numeric(5, 0) YES The weight of a vehicle. Unit of measure is pounds.
LENGTH numeric(7, 2) YES The length of the vehicle. Unit of measure is feet.
DISPLAY_ORDER numeric(3, 0) YES Override the display order of this item for a list.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKMFG_MODEL_SERIES PrimaryKey MFG_MODEL_SERIES_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys

MODEM_PROFILE
Definition
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE MODEM_PROFILE(
     MODEM_PROFILE_ID     numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     PROFILE_NAME         varchar(100)      NULL,
     SLOTLENGTH           numeric(5, 0)     NULL,
     SCRAMBLEENABLE       numeric(1, 0)     NULL,
     TXBUFFEREMPTY        numeric(5, 0)     NULL,
     TXRXMODE             numeric(5, 0)     NULL,
     DATARATERX           numeric(5, 0)     NULL,
     AMPLITUDEDATA1       numeric(5, 0)     NULL,
     AMPLITUDEDATA2       numeric(5, 0)     NULL,
     AMPLITUDEDATA4       numeric(5, 0)     NULL,

     RXINVERT             numeric(1, 0)     NULL,

     NUMRXPACKETS         numeric(5, 0)     NULL,

     UNKEYCOUNT           numeric(5, 0)     NULL,
     TXTIMEOFFSET         numeric(5, 0)     NULL,

     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition

PROFILE_NAME varchar(100) YES The text description, or user-assigned identifier for a profile.
SLOTLENGTH numeric(5, 0) YES
SCRAMBLEENABLE numeric(1, 0) YES 0 = off/false
1 = on/true
TXBUFFEREMPTY numeric(5, 0) YES
TXRXMODE numeric(5, 0) YES
DATARATERX numeric(5, 0) YES
AMPLITUDEDATA1 numeric(5, 0) YES
AMPLITUDEDATA2 numeric(5, 0) YES
AMPLITUDEDATA4 numeric(5, 0) YES

1 = on/true

1 = on/true

NUMTXPACKETS numeric(5, 0) YES
NUMRXPACKETS numeric(5, 0) YES

UNKEYCOUNT numeric(5, 0) YES

     NT_GROUP_TEXT     varchar(100)      NOT NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKNT_GROUP PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (NT_GROUP_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
NT_GROUP_ID numeric(3, 0) NO The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
NT_GROUP_TEXT varchar(100) NO The text name of the NT group that is displayed to the user. For example:

TM Charter
TM Paratransit Maintenance
TM FixedRoute Maintenance
TM Special
TM Training

OPERATING_TIME_TYPE
Definition Each entry is a text description for the enumerated types for use in displays.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE OPERATING_TIME_TYPE(
     OPERATING_TIME_ID       numeric(3, 0)     NOT NULL,
     OPERATING_TIME_TEXT     varchar(100)      NOT NULL,
     DISPLAY_ORDER           numeric(3, 0)     NULL,
     DEACTIVATION_DATE       datetime          NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKOPERATING_TIME_TYPE PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (OPERATING_TIME_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
OPERATING_TIME_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
OPERATING_TIME_TEXT varchar(100) NO A numeric value indicating the type of operating time.

1\tDeadhead Time- Bus travel time in non-revenue bus travel time to or from the garage and a terminus point where revenue services begins or ends; or within a vehicle assignment from the end of one revenue service segment to the beginning of another.
2\tDwell Time - Time scheduled for loading pas- sengers or waiting for them to transfer at a stop point.
3\tLayover Time - Scheduled rest and recovery, usually at a terminal.
4\tMake Up Time - Payment for time in order that the total paid time for an operator assignment is equal to a minimum daily or weekly guarantee.
5\tOvertime - Identifies the amount of scheduled time paid beyond the daily guarantee or actually operated beyond the scheduled time.
6\tPullIn Time - Deadhead running time allowed a transit vehicle to arrive at the VehicleBase after the final access or time point in the vehicle assignment.
7\tPullOut Time - Deadhead running time allowed a transit vehicle to depart the VehicleBase prior to arriving at the first time point in the vehicle assignment.
8\tSpread Time - Total elapsed time between the first report time and the final turn-in time of an operator's assignment.
9\tTravel Time - A period of time allocated to an operator during which (s)he must travel from one piece of work to another.
10\tTurnInAllowance - Paid time for the operator to report to the dispatcher at the conclusion of a run.
11\tReport Time - Paid time for the operator to prepare for the start of a run or a piece of work.
12\tPlatform Time - Time when the operator is scheduled to drive the transit vehicle, including layover time.
13\tBreak Time - Time when the operator is scheduled to have a rest.
14\tMeal Break Time - Time when the operator is scheduled to have a rest (for a meal).
DISPLAY_ORDER numeric(3, 0) YES Override the display order of this item for a list.
DEACTIVATION_DATE datetime YES The date that an item is removed from display within the system (ie. logical delete).

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKOPERATING_TIME_TYPE PrimaryKey OPERATING_TIME_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
OPERATING_TIME_TYPE WORK_PIECE Non-Identifying WORK_PIECE_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

OPERATOR
Definition Each entry represents a transit staff member who operates a vehicle.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE OPERATOR(
     OPERATOR_ID          numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     ONBOARD_LOGON_ID     numeric(7, 0)     NULL,
     BADGE                varchar(20)       NULL,
     FIRST_NAME           varchar(20)       NULL,
     MIDDLE_NAME          varchar(20)       NULL,
     LAST_NAME            varchar(20)       NULL,
     MDT_PASSWORD         varchar(20)       NULL,
     INTERFACE_ID         varchar(20)       NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKOPERATOR PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (OPERATOR_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
OPERATOR_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The unique, system-assigned identifier for an operator record.
ONBOARD_LOGON_ID numeric(7, 0) YES Operator logon, or system identifier.
BADGE varchar(20) YES The public identification for the transit staff person. The official transit property badge or pass displayed by the operator.
FIRST_NAME varchar(20) YES The first name of an operator.
MIDDLE_NAME varchar(20) YES The middle name or initial of an operator. Optional.
LAST_NAME varchar(20) YES The last name of the operator.
MDT_PASSWORD varchar(20) YES Operator logon password.
INTERFACE_ID varchar(20) YES Identifier to match the operator to a record in another system. For example, a legacy payroll system.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XIE1OPERATOR Index ONBOARD_LOGON_ID
XPKOPERATOR PrimaryKey OPERATOR_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
OPERATOR INCIDENT Non-Identifying INCIDENT_ID
OPERATOR INCIDENT Non-Identifying INCIDENT_ID
OPERATOR OPERATOR_FLEET_XREF Identifying OPERATOR_ID
OPERATOR ROSTER Non-Identifying ROSTER_ID
OPERATOR RUN_SUBSTITUTION Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
OPERATOR DAILY_RUN Non-Identifying DAILY_RUN_ID
OPERATOR DAILY_MESSAGE_TEXT Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
OPERATOR SCHEDULE_ADHERENCE Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
OPERATOR MECHANICAL_WARNING Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
OPERATOR DRIVER_LOGON Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
OPERATOR DRIVER_VIOLATION Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
OPERATOR COMMUNICATION_SUMMARY Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
OPERATOR ROUTE_DEVIATION Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
OPERATOR SCHEDULE_DEVIATION Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID

FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

PASSENGER_COUNT
Definition Reporting. This table is sourced from passenger count message (type 59) messages in the TMreporting..passenger_count table.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE PASSENGER_COUNT(
     PASSENGER_COUNT_ID         numeric(7, 0)      NOT NULL,
     TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID     int                DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     CALENDAR_ID                numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     VEHICLE_ID                 numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     TRIP_ID                    numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     TIME_OF_DAY_ID             numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     PASSENGER_COUNT_ON         smallint           NULL,
     PASSENGER_COUNT_OFF        smallint           NULL,
     ROUTE_OFFSET               smallint           NULL,
     STOP_OFFSET                smallint           NULL,
     MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP          datetime           NULL,
     ODOMETER                   smallint           NULL,
     INSERT_TIMESTAMP           timestamp          NOT NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKPASSENGER_COUNT PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (PASSENGER_COUNT_ID)
     ON REPORTING_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT [R/565] FOREIGN KEY (CALENDAR_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_CALENDAR(CALENDAR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/566] FOREIGN KEY (VEHICLE_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE(VEHICLE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/567] FOREIGN KEY (TRIP_ID)
     REFERENCES TRIP(TRIP_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/568] FOREIGN KEY (TIME_OF_DAY_ID)
     REFERENCES TIME_OF_DAY(TIME_OF_DAY_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/569] FOREIGN KEY (TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID)
     REFERENCES LOGGED_MESSAGE(TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID)
) ON REPORTING_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
PASSENGER_COUNT_ID numeric(7, 0) NO Unique, system-assigned identifier for each record. Required for SQL Server \"FOR BROWSE\" cursors.
TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID int NO The message id.
CALENDAR_ID numeric(10, 0) NO Service day.
VEHICLE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The vehicle that logged the message.
TRIP_ID numeric(10, 0) YES The trip where the message was logged.
TIME_OF_DAY_ID numeric(3, 0) YES Time of day when the message was logged.
PASSENGER_COUNT_ON smallint YES Passenger count on. Value copied from the logged message.
PASSENGER_COUNT_OFF smallint YES Passenger count off. Value copied from the logged message.
ROUTE_OFFSET smallint YES MDT route offset.
STOP_OFFSET smallint YES MDT stop offset.
MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP datetime YES Logged message date and time.
ODOMETER smallint YES Odometer value copied from the logged message.
INSERT_TIMESTAMP timestamp NO Timestamp column required by SQL Server for \"FOR BROWSE\" cursors.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKPASSENGER_COUNT PrimaryKey PASSENGER_COUNT_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
SERVICE_CALENDAR PASSENGER_COUNT Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
VEHICLE PASSENGER_COUNT Non-Identifying VEHICLE_ID
TRIP PASSENGER_COUNT Non-Identifying TRIP_ID
TIME_OF_DAY PASSENGER_COUNT Non-Identifying TIME_OF_DAY_ID
LOGGED_MESSAGE PASSENGER_COUNT Non-Identifying TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP REPORTING_DATA

PATTERN
Definition A unique identifier assigned by a transit agency for a defined sequence of points, events and activation events along a variation of a route.

Or, a series/sequence of timepoints (path) from a route start to a
route end.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE PATTERN(
     PATTERN_ID                   numeric(10, 0)     NOT NULL,
     EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID     numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID           numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_ID                     numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     PATTERN_ABBR                 varchar(20)        NULL,
     PATTERN_NAME                 varchar(20)        NULL,
     TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID        numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     TRANSIT_DIV_ID               numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 1 NOT NULL,
     DETOUR_IND                   varchar(1)         NULL,
     DETOUR_DISTANCE_CHG          numeric(7, 2)      NULL,
     OPERATOR_INSTRUCTION         varchar(2000)      NULL,
     REVENUE_IND                  varchar(1)         NULL,
     REMARK                       varchar(2000)      NULL,
     NEXT_STOP_ANNUN_IND          varchar(1)         NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKPATTERN PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (PATTERN_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKANNOUNCEMENT_PATTERN FOREIGN KEY (EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID)
     REFERENCES ANNOUNCEMENT(ANNOUNCE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKROUTE_PATTERN FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE(ROUTE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKRTE_DIRECTION_PATTERN FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE_DIRECTION(ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTRANSIT_DIV_PATTERN FOREIGN KEY (TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
     REFERENCES TRANSIT_DIVISION(TRANSIT_DIV_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTT_VERSION_PATTERN FOREIGN KEY (TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
     REFERENCES TIME_TABLE_VERSION(TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
PATTERN_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique identifier assigned by a transit agency for a defined sequence of points, events and activation events along a variation of a route.
EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ROUTE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
PATTERN_ABBR varchar(20) YES An alpha-numeric identifier for a defined sequence of points, events and activation events along a route.
PATTERN_NAME varchar(20) YES The name for a defined sequence of points and events along a variation of a route that represents a physical path traversed by a transit vehicle in a network.
TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique number associated with the concepts, messages and parts of a schedule including all the messages associated with the scheduling business area.
TRANSIT_DIV_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
DETOUR_IND varchar(1) YES Identifies this pattern as a detour pattern.
DETOUR_DISTANCE_CHG numeric(7, 2) YES The net distance change resulting from this detour as compared to the normal route.
OPERATOR_INSTRUCTION varchar(2000) YES \"Turn by turn\" instructions for the operator that will appear on the daily Block Paddle report.
REVENUE_IND varchar(1) YES Specifies if this segment is revenue miles, or not.

1 = revenue
0 = non-revenue
REMARK varchar(2000) YES A free-form text field to record general information about a pattern.
NEXT_STOP_ANNUN_IND varchar(1) YES An indicator to specify that the next stop should be announced.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XIE1PATTERN Index ROUTE_ID,PATTERN_NAME
XPKPATTERN PrimaryKey PATTERN_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
ANNOUNCEMENT PATTERN Non-Identifying EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID
ROUTE PATTERN Non-Identifying ROUTE_ID
ROUTE_DIRECTION PATTERN Non-Identifying ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID
TRANSIT_DIVISION PATTERN Non-Identifying TRANSIT_DIV_ID
TIME_TABLE_VERSION PATTERN Non-Identifying TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID
PATTERN PATTERN_GEO_NODE_XREF Identifying PATTERN_ID
PATTERN TIME_POINT_CROSSING Non-Identifying DAILY_TRIP_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

PATTERN_GEO_NODE_XREF
Definition This is the \"drawable\" set of geographical nodes that form a pattern.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE PATTERN_GEO_NODE_XREF(
     PATTERN_ID                   numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     GEO_NODE_ID                  numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     PATTERN_GEO_NODE_SEQ         numeric(7, 0)      NOT NULL,
     FARE_ZONE_ID                 numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID     numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     ANNOUNCEMENT_ZONE_ID         numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     INTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID     numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     NEXT_STOP_ANNUN_IND          varchar(1)         NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKPATTERN_GEO_NODE_XREF PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (PATTERN_ID,GEO_NODE_ID,PATTERN_GEO_NODE_SEQ)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKANNOUNCE_PATTERN_GN_X FOREIGN KEY (EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID)
     REFERENCES ANNOUNCEMENT(ANNOUNCE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKANNOUNCE_PATTRN_GEO_NODE_X FOREIGN KEY (INTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID)
     REFERENCES ANNOUNCEMENT(ANNOUNCE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKANNOUNCEZ_PAT_GEO_NODE_X FOREIGN KEY (ANNOUNCEMENT_ZONE_ID)
     REFERENCES ANNOUNCEMENT_ZONE(ANNOUNCEMENT_ZONE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKFARE_ZONE_PATTERN_GN_X FOREIGN KEY (FARE_ZONE_ID)
     REFERENCES FARE_ZONE(FARE_ZONE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKGEO_NODE_RTE_PATTERN_X FOREIGN KEY (GEO_NODE_ID)
     REFERENCES GEO_NODE(GEO_NODE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKPATTERN_RTE_PATTERN_X FOREIGN KEY (PATTERN_ID)
     REFERENCES PATTERN(PATTERN_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
PATTERN_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique identifier assigned by a transit agency for a defined sequence of points, events and activation events along a variation of a route.
GEO_NODE_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
PATTERN_GEO_NODE_SEQ numeric(7, 0) NO The sequence in which geo nodes are crossed along the pattern.
FARE_ZONE_ID numeric(3, 0) YES An unique number used to reference a geographic area with which a specified fare is associated. (The fare may be based on trips between two fare zones or as a fixed value at Stop Points contained in the zone.)
EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ANNOUNCEMENT_ZONE_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The announcement zone time/distance settings for this location.
INTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
NEXT_STOP_ANNUN_IND varchar(1) YES

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKPATTERN_GEO_NODE_XREF PrimaryKey PATTERN_ID,GEO_NODE_ID,PATTERN_GEO_NODE_SEQ

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
ANNOUNCEMENT PATTERN_GEO_NODE_XREF Non-Identifying EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID
ANNOUNCEMENT PATTERN_GEO_NODE_XREF Non-Identifying INTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID
ANNOUNCEMENT_ZONE PATTERN_GEO_NODE_XREF Non-Identifying ANNOUNCEMENT_ZONE_ID
FARE_ZONE PATTERN_GEO_NODE_XREF Non-Identifying FARE_ZONE_ID
GEO_NODE PATTERN_GEO_NODE_XREF Identifying GEO_NODE_ID
PATTERN PATTERN_GEO_NODE_XREF Identifying PATTERN_ID
PATTERN_GEO_NODE_XREF TRIP_PATTERN_XREF Identifying TRIP_ID,PATTERN_ID,GEO_NODE_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

PAY_TYPE
Definition The types of pay that can be assigned to a work piece to interface with a payroll system.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE PAY_TYPE(
     PAY_ID                numeric(3, 0)     NOT NULL,
     PAY_TYPE_TEXT         varchar(100)      NOT NULL,
     DISPLAY_ORDER         numeric(3, 0)     NULL,
     DEACTIVATION_DATE     datetime          NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKPAY_TYPE PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (PAY_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
PAY_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
PAY_TYPE_TEXT varchar(100) NO The pay factor which identifies the amount of money paid for each hour of service.

1\tPlatform Time
2\tWorking Time
3\tSpread
4\tSpread Bonus
5\tOvertime
6\tOvertime Bonus
7\tPaid Meal Break
8\tOther Paid Break
9\tPaid Travel
10\tSign-on Time
11\tSign-off Time
12\tEarly Shift Bonus
13\tEvening Shift Bonus
14\tNight Shift Bonus
DISPLAY_ORDER numeric(3, 0) YES Override the display order of this item for a list.
DEACTIVATION_DATE datetime YES The date that an item is removed from display within the system (ie. logical delete).

Primary and Unique Keys

PROPERTY_CONFIGURATION
Definition Store locally configurable application constants.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE PROPERTY_CONFIGURATION(
     CONFIGURATION_KEY     varchar(255)       NOT NULL,
     DATA_TYPE             numeric(3, 0)      NOT NULL,
     STRING_PARM           varchar(2000)      NULL,
     DWORD_PARM            numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKPROPERTY_CONFIGURATION PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (CONFIGURATION_KEY)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
CONFIGURATION_KEY varchar(255) NO The attribute, or configurable item name.
DATA_TYPE numeric(3, 0) NO 1 = 1-byte (dword_parm is 0 through 255)
2 = 2-byte (dword_parm is 0 through 65,535)
4 = 4-byte (dword_parm is 0 through 4,294,967,295)
8 = string
STRING_PARM varchar(2000) YES Populated when data_type is 8.
DWORD_PARM numeric(10, 0) YES Populated when data_type is 1, 2, or 4.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKPROPERTY_CONFIGURATION PrimaryKey CONFIGURATION_KEY

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys

Storage

FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

PULL_IN_OUT_SUMMARY
Definition Reporting. This table is sourced from the TMDailyLog..daily_pullout table.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE PULL_IN_OUT_SUMMARY(
     CALENDAR_ID                numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     BLOCK_ID                   numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     SCHEDULED_VEHICLE_ID       numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     ACTUAL_VEHICLE_ID          numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     SCHEDULED_PULLOUT_TIME     numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     ACTUAL_PULLOUT_TIME        numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     SCHEDULED_PULLIN_TIME      numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     ACTUAL_PULLIN_TIME         numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     OVERLOAD_FLAG              varchar(1)         NULL,
     CONSTRAINT [R/548] FOREIGN KEY (CALENDAR_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_CALENDAR(CALENDAR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/549] FOREIGN KEY (BLOCK_ID)
     REFERENCES BLOCK(BLOCK_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/550] FOREIGN KEY (SCHEDULED_VEHICLE_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE(VEHICLE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/551] FOREIGN KEY (ACTUAL_VEHICLE_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE(VEHICLE_ID)
) ON REPORTING_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
CALENDAR_ID numeric(10, 0) NO Service day.
BLOCK_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
SCHEDULED_VEHICLE_ID numeric(5, 0) YES Scheduled vehicle.
ACTUAL_VEHICLE_ID numeric(5, 0) YES Actual vehicle that ran the block.
SCHEDULED_PULLOUT_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES Scheduled pullout time.
ACTUAL_PULLOUT_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES Time that vehicle actually pulled out.
SCHEDULED_PULLIN_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES Scheduled pullin time.
ACTUAL_PULLIN_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES Actual time that vehicle pulled in.
OVERLOAD_FLAG varchar(1) YES Indicates if block is an overload.

0 - No
1 - Yes

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
SERVICE_CALENDAR PULL_IN_OUT_SUMMARY Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
BLOCK PULL_IN_OUT_SUMMARY Non-Identifying BLOCK_ID
VEHICLE PULL_IN_OUT_SUMMARY Non-Identifying SCHEDULED_VEHICLE_ID
VEHICLE PULL_IN_OUT_SUMMARY Non-Identifying ACTUAL_VEHICLE_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP REPORTING_DATA

RADIO_LOAD_TALK_GRP_XREF
Definition
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE RADIO_LOAD_TALK_GRP_XREF(
     LOAD_ID           numeric(3, 0)     NOT NULL,
     TALK_GROUP_ID     numeric(3, 0)     NOT NULL,
     CHANNEL           numeric(7, 0)     NULL,
     UNIT_TO_UNIT      varchar(1)        NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKRADIO_LOAD_TALK_GRP_XREF PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (LOAD_ID,TALK_GROUP_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKRADIO_LOAD_RADIO_LOAD_TGX FOREIGN KEY (LOAD_ID)
     REFERENCES RADIO_LOAD(LOAD_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTALK_GROUP_RADIO_LOAD_TGX FOREIGN KEY (TALK_GROUP_ID)
     REFERENCES TALK_GROUP(TALK_GROUP_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
LOAD_ID numeric(3, 0) NO
TALK_GROUP_ID numeric(3, 0) NO
CHANNEL numeric(7, 0) YES The mobile radio dial position.
UNIT_TO_UNIT varchar(1) YES Identifies this record as the channel to use for \"unit to unit\" talk requests. Only 1 allowed per Radio Load (LOAD_ID).

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKRADIO_LOAD_TALK_GRP_XREF PrimaryKey LOAD_ID,TALK_GROUP_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
RADIO_LOAD RADIO_LOAD_TALK_GRP_XREF Identifying LOAD_ID
TALK_GROUP RADIO_LOAD_TALK_GRP_XREF Identifying TALK_GROUP_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

LATITUDE numeric(12, 0) YES The geographical location of the tower.
RANGE numeric(5, 0) YES The number of feet within which a tower can send/receive a signal.
