ROSTER
Definition The scheduled daily operator assignments.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE ROSTER(
     ROSTER_ID                 numeric(10, 0)     NOT NULL,
     SIGNUP_OPERATOR_ID        numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     ROSTER_DESIGNATOR         varchar(20)        NULL,
     TRANSIT_DIV_ID            numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 1 NOT NULL,
     TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID     numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     ROSTER_NUM                numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKROSTER PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (ROSTER_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKOPERATOR_ROSTER FOREIGN KEY (SIGNUP_OPERATOR_ID)
     REFERENCES OPERATOR(OPERATOR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTRANSIT_DIV_ROSTER FOREIGN KEY (TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
     REFERENCES TRANSIT_DIVISION(TRANSIT_DIV_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTT_VERSION_ROSTER FOREIGN KEY (TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
     REFERENCES TIME_TABLE_VERSION(TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
ROSTER_ID numeric(10, 0) NO An unique number assigned by a transit agency to a weekly assignment.
SIGNUP_OPERATOR_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The unique, system-assigned identifier for an operator record.
ROSTER_DESIGNATOR varchar(20) YES An alpha-numeric identifier of a collection of patterns in a revenue service.
TRANSIT_DIV_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique number associated with the concepts, messages and parts of a schedule including all the messages associated with the scheduling business area.
ROSTER_NUM numeric(10, 0) YES The Trapeze roster number.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKROSTER PrimaryKey ROSTER_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
OPERATOR ROSTER Non-Identifying SIGNUP_OPERATOR_ID
TRANSIT_DIVISION ROSTER Non-Identifying TRANSIT_DIV_ID
TIME_TABLE_VERSION ROSTER Non-Identifying TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID
ROSTER ROSTER_RUN_XREF Identifying ROSTER_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

ROSTER_RUN_XREF
Definition
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE ROSTER_RUN_XREF(
     ROSTER_ID              numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     RUN_ID                 numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     INCL_SUNDAY_IND        numeric(1, 0)      NULL,
     INCL_MONDAY_IND        numeric(1, 0)      NULL,
     INCL_TUESDAY_IND       numeric(1, 0)      NULL,
     INCL_WEDNESDAY_IND     numeric(1, 0)      NULL,
     INCL_THURSDAY_IND      numeric(1, 0)      NULL,
     INCL_FRIDAY_IND        numeric(1, 0)      NULL,
     INCL_SATURDAY_IND      numeric(1, 0)      NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKROSTER_RUN_XREF PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (ROSTER_ID,RUN_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKROSTER_ROSTER_RUN_X FOREIGN KEY (ROSTER_ID)
     REFERENCES ROSTER(ROSTER_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKRUN_ROSTER_RUN_X FOREIGN KEY (RUN_ID)
     REFERENCES RUN(RUN_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
ROSTER_ID numeric(10, 0) NO An unique number assigned by a transit agency to a weekly assignment.
RUN_ID numeric(10, 0) NO Identifies the piece of work for an operator on a given day type or within a particular schedule.
INCL_SUNDAY_IND numeric(1, 0) YES Include this run on Sunday.

0 = no
1 = yes
INCL_MONDAY_IND numeric(1, 0) YES Include this run on Monday.

0 = no
1 = yes
INCL_TUESDAY_IND numeric(1, 0) YES Include this run on Tuesday.

0 = no
1 = yes
INCL_WEDNESDAY_IND numeric(1, 0) YES Include this run on Wednesday.

0 = no
1 = yes
INCL_THURSDAY_IND numeric(1, 0) YES Include this run on Thursday.

0 = no
1 = yes
INCL_FRIDAY_IND numeric(1, 0) YES Include this run on Friday.

0 = no
1 = yes
INCL_SATURDAY_IND numeric(1, 0) YES Include this run on Saturday.

0 = no
1 = yes

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKROSTER_RUN_XREF PrimaryKey ROSTER_ID,RUN_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
ROSTER ROSTER_RUN_XREF Identifying ROSTER_ID
RUN ROSTER_RUN_XREF Identifying RUN_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

ROUTE
Definition Each entry defines a collection of patterns in revenue service.

This is the pretty picture that the public sees in those Pocket
Schedules. It is not always a simple loop or out-and-back. It may have
different paths going out vs coming back, different paths per time of day,
and different end points (like a tree branch fork). Each of these unique
paths between a start and end point on a route is a pattern so a route is a
collection of patterns.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE ROUTE(
     ROUTE_ID                  numeric(5, 0)      NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_GROUP_ID            numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     ROUTE_ABBR                varchar(8)         NULL,
     ROUTE_NAME                varchar(35)        NULL,
     TRANSIT_DIV_ID            numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 1 NOT NULL,
     TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID     numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     ADHERENCE_EARLY_SEC       numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     ADHERENCE_LATE_SEC        numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     REMARK                    varchar(2000)      NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKROUTE PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (ROUTE_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKROUTE_GROUP_ROUTE FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_GROUP_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE_GROUP(ROUTE_GROUP_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTRANSIT_DIV_ROUTE FOREIGN KEY (TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
     REFERENCES TRANSIT_DIVISION(TRANSIT_DIV_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTT_VERSION_ROUTE FOREIGN KEY (TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
     REFERENCES TIME_TABLE_VERSION(TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
ROUTE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ROUTE_GROUP_ID numeric(5, 0) YES Route group, or interline that route is associated with.
ROUTE_ABBR varchar(8) YES An alpha-numeric identifier of a collection of patterns in a revenue service. The publicized route identifer; for example 72.
ROUTE_NAME varchar(35) YES Names a collection of patterns in a revenue service.
TRANSIT_DIV_ID numeric(3, 0) NO Transit division associated with the route.
TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID numeric(5, 0) NO Schedule version.
ADHERENCE_EARLY_SEC numeric(10, 0) YES Route override for schedule adherence.
ADHERENCE_LATE_SEC numeric(10, 0) YES Route override for schedule adherence.
REMARK varchar(2000) YES A free-form text field to record general information about the route.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKROUTE PrimaryKey ROUTE_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
ROUTE_GROUP ROUTE Non-Identifying ROUTE_GROUP_ID
TRANSIT_DIVISION ROUTE Non-Identifying TRANSIT_DIV_ID
TIME_TABLE_VERSION ROUTE Non-Identifying TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID
ROUTE INCIDENT Non-Identifying INCIDENT_ID
ROUTE MDT_FILE Non-Identifying BLOCK_ID
ROUTE MDT_TRANSFER Non-Identifying TRANSFER_OFFSET_ID
ROUTE PATTERN Non-Identifying PATTERN_ID
ROUTE RTE_GEO_NODE_XREF Identifying ROUTE_ID
ROUTE WA_ROLE_ROUTE_XREF Identifying CONFIGURATION_ID
ROUTE ROUTE_GROUP_DIRECTION_XREF Identifying ROUTE_GROUP_ID
ROUTE TIME_POINT_CROSSING Non-Identifying DAILY_TRIP_ID
ROUTE MECHANICAL_WARNING Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
ROUTE COMMUNICATION_SUMMARY Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
ROUTE SCHEDULE_ADHERENCE Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
ROUTE ROUTE_DEVIATION Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
ROUTE SCHEDULE_DEVIATION Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

ROUTE_DEVIATION
Definition Reporting. This table is sourced from MT_DRIVERVIOLATION (msg type 20) messages in the tmdailylog..logged_message table.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE ROUTE_DEVIATION(
     CALENDAR_ID                numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID     int                DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     OPERATOR_ID                numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     VEHICLE_ID                 numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     ROUTE_ID                   numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID         numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     GEO_NODE_ID                numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP          datetime           NULL,
     CONSTRAINT [R/530] FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE(ROUTE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/531] FOREIGN KEY (VEHICLE_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE(VEHICLE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/532] FOREIGN KEY (OPERATOR_ID)
     REFERENCES OPERATOR(OPERATOR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/533] FOREIGN KEY (CALENDAR_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_CALENDAR(CALENDAR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/534] FOREIGN KEY (TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID)
     REFERENCES LOGGED_MESSAGE(TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/535] FOREIGN KEY (GEO_NODE_ID)
     REFERENCES GEO_NODE(GEO_NODE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/536] FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE_DIRECTION(ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID)
) ON REPORTING_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
CALENDAR_ID numeric(10, 0) NO Service day.
TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID int NO The message id.
OPERATOR_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The operator that logged the message.
VEHICLE_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The vehicle that logged the message.
ROUTE_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The logon route.
ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID numeric(3, 0) YES The logon route direction.
GEO_NODE_ID numeric(10, 0) YES The missed node.
MESSAGE_TIMESTAMP datetime YES The message date and time.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
ROUTE ROUTE_DEVIATION Non-Identifying ROUTE_ID
VEHICLE ROUTE_DEVIATION Non-Identifying VEHICLE_ID
OPERATOR ROUTE_DEVIATION Non-Identifying OPERATOR_ID
SERVICE_CALENDAR ROUTE_DEVIATION Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
LOGGED_MESSAGE ROUTE_DEVIATION Non-Identifying TRANSMITTED_MESSAGE_ID
GEO_NODE ROUTE_DEVIATION Non-Identifying GEO_NODE_ID
ROUTE_DIRECTION ROUTE_DEVIATION Non-Identifying ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP REPORTING_DATA

ROUTE_DIRECTION
Definition A set of publicized route directions that will indicate which way a vehicle will travel a route.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE ROUTE_DIRECTION(
     ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID       numeric(3, 0)     NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_DIRECTION_ABBR     varchar(3)        NULL,
     ROUTE_DIRECTION_NAME     varchar(100)      NOT NULL,
     DISPLAY_ORDER            numeric(3, 0)     NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKROUTE_DIRECTION PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ROUTE_DIRECTION_ABBR varchar(3) YES A short, property-assigned text identifier for a route direction that appears on user displays.
ROUTE_DIRECTION_NAME varchar(100) NO A name which describes the direction of a route.

1 N
2 S
3 E
4 W
5 NE
6 NW
7 SE
8 SW
9 Inbound
10 Outbound
11 Circular
12 Destination
13 Clockwise
14 Counter-Clockwise
DISPLAY_ORDER numeric(3, 0) YES Override the display order of this item for a list.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKROUTE_DIRECTION PrimaryKey ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
ROUTE_DIRECTION MDT_ROUTE_DIR Non-Identifying ROUTE_DIR_OFFSET_ID
ROUTE_DIRECTION MDT_FILE Non-Identifying BLOCK_ID
ROUTE_DIRECTION MDT_TRANSFER Non-Identifying TRANSFER_OFFSET_ID
ROUTE_DIRECTION RTE_GEO_NODE_XREF Identifying ROUTE_ID
ROUTE_DIRECTION ROUTE_GROUP_DIRECTION_XREF Identifying ROUTE_GROUP_ID
ROUTE_DIRECTION ROUTE_GROUP_DIRECTION_XREF Identifying ROUTE_GROUP_ID
ROUTE_DIRECTION PATTERN Non-Identifying PATTERN_ID
ROUTE_DIRECTION TIME_POINT_CROSSING Non-Identifying DAILY_TRIP_ID
ROUTE_DIRECTION ROUTE_DEVIATION Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
ROUTE_DIRECTION SIGN_SCHEDULE Non-Identifying SCHEDULE_ID

FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

ROUTE_GROUP
Definition A set of two or more routes that comprise a single publicized route. Also referred to as the Base Route.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE ROUTE_GROUP(
     ROUTE_GROUP_ID            numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     TRANSIT_DIV_ID            numeric(3, 0)     DEFAULT 1 NOT NULL,
     TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID     numeric(5, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     RTE_GROUP_ABBR            varchar(8)        NULL,
     RTE_GROUP_NAME            varchar(100)      NOT NULL,
     REMARK                    varchar(2000)     NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKROUTE_GROUP PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (ROUTE_GROUP_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKTRANSIT_DIV_RTE_GROUP FOREIGN KEY (TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
     REFERENCES TRANSIT_DIVISION(TRANSIT_DIV_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTT_VERSION_RTE_GROUP FOREIGN KEY (TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
     REFERENCES TIME_TABLE_VERSION(TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
ROUTE_GROUP_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TRANSIT_DIV_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique number associated with the concepts, messages and parts of a schedule including all the messages associated with the scheduling business area.
RTE_GROUP_ABBR varchar(8) YES The property assigned abbreviation for the route group.
RTE_GROUP_NAME varchar(100) NO The text description of the route group.
REMARK varchar(2000) YES A free-form text field to record general information about a route group.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKROUTE_GROUP PrimaryKey ROUTE_GROUP_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
TRANSIT_DIVISION ROUTE_GROUP Non-Identifying TRANSIT_DIV_ID
TIME_TABLE_VERSION ROUTE_GROUP Non-Identifying TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID
ROUTE_GROUP BLOCK Non-Identifying BLOCK_ID
ROUTE_GROUP ROUTE Non-Identifying ROUTE_ID
ROUTE_GROUP ROUTE_GROUP_DIRECTION_XREF Identifying ROUTE_GROUP_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

ROUTE_GROUP_DIRECTION_XREF
Definition Controls the order the time points are traveled for a specific route within a base route/interline/route group.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE ROUTE_GROUP_DIRECTION_XREF(
     ROUTE_GROUP_ID               numeric(5, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_GROUP_DIRECTION_ID     numeric(3, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_ID                     numeric(5, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID           numeric(3, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     TIME_POINT_ORDER             varchar(1)        NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKROUTE_GROUP_DIRECTION_XREF PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (ROUTE_GROUP_ID,ROUTE_GROUP_DIRECTION_ID,ROUTE_ID,ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKRTE_DIRECT_RTE_GRP_DIRECT_X1 FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE_DIRECTION(ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKRTE_DIRECT_RTE_GRP_DIRECT_X2 FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_GROUP_DIRECTION_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE_DIRECTION(ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKRTE_GRP_RTE_GRP_DIRECT_X FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_GROUP_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE_GROUP(ROUTE_GROUP_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKRTE_RTE_GRP_DIRECT_X FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE(ROUTE_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
ROUTE_GROUP_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ROUTE_GROUP_DIRECTION_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ROUTE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TIME_POINT_ORDER varchar(1) YES Indicates if the Time Points for the route should be run in forward or reverse order.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKROUTE_GROUP_DIRECTION_XREF PrimaryKey ROUTE_GROUP_ID,ROUTE_GROUP_DIRECTION_ID,ROUTE_ID,ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
ROUTE_DIRECTION ROUTE_GROUP_DIRECTION_XREF Identifying ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID
ROUTE_DIRECTION ROUTE_GROUP_DIRECTION_XREF Identifying ROUTE_GROUP_DIRECTION_ID
ROUTE_GROUP ROUTE_GROUP_DIRECTION_XREF Identifying ROUTE_GROUP_ID
ROUTE ROUTE_GROUP_DIRECTION_XREF Identifying ROUTE_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

ROUTE_PROFILE
Definition Each profile represents a configuration that pertains to a route.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE ROUTE_PROFILE(
     ROUTE_PROFILE_ID            numeric(5, 0)      NOT NULL,
     PROFILE_NAME                varchar(100)       NULL,
     MOVEMENT_ALARM_DISTANCE     numeric(7, 2)      NULL,
     MOVEMENT_RPT_DISTANCE       numeric(7, 2)      NULL,
     XFER_REQ_LOOKAHEAD_TIME     numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     OFF_COURSE_DISTANCE         numeric(7, 2)      NULL,
     ANNOUNCEMENT_DISTANCE       numeric(7, 2)      NULL,
     STOP_CHANGE_DISTANCE        numeric(7, 2)      NULL,
     DEFAULT_SIGN_ROUTE          varchar(20)        NULL,
     EXT_SPKR_ENABLE_TIME        numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     EXT_SPKR_DISABLE_TIME       numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     XFR_MAX_BUS_HOLD_TIME       numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     XFR_MAX_PSGR_WAIT           numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     STD_DEPART_DISTANCE         numeric(7, 2)      NULL,
     LAYOVER_DEPART_DISTANCE     numeric(7, 2)      NULL,
     DEFAULT_CHARTER_ROUTE       varchar(20)        NULL,
     DEFAULT_SPECIAL_ROUTE       varchar(20)        NULL,
     DEFAULT_PARA_ROUTE          varchar(20)        NULL,
     SPEC_MIN_DIFF_ANN_DIST      numeric(7, 2)      NULL,
     SPEC_MIN_SAME_ANN_DIST      numeric(7, 2)      NULL,
     UPDATE_TIMESTAMP            datetime           NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKROUTE_PROFILE PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (ROUTE_PROFILE_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
ROUTE_PROFILE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
PROFILE_NAME varchar(100) YES The text description, or user-assigned identifier for each profile.
MOVEMENT_ALARM_DISTANCE numeric(7, 2) YES eeprom.h 450
MOVEMENT_RPT_DISTANCE numeric(7, 2) YES eeprom.h 451
XFER_REQ_LOOKAHEAD_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES eeprom.h 452
OFF_COURSE_DISTANCE numeric(7, 2) YES eeprom.h 453
ANNOUNCEMENT_DISTANCE numeric(7, 2) YES eeprom.h 454
STOP_CHANGE_DISTANCE numeric(7, 2) YES eeprom.h 455
DEFAULT_SIGN_ROUTE varchar(20) YES Used to force a sign when driver is logged out. (eeprom.h 456)
EXT_SPKR_ENABLE_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES Time to enable external announcements. (eeprom.h 457)
EXT_SPKR_DISABLE_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES Time to disable external announcements. (eeprom.h 458)
XFR_MAX_BUS_HOLD_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES Maximum time to hold a bus for a transfer. (eeprom.h 459)
XFR_MAX_PSGR_WAIT numeric(10, 0) YES Maximum time to allow passenger to wait. (eeprom.h 460)
STD_DEPART_DISTANCE numeric(7, 2) YES Distance to add to the initial distance from a point that must be traveled according to the odometer before allowing the vehicle to depart the point. (eeprom.h 461)
LAYOVER_DEPART_DISTANCE numeric(7, 2) YES Distance to add to the initial distance from a layover point that must be traveled according to the odometer before allowing the vehicle to depart the point. (eeprom.h 462)
DEFAULT_CHARTER_ROUTE varchar(20) YES Headsign for Charter if no route file. (eeprom.h 463)
DEFAULT_SPECIAL_ROUTE varchar(20) YES Headsign for Special if no route file. (eeprom.h 464)
DEFAULT_PARA_ROUTE varchar(20) YES Headsign for Special if no route file. (eeprom.h 465)
SPEC_MIN_DIFF_ANN_DIST numeric(7, 2) YES Minimum distance the vehicle must move before a new announcement can be made again in charter/special mode. (eeprom.h 466)
SPEC_MIN_SAME_ANN_DIST numeric(7, 2) YES Minimum distance the vehicle must move before the same announcement can be made again in charter/special mode. (eeprom.h 467)
UPDATE_TIMESTAMP datetime YES

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKROUTE_PROFILE PrimaryKey ROUTE_PROFILE_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
ROUTE_PROFILE VEHICLE Non-Identifying VEHICLE_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

RTE_GEO_NODE_XREF
Definition This entity stores the logical stop sequence to complete a full route. This is used to build patterns for which trips are ultimately assigned. This also represents the sequence of nodes that will appear across a Headway Report.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE RTE_GEO_NODE_XREF(
     ROUTE_ID                numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     GEO_NODE_ID             numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_STOP_SEQUENCE     numeric(7, 0)      NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID      numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKRTE_GEO_NODE_XREF PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (ROUTE_ID,GEO_NODE_ID,ROUTE_STOP_SEQUENCE,ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKGEO_NODE_RTE_GEO_NODE_X FOREIGN KEY (GEO_NODE_ID)
     REFERENCES GEO_NODE(GEO_NODE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKROUTE_RTE_GEO_NODE_X FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE(ROUTE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKRTE_DIRECT_RTE_GN_X FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE_DIRECTION(ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
ROUTE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
GEO_NODE_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ROUTE_STOP_SEQUENCE numeric(7, 0) NO The order in which stops are made along this route.
ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKRTE_GEO_NODE_XREF PrimaryKey ROUTE_ID,GEO_NODE_ID,ROUTE_STOP_SEQUENCE,ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
GEO_NODE RTE_GEO_NODE_XREF Identifying GEO_NODE_ID
ROUTE RTE_GEO_NODE_XREF Identifying ROUTE_ID
ROUTE_DIRECTION RTE_GEO_NODE_XREF Identifying ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

RUN
Definition Each entry defines the daily pieces of work assigned to a transit employee. This is what the driver does during their shift. This may exactly
match a block, be part of a block (say 2 operators share 10 hour shifts on
a block that lasts 20 hours), or several blocks (4 hours on one block and 4
on another).

Also known as \"Operator Run\", \"Operator Paddle\", or \"Block Paddle\".
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE RUN(
     RUN_ID                    numeric(10, 0)     NOT NULL,
     RUN_DESIGNATOR            varchar(20)        NULL,
     RUN_TYPE_ID               numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     SERVICE_TYPE_ID           numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     TRANSIT_DIV_ID            numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 1 NOT NULL,
     TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID     numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     REMARK                    varchar(2000)      NULL,
     RUN_NUM                   numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKRUN PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (RUN_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKRUN_TYPE_RUN FOREIGN KEY (RUN_TYPE_ID)
     REFERENCES RUN_TYPE(RUN_TYPE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKSERVICE_TYPE_RUN FOREIGN KEY (SERVICE_TYPE_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_TYPE(SERVICE_TYPE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTRANSIT_DIV_RUN FOREIGN KEY (TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
     REFERENCES TRANSIT_DIVISION(TRANSIT_DIV_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTT_VERSION_RUN FOREIGN KEY (TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
     REFERENCES TIME_TABLE_VERSION(TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
RUN_ID numeric(10, 0) NO Identifies the piece of work for an operator on a given day type or within a particular schedule.
RUN_DESIGNATOR varchar(20) YES The alpha-numeric designator of the run.
RUN_TYPE_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
SERVICE_TYPE_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TRANSIT_DIV_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique number associated with the concepts, messages and parts of a schedule including all the messages associated with the scheduling business area.
REMARK varchar(2000) YES A free-form text area to store general or special information about a run.
RUN_NUM numeric(10, 0) YES The Trapeze run number.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKRUN PrimaryKey RUN_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
RUN_TYPE RUN Non-Identifying RUN_TYPE_ID
SERVICE_TYPE RUN Non-Identifying SERVICE_TYPE_ID
TRANSIT_DIVISION RUN Non-Identifying TRANSIT_DIV_ID
TIME_TABLE_VERSION RUN Non-Identifying TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID
RUN DAILY_RUN Non-Identifying DAILY_RUN_ID
RUN ROSTER_RUN_XREF Identifying ROSTER_ID
RUN RUN_SUBSTITUTION Identifying CALENDAR_ID
RUN WORK_PIECE Non-Identifying WORK_PIECE_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

RUN_SUBSTITUTION
Definition Scheduled operator substitution for a specific service day.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE RUN_SUBSTITUTION(
     CALENDAR_ID         numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     RUN_ID              numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     SUB_OPERATOR_ID     numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKRUN_SUBSTITUTION PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (CALENDAR_ID,RUN_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKOPERATOR_RUN_SUBST FOREIGN KEY (SUB_OPERATOR_ID)
     REFERENCES OPERATOR(OPERATOR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKRUN_RUN_SUBSTITUTION FOREIGN KEY (RUN_ID)
     REFERENCES RUN(RUN_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKSERVICE_CAL_RUN_SUBST FOREIGN KEY (CALENDAR_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_CALENDAR(CALENDAR_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
CALENDAR_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
RUN_ID numeric(10, 0) NO Identifies the piece of work for an operator on a given day type or within a particular schedule.
SUB_OPERATOR_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The unique, system-assigned identifier for an operator record.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKRUN_SUBSTITUTION PrimaryKey CALENDAR_ID,RUN_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
OPERATOR RUN_SUBSTITUTION Non-Identifying SUB_OPERATOR_ID
RUN RUN_SUBSTITUTION Identifying RUN_ID
SERVICE_CALENDAR RUN_SUBSTITUTION Identifying CALENDAR_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

RUN_TYPE
Definition Each entry is a text description for the enumerated types for use in displays.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE RUN_TYPE(
     RUN_TYPE_ID       numeric(3, 0)     NOT NULL,
     RUN_TEXT          varchar(100)      NOT NULL,
     DISPLAY_ORDER     numeric(3, 0)     NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKRUN_TYPE PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (RUN_TYPE_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
RUN_TYPE_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
RUN_TEXT varchar(100) NO Type of operator assignment.

1 AM Straight,
2 Midday Straight,
3 PM Straight,
4 Straight,
5 Cleanup,
6 Owl,
7 Regular,
8 Relief,
9 Split,
10 Three Piece (including swing),
11 Tripper,
12 Two Piece (including swing)
DISPLAY_ORDER numeric(3, 0) YES Override the display order of this item for a list.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKRUN_TYPE PrimaryKey RUN_TYPE_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
RUN_TYPE RUN Non-Identifying RUN_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

SCHED_ADHERE_WAIVER
Definition Log of schedule adherence waivers to suppress schedule adherence warning messages during a temporary condition that causes one or more vehicles to be off schedule.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE SCHED_ADHERE_WAIVER(
     WAIVER_ID                 numeric(5, 0)      NOT NULL,
     CALENDAR_ID               numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     EARLY_ALLOWED_FLAG        numeric(1, 0)      NULL,
     LATE_ALLOWED_FLAG         numeric(1, 0)      NULL,
     CREATE_BY_DISPATCH_ID     numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     CREATE_DATETIME           datetime           NULL,
     ENDED_BY_DISPATCH_ID      numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     ENDED_DATE_TIME           datetime           NULL,
     REMARK                    varchar(2000)      NULL,
     UPDATE_TIMESTAMP          datetime           NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKSCHED_ADHERE_WAIVER PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (WAIVER_ID)
     ON DAILYLOG_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKDISPATCH_SCHED_ADH_WAIV1 FOREIGN KEY (CREATE_BY_DISPATCH_ID)
     REFERENCES DISPATCHER(DISPATCHER_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKDISPATCH_SCHED_ADH_WAIV2 FOREIGN KEY (ENDED_BY_DISPATCH_ID)
     REFERENCES DISPATCHER(DISPATCHER_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKSERVICE_CAL_SCHED_ADH_WAIV FOREIGN KEY (CALENDAR_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_CALENDAR(CALENDAR_ID)
) ON DAILYLOG_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
WAIVER_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A counter within the calendar day, or some other arbitrary number to make a unique record key.
CALENDAR_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
EARLY_ALLOWED_FLAG numeric(1, 0) YES Waiver to allow early arrival. Ignore adherence warning message.
LATE_ALLOWED_FLAG numeric(1, 0) YES Waiver to allow late departure. Ignore adherence warning message.
CREATE_BY_DISPATCH_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The unique identifier for each dispatch person.
CREATE_DATETIME datetime YES The date and time that the waiver was created.
ENDED_BY_DISPATCH_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The unique identifier for each dispatch person.
ENDED_DATE_TIME datetime YES The date and time that the waiver is discontinued, or dismissed.
REMARK varchar(2000) YES A free-form comment area for the dispatcher to enter remarks.
UPDATE_TIMESTAMP datetime YES

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKSCHED_ADHERE_WAIVER PrimaryKey WAIVER_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
DISPATCHER SCHED_ADHERE_WAIVER Non-Identifying CREATE_BY_DISPATCH_ID
DISPATCHER SCHED_ADHERE_WAIVER Non-Identifying ENDED_BY_DISPATCH_ID
SERVICE_CALENDAR SCHED_ADHERE_WAIVER Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
SCHED_ADHERE_WAIVER TIME_POINT_CROSSING Non-Identifying DAILY_TRIP_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP DAILYLOG_DATA

SCHEDULE_ADHERENCE
Definition Reporting. This table is sourced from the TMDailyLog..time_point_crossing and related tables.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE SCHEDULE_ADHERENCE(
     CALENDAR_ID       numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     VEHICLE_ID        numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     OPERATOR_ID       numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_ID          numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     BLOCK_ID          numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     EARLY_COUNT       numeric(7, 0)      NOT NULL,
     ON_TIME_COUNT     numeric(7, 0)      NOT NULL,
     LATE_COUNT        numeric(7, 0)      NOT NULL,
     INVALID_COUNT     numeric(7, 0)      NOT NULL,
     CONSTRAINT [R/461] FOREIGN KEY (OPERATOR_ID)
     REFERENCES OPERATOR(OPERATOR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/462] FOREIGN KEY (VEHICLE_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE(VEHICLE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/492] FOREIGN KEY (CALENDAR_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_CALENDAR(CALENDAR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/526] FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE(ROUTE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/540] FOREIGN KEY (BLOCK_ID)
     REFERENCES BLOCK(BLOCK_ID)
) ON REPORTING_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
CALENDAR_ID numeric(10, 0) NO Service day.
VEHICLE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The source vehicle.
OPERATOR_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The operator logged onto the source vehicle.
ROUTE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The logon route.
BLOCK_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
EARLY_COUNT numeric(7, 0) NO Count of records where logged_message.tp_adherence > 0.
ON_TIME_COUNT numeric(7, 0) NO Count of records where logged_message.tp_adherence = 0.
LATE_COUNT numeric(7, 0) NO Count of records where logged_message.tp_adherence <0.
INVALID_COUNT numeric(7, 0) NO Count of records where logged_message.tp_adherence is null.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
OPERATOR SCHEDULE_ADHERENCE Non-Identifying OPERATOR_ID
VEHICLE SCHEDULE_ADHERENCE Non-Identifying VEHICLE_ID
SERVICE_CALENDAR SCHEDULE_ADHERENCE Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
ROUTE SCHEDULE_ADHERENCE Non-Identifying ROUTE_ID
BLOCK SCHEDULE_ADHERENCE Non-Identifying BLOCK_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP REPORTING_DATA

SCHEDULE_DEVIATION
Definition Reporting. This table is sourced from the TMDailyLog..time_point_crossing and related tables.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE SCHEDULE_DEVIATION(
     CALENDAR_ID          numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     OPERATOR_ID          numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     VEHICLE_ID           numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     ROUTE_ID             numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     BLOCK_ID             numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     GEO_NODE_ID          numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     SCHEDULED_TIME       numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     ACT_ARRIVAL_TIME     numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     CONSTRAINT [R/542] FOREIGN KEY (CALENDAR_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_CALENDAR(CALENDAR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/543] FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE(ROUTE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/544] FOREIGN KEY (BLOCK_ID)
     REFERENCES BLOCK(BLOCK_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/545] FOREIGN KEY (VEHICLE_ID)
     REFERENCES VEHICLE(VEHICLE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/546] FOREIGN KEY (OPERATOR_ID)
     REFERENCES OPERATOR(OPERATOR_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/547] FOREIGN KEY (GEO_NODE_ID)
     REFERENCES GEO_NODE(GEO_NODE_ID)
) ON REPORTING_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
CALENDAR_ID numeric(10, 0) NO Service day.
OPERATOR_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The operator that logged the message.
VEHICLE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The vehicle that logged the message.
ROUTE_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The logon route.
BLOCK_ID numeric(10, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
GEO_NODE_ID numeric(10, 0) YES The node where the deviation occurred.
SCHEDULED_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES Scheduled arrival time at the node.
ACT_ARRIVAL_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES Actual arrival time at the node.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
SERVICE_CALENDAR SCHEDULE_DEVIATION Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID
ROUTE SCHEDULE_DEVIATION Non-Identifying ROUTE_ID
BLOCK SCHEDULE_DEVIATION Non-Identifying BLOCK_ID
VEHICLE SCHEDULE_DEVIATION Non-Identifying VEHICLE_ID
OPERATOR SCHEDULE_DEVIATION Non-Identifying OPERATOR_ID
GEO_NODE SCHEDULE_DEVIATION Non-Identifying GEO_NODE_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP REPORTING_DATA

     TEXT_ID             numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     TEXT_TO_SCROLL      varchar(256)      NULL,
     BEGIN_DATE_TIME     datetime          NULL,
     END_DATE_TIME       datetime          NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKSCROLLING_TEXT PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (TEXT_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition

END_DATE_TIME datetime YES The date and time a scrolling text message should end.

Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE SERVICE_CALENDAR(
     CALENDAR_ID        numeric(10, 0)     NOT NULL,
     TRANSIT_DIV_ID     numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 1 NULL,

     CONSTRAINT XPKSERVICE_CALENDAR PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (CALENDAR_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKTRANSIT_DIV_SERVICE_CAL FOREIGN KEY (TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
     REFERENCES TRANSIT_DIVISION(TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
CALENDAR_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TRANSIT_DIV_ID numeric(3, 0) YES The transit division associated with the calendar.
CALENDAR_DATE datetime NO The service, or calendar date. The time portion of this column should be midnight (00:00:00).

     SERVICE_TYPE_ID     numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,

     REFERENCES SERVICE_TYPE(SERVICE_TYPE_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA

SERVICE_TYPE
Definition A collection of categories that define the levels of service defined for a public transportation operation.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE SERVICE_TYPE(
     SERVICE_TYPE_ID       numeric(3, 0)     NOT NULL,
     SERVICE_ABBR          varchar(8)        NULL,
     SERVICE_TYPE_TEXT     varchar(100)      NOT NULL,
     DISPLAY_ORDER         numeric(3, 0)     NULL,
     DEACTIVATION_DATE     datetime          NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKSERVICE_TYPE PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (SERVICE_TYPE_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
SERVICE_TYPE_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
SERVICE_ABBR varchar(8) YES
SERVICE_TYPE_TEXT varchar(100) NO The schedule that will be run. Examples:

1 Sunday
2 Monday
3 Tuesday
4 Wednesday
5 Thursday
6 Friday
7 Saturday
8 Holiday
9 Weekday
10 Weekend
11 Weekday, school closed
DISPLAY_ORDER numeric(3, 0) YES Override the display order of this item for a list.
DEACTIVATION_DATE datetime YES The date that an item is removed from display within the system (ie. logical delete).

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKSERVICE_TYPE PrimaryKey SERVICE_TYPE_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
SERVICE_TYPE MDT_TRANSFER Non-Identifying TRANSFER_OFFSET_ID
SERVICE_TYPE BLOCK Non-Identifying BLOCK_ID
SERVICE_TYPE RUN Non-Identifying RUN_ID
SERVICE_TYPE SERVICE_SELECTION Identifying CALENDAR_ID
SERVICE_TYPE TIME_OF_DAY Non-Identifying TIME_OF_DAY_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

SHAPE_POINT
Definition This table details the map shape points for each geo node interval, or segment.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE SHAPE_POINT(
     INTERVAL_ID     numeric(5, 0)      NOT NULL,
     UNIQUE_ID       numeric(5, 0)      NOT NULL,
     LATITUDE        numeric(12, 0)     NULL,
     LONGITUDE       numeric(12, 0)     NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKSHAPE_POINT PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (INTERVAL_ID,UNIQUE_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKGEO_NODE_INTRV_SHAPE_PT FOREIGN KEY (INTERVAL_ID)
     REFERENCES GEO_NODE_INTERVAL(INTERVAL_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
INTERVAL_ID numeric(5, 0) NO Identifies a unique path between two time points.
UNIQUE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
LATITUDE numeric(12, 0) YES The latitude reading for this point.
LONGITUDE numeric(12, 0) YES The longitude reading for this point.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKSHAPE_POINT PrimaryKey INTERVAL_ID,UNIQUE_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
GEO_NODE_INTERVAL SHAPE_POINT Identifying INTERVAL_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

SIGN_DISPLAY
Definition
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE SIGN_DISPLAY(
     SIGN_ID              numeric(7, 0)     NOT NULL,
     SIGN_NAME            varchar(20)       NULL,
     ADHERENCE_WINDOW     smallint          NULL,
     AUTO_UPDATE          smallint          NULL,
     REPEAT               smallint          NULL,
     RESEND_INTERVAL      smallint          NULL,
     ROUTE_LOOK_AHEAD     smallint          NULL,
     SERVER_LOGGING       smallint          NULL,
     SIGN_UPDATE          smallint          NULL,
     TDMA_CHANNEL         smallint          NULL,
     TIME_FORMAT          varchar(20)       NULL,
     TIME_INTERVAL        smallint          NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKSIGN_DISPLAY PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (SIGN_ID)
)
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
SIGN_ID numeric(7, 0) NO
SIGN_NAME varchar(20) YES
ADHERENCE_WINDOW smallint YES
AUTO_UPDATE smallint YES
REPEAT smallint YES
RESEND_INTERVAL smallint YES
ROUTE_LOOK_AHEAD smallint YES
SERVER_LOGGING smallint YES
SIGN_UPDATE smallint YES
TDMA_CHANNEL smallint YES

TIME_INTERVAL smallint YES

Key Name Key Type Keys

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys

FILEGROUP

SIGN_SCHEDULE
Definition
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE SIGN_SCHEDULE(
     SCHEDULE_ID               numeric(7, 0)      NOT NULL,
     SIGN_ID                   numeric(7, 0)      NOT NULL,
     USER_MESSAGE_ID           numeric(7, 0)      NOT NULL,
     TIME_POINT_ID             numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID        numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     DIRECTION_FILTER_FLAG     numeric(1, 0)      NULL,
     SCHEDULED_START_TIME      numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     SCHEDULED_DURATION        numeric(7, 0)      NULL,
     SCHEDULE_FLAGS            varchar(20)        NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKSIGN_SCHEDULE PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (SCHEDULE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/575] FOREIGN KEY (SIGN_ID)
     REFERENCES SIGN_DISPLAY(SIGN_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/576] FOREIGN KEY (USER_MESSAGE_ID)
     REFERENCES USER_MESSAGE(USER_MESSAGE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/577] FOREIGN KEY (TIME_POINT_ID)
     REFERENCES TIME_POINT(TIME_POINT_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/578] FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE_DIRECTION(ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID)
)
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
SCHEDULE_ID numeric(7, 0) NO
SIGN_ID numeric(7, 0) NO
USER_MESSAGE_ID numeric(7, 0) NO
TIME_POINT_ID numeric(5, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID numeric(3, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
DIRECTION_FILTER_FLAG numeric(1, 0) YES
SCHEDULED_START_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES
SCHEDULED_DURATION numeric(7, 0) YES
SCHEDULE_FLAGS varchar(20) YES

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKSIGN_SCHEDULE PrimaryKey SCHEDULE_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
SIGN_DISPLAY SIGN_SCHEDULE Non-Identifying SIGN_ID
USER_MESSAGE SIGN_SCHEDULE Non-Identifying USER_MESSAGE_ID
TIME_POINT SIGN_SCHEDULE Non-Identifying TIME_POINT_ID
ROUTE_DIRECTION SIGN_SCHEDULE Non-Identifying ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP

Definition A list of locations used for staging a group of buses.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE STAGING_AREA(
     STAGING_AREA_ID       numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     STAGING_AREA_TEXT     varchar(100)      NULL,

     ON DAILYLOG_INDX
) ON DAILYLOG_DATA
go

ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition

STAGING_AREA_TEXT varchar(100) YES The text description of the staging area that is seen by the user.

     LONGITUDE        numeric(12, 0)     NULL,

     MAP_CASE         varchar(3)         NULL,

) ON MAIN_DATA

STAGING_TRAP_SCHEDVIEW
Definition Used to integrate the Trapeze Fx databases views and to make the
schedule merge more robust.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE STAGING_TRAP_SCHEDVIEW(
     BLOCK_NUM              int             NULL,
     BLOCK_NAME             varchar(8)      NULL,
     SERVICE_ABBR           varchar(8)      NULL,
     SERVICE_NAME           varchar(30)     NULL,
     SERVICE_GROUP_NAME     varchar(30)     NULL,
     LINE_ABBR              varchar(8)      NULL,
     LINE_NAME              varchar(30)     NULL,
     LINE_GROUP_ABBR        varchar(8)      NULL,
     TIME                   int             NULL,
     NODE_ABBR              varchar(20)     NULL,
     STOP_ABBR              varchar(20)     NULL,
     LINE_DIR_NAME          varchar(15)     NULL,
     PATTERN_NAME           varchar(15)     NULL,
     TRIP_NUM               int             NULL,
     STOP_SEQUENCE          int             NULL,
     RUN_NUM                int             NULL,
     SIGNUP_NAME            varchar(30)     NULL,
     STOP_NUMBER            int             NULL,
     PATTERN_DISTANCE       float           NULL,
     TIME_POINT_FLAG        varchar(1)      NULL,
     NODE_LABEL             varchar(8)      NULL,
     BEFORE_LINE            varchar(30)     NULL,
     AFTER_LINE             varchar(30)     NULL,
     STOP_FLAG              smallint        NULL,
     ADD_DISTANCE           float           NULL
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
BLOCK_NUM int YES
BLOCK_NAME varchar(8) YES
SERVICE_ABBR varchar(8) YES
SERVICE_NAME varchar(30) YES
SERVICE_GROUP_NAME varchar(30) YES
LINE_ABBR varchar(8) YES
LINE_NAME varchar(30) YES
LINE_GROUP_ABBR varchar(8) YES
TIME int YES
NODE_ABBR varchar(20) YES
STOP_ABBR varchar(20) YES
LINE_DIR_NAME varchar(15) YES
PATTERN_NAME varchar(15) YES
TRIP_NUM int YES
STOP_SEQUENCE int YES
RUN_NUM int YES
SIGNUP_NAME varchar(30) YES
STOP_NUMBER int YES
PATTERN_DISTANCE float YES
TIME_POINT_FLAG varchar(1) YES
NODE_LABEL varchar(8) YES
BEFORE_LINE varchar(30) YES
AFTER_LINE varchar(30) YES
STOP_FLAG smallint YES
ADD_DISTANCE float YES

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XIE1STAGING_TRAP_SCHEDVIEW Index BLOCK_NUM,SERVICE_ABBR,LINE_GROUP_ABBR,TRIP_NUM
XIE2STAGING_TRAP_SCHEDVIEW Index SERVICE_ABBR
XIE3STAGING_TRAP_SCHEDVIEW Index RUN_NUM
XIE4STAGING_TRAP_SCHEDVIEW Index BLOCK_NUM
XIE5STAGING_TRAP_SCHEDVIEW Index STOP_SEQUENCE

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

STAGING_TRAP_STOPVIEW
Definition Used to integrate the Trapeze Fx databases views and to make the
schedule merge more robust.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE STAGING_TRAP_STOPVIEW(
     ALIAS_ID          int             NULL,
     NODE_NAME         varchar(35)     NULL,
     NODE_ABBR         varchar(8)      NULL,
     STOP_NAME         varchar(35)     NULL,
     STOP_ABBR         varchar(8)      NULL,
     GPS_LATITUDE      int             NULL,
     GPS_LONGITUDE     int             NULL,

     PREFERRED         smallint        NULL,

     SHELTER           smallint        NULL,
     LIGHTING          smallint        NULL,
     GARBAGE           smallint        NULL,
     SIGNPOST          smallint        NULL,
     BICYCLE           smallint        NULL,

     USERSTRING1       varchar(30)     NULL,
     USERSTRING2       varchar(30)     NULL,
     USERSTRING3       varchar(30)     NULL,
     USERSTRING4       varchar(30)     NULL,
     USERSTRING5       varchar(30)     NULL,

     USERSTRING7       varchar(30)     NULL,
     USERSTRING8       varchar(30)     NULL,

) ON MAIN_DATA

STOP_FEATURE
Definition A list of features typcially associated with a bus stop.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE STOP_FEATURE(
     STOP_FEATURE_ID         numeric(3, 0)     NOT NULL,
     STOP_FEATURE_CAT_ID     numeric(3, 0)     NULL,
     STOP_FEATURE_TEXT       varchar(100)      NOT NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKSTOP_FEATURE PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (STOP_FEATURE_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKSTOP_FEAT_CAT_STOP_FEAT FOREIGN KEY (STOP_FEATURE_CAT_ID)
     REFERENCES STOP_FEATURE_CATEGORY(STOP_FEATURE_CAT_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
STOP_FEATURE_ID numeric(3, 0) NO The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
STOP_FEATURE_CAT_ID numeric(3, 0) YES The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
STOP_FEATURE_TEXT varchar(100) NO A feature, facility, or provision at a stop.

Ex. Bench, wind shelter, vending machines

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKSTOP_FEATURE PrimaryKey STOP_FEATURE_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys

STOP_FEATURE STOP_FEATURE_XREF Identifying GEO_NODE_ID

FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

STOP_FEATURE_XREF
Definition Association of one or more features to a bus stop.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE STOP_FEATURE_XREF(
     GEO_NODE_ID         numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     STOP_FEATURE_ID     numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKSTOP_FEATURE_XREF PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (GEO_NODE_ID,STOP_FEATURE_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKGEO_NODE_STOP_FEATURE_X FOREIGN KEY (GEO_NODE_ID)
     REFERENCES GEO_NODE(GEO_NODE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKSTOP_FEAT_STOP_FEAT_X FOREIGN KEY (STOP_FEATURE_ID)
     REFERENCES STOP_FEATURE(STOP_FEATURE_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition

STOP_FEATURE_ID numeric(3, 0) NO The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.

SUMMARY_CONTROL
Definition This table documents the date and time that each reporting table was loaded for a given day.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE SUMMARY_CONTROL(
     CALENDAR_ID                  numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     DAILY_MESSAGE_TEXT           datetime           NULL,
     MDT_SOFTWARE_VERSION_RPT     datetime           NULL,
     SCHEDULE_ADHERENCE           datetime           NULL,
     DRIVER_LOGON                 datetime           NULL,
     MECHANICAL_WARNING           datetime           NULL,
     ROUTE_DEVIATION              datetime           NULL,
     SCHEDULE_DEVIATION           datetime           NULL,
     DRIVER_VIOLATION             datetime           NULL,
     COMMUNICATION_SUMMARY        datetime           NULL,
     PULL_IN_OUT_SUMMARY          datetime           NULL,
     VEHICLE_MILES_HOURS          datetime           NULL,
     PASSENGER_COUNT              datetime           NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKSUMMARY_CONTROL PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (CALENDAR_ID)
     ON REPORTING_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT [R/541] FOREIGN KEY (CALENDAR_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_CALENDAR(CALENDAR_ID)
) ON REPORTING_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
CALENDAR_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
DAILY_MESSAGE_TEXT datetime YES Date and time stamp when the summary was completed.
MDT_SOFTWARE_VERSION_RPT datetime YES Date and time stamp when the summary was completed.
SCHEDULE_ADHERENCE datetime YES Date and time stamp when the summary was completed.
DRIVER_LOGON datetime YES Date and time stamp when the summary was completed.
MECHANICAL_WARNING datetime YES Date and time stamp when the summary was completed.
ROUTE_DEVIATION datetime YES Date and time stamp when the summary was completed.
SCHEDULE_DEVIATION datetime YES Date and time stamp when the summary was completed.
DRIVER_VIOLATION datetime YES Date and time stamp when the summary was completed.
COMMUNICATION_SUMMARY datetime YES Date and time stamp when the summary was completed.
PULL_IN_OUT_SUMMARY datetime YES Date and time stamp when the summary was completed.
VEHICLE_MILES_HOURS datetime YES Date and time stamp when the summary was completed.
PASSENGER_COUNT datetime YES Date and time stamp when the summary was completed.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKSUMMARY_CONTROL PrimaryKey CALENDAR_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
SERVICE_CALENDAR SUMMARY_CONTROL Identifying CALENDAR_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP REPORTING_DATA

TASK_INTERPRETATION
Definition Provides information to the Maintenance Program about how to use the mileage and operation days fields in the Maintenance Task record. This entity is part of the GUI infrastructure and never seen by the user.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE TASK_INTERPRETATION(
     TASK_INTERPRETATION_ID       numeric(3, 0)     NOT NULL,
     TASK_INTERPRETATION_TEXT     varchar(100)      NOT NULL,
     DISPLAY_ORDER                numeric(3, 0)     NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKTASK_INTERPRETATION PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (TASK_INTERPRETATION_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
TASK_INTERPRETATION_ID numeric(3, 0) NO The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TASK_INTERPRETATION_TEXT varchar(100) NO Provide information to the program about how to use the mileage and day fields in the task records.
DISPLAY_ORDER numeric(3, 0) YES Override the display order of this item for a list.

TELEPHONE_DIRECTORY
Definition A list of contacts maintained by the transit company.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE TELEPHONE_DIRECTORY(
     TEL_DIR_ID              numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     LAST_NAME               varchar(20)       NULL,
     FIRST_NAME              varchar(20)       NULL,
     MIDDLE_NAME             varchar(20)       NULL,
     COMPANY_NAME            varchar(30)       NULL,
     TELEPHONE_NUMBER        varchar(20)       NULL,
     FAX_NUMBER              varchar(20)       NULL,
     MOBILE_NUMBER           varchar(20)       NULL,
     PAGER_NUMBER            varchar(20)       NULL,
     GENERAL_INFORMATION     varchar(2000)     NULL,
     PRIORITY                numeric(5, 0)     NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKTELEPHONE_DIRECTORY PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (TEL_DIR_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
TEL_DIR_ID numeric(5, 0) NO The unique, system-assigned number for this entry.
LAST_NAME varchar(20) YES The last name of this person. Required.
FIRST_NAME varchar(20) YES The first name of this person. Required.
MIDDLE_NAME varchar(20) YES The middle name or inital of this person. Optional.
COMPANY_NAME varchar(30) YES The company this person is employed by, or represents.
TELEPHONE_NUMBER varchar(20) YES The residential or business number to contact this person.
FAX_NUMBER varchar(20) YES The number to send a fax to this person.
MOBILE_NUMBER varchar(20) YES The cellular or wireless number to call to contact this person.
PAGER_NUMBER varchar(20) YES The number to dial to page this person.
GENERAL_INFORMATION varchar(2000) YES Free-form text area to enter additional information regarding this entry.
PRIORITY numeric(5, 0) YES The order of people to call in an emergency.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKTELEPHONE_DIRECTORY PrimaryKey TEL_DIR_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys

Storage

FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

TIME_OF_DAY
Definition Categories of the time of day as is relates to passenger count.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE TIME_OF_DAY(
     TIME_OF_DAY_ID        numeric(3, 0)      NOT NULL,
     SERVICE_TYPE_ID       numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     TIME_OF_DAY_TEXT      varchar(100)       NOT NULL,
     START_TIME            numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     END_TIME              numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     EARLY_ALLOWED_IND     varchar(1)         NULL,
     LATE_ALLOWED_IND      varchar(1)         NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKTIME_OF_DAY PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (TIME_OF_DAY_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKSERVICE_TYPE_TIME_OF_DAY FOREIGN KEY (SERVICE_TYPE_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_TYPE(SERVICE_TYPE_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
TIME_OF_DAY_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
SERVICE_TYPE_ID numeric(3, 0) NO Service type associated with the time of day.
TIME_OF_DAY_TEXT varchar(100) NO Time of day text. Examples: AM Peak, AM Off-Peak, PM Peak, PM Off-Peak, Evening
START_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES Boundary value expressed in seconds after midnight.
END_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES Boundary value expressed in seconds after midnight.
EARLY_ALLOWED_IND varchar(1) YES 'Y' if vehicle is allowed to arrive early at a time point.
LATE_ALLOWED_IND varchar(1) YES 'Y' if late departure from a time point is permitted.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKTIME_OF_DAY PrimaryKey TIME_OF_DAY_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
SERVICE_TYPE TIME_OF_DAY Non-Identifying SERVICE_TYPE_ID
TIME_OF_DAY GEO_INTERVAL_TOD_XREF Identifying INTERVAL_ID
TIME_OF_DAY TIME_POINT_CROSSING Non-Identifying DAILY_TRIP_ID
TIME_OF_DAY PASSENGER_COUNT Non-Identifying PASSENGER_COUNT_ID

Storage

FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

TIME_OUT_PROFILE
Definition Each record represents a configuration profile pertaining to time outs.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE TIME_OUT_PROFILE(
     TO_PROFILE_ID                numeric(5, 0)      NOT NULL,
     PROFILE_NAME                 varchar(20)        NULL,
     POWER_DOWN_TIMEOUT           numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     LOGOUT_DISPLAY_TIME          numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     CALL_SESSION_TIMEOUT         numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     DRIVER_IND_CALL_TIMEOUT      numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     TRANSMIT_SESSION_TIMEOUT     numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     NETWORK_NOTIFY_TIMEOUT       numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     FALLBACK_MODE_TIMEOUT        numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     RETURN_TO_NET_TIMEOUT        numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     RETURN_TO_NET_RETRY          numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     PA_SWITCH_TIMEOUT            numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     FALLBACK_VOICE_TIMER         numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     SUPERVISOR_SEND_TIMEOUT      numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     VOICE_ACK_RQD_TO             numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     VOICE_ACK_BEEP_INTERVAL      numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     SUPER_LOC_RPT_INTERVAL       numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     GPS_NO_SIG_WAIT              numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     GPS_RESET_RETRY_WAIT         numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     GPS_NO_NAV_WAIT              numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     DR_INIT_WAIT                 numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     LUM_ANUN_FAIL_WAIT           numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     UPDATE_TIMESTAMP             datetime           NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKTIME_OUT_PROFILE PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (TO_PROFILE_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
TO_PROFILE_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
PROFILE_NAME varchar(20) YES The text description, or user-assigned identifier for a profile.
POWER_DOWN_TIMEOUT numeric(10, 0) YES Time on after ignition off (seconds). (eeprom.h 550)
LOGOUT_DISPLAY_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES Seconds after ignition off to display logout message. (eeprom.h 551)
CALL_SESSION_TIMEOUT numeric(10, 0) YES Dispatch to MDT timeout. (eeprom.h 552)
DRIVER_IND_CALL_TIMEOUT numeric(10, 0) YES (eeprom.h 553)
TRANSMIT_SESSION_TIMEOUT numeric(10, 0) YES MDT to Dispatch timeout. (eeprom.h 554)
NETWORK_NOTIFY_TIMEOUT numeric(10, 0) YES Network logout notification wait. (eeprom.h 555)
FALLBACK_MODE_TIMEOUT numeric(10, 0) YES Network logout notification. (eeprom.h 556)
RETURN_TO_NET_TIMEOUT numeric(10, 0) YES ReturnToNet message wait. (eeprom.h 557)
RETURN_TO_NET_RETRY numeric(10, 0) YES ReturnToNet retry wait. (eeprom.h 558)
PA_SWITCH_TIMEOUT numeric(10, 0) YES Delay before disabling Gooseneck switch. (eeprom.h 559)
FALLBACK_VOICE_TIMER numeric(10, 0) YES Seconds on voice channel bfore data check in AATA FB. (eeprom.h 560)
SUPERVISOR_SEND_TIMEOUT numeric(10, 0) YES Seconds on supervisor data channel to send messages. (eeprom.h 561)
VOICE_ACK_RQD_TO numeric(10, 0) YES Seconds for the VoiceAck required prompt to remain. (eeprom.h 562)
VOICE_ACK_BEEP_INTERVAL numeric(10, 0) YES Seconds between beeps if VoiceAck is required. (eeprom.h 563)
SUPER_LOC_RPT_INTERVAL numeric(10, 0) YES Seconds to wait before returning to datamode and reporting supervisor location. (eeprom.h 564)
GPS_NO_SIG_WAIT numeric(10, 0) YES Seconds to wait before resetting dead GPS. (eeprom.h 565)
GPS_RESET_RETRY_WAIT numeric(10, 0) YES Seconds to wait between resets of GPS. (eeprom.h 566)
GPS_NO_NAV_WAIT numeric(10, 0) YES Seconds to wait before reset of not navigating GPS. (eeprom.h 567)
DR_INIT_WAIT numeric(10, 0) YES Seconds to wait before reset of not navigating GPS. (eeprom.h 568)
LUM_ANUN_FAIL_WAIT numeric(10, 0) YES Seconds to wait before fail of LVA announcement. (eeprom.h 569)
UPDATE_TIMESTAMP datetime YES

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKTIME_OUT_PROFILE PrimaryKey TO_PROFILE_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
TIME_OUT_PROFILE VEHICLE Non-Identifying VEHICLE_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

TIME_POINT
Definition The logical entity that is defined for one or more stops on a route. The time associated with the time point appears on the publicized route schedule and is used to calculate schedule adherence for each driver.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE TIME_POINT(
     TIME_POINT_ID          numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     TRANSIT_DIV_ID         numeric(3, 0)     DEFAULT 1 NOT NULL,
     TIME_POINT_ABBR        varchar(8)        NULL,
     TIME_PT_SHORT_NAME     varchar(35)       NULL,
     TIME_PT_LONG_NAME      varchar(100)      NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKTIME_POINT PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (TIME_POINT_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKTRANSIT_DIV_TIME_POINT FOREIGN KEY (TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
     REFERENCES TRANSIT_DIVISION(TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
TIME_POINT_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TRANSIT_DIV_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TIME_POINT_ABBR varchar(8) YES The property abbreviation assigned to the time point.
TIME_PT_SHORT_NAME varchar(35) YES The short text name for the time point.
TIME_PT_LONG_NAME varchar(100) YES The long text name for the time point.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKTIME_POINT PrimaryKey TIME_POINT_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
TRANSIT_DIVISION TIME_POINT Non-Identifying TRANSIT_DIV_ID
TIME_POINT GEO_NODE_TIME_PT_XREF Identifying GEO_NODE_ID
TIME_POINT SIGN_SCHEDULE Non-Identifying SCHEDULE_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

TIME_POINT_ATTRIBUTE
Definition Each entry is a text description for the enumerated types for use in displays.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE TIME_POINT_ATTRIBUTE(
     TIME_POINT_ATTRIB_ID       numeric(3, 0)     NOT NULL,
     TIME_POINT_ATTRIB_TEXT     varchar(100)      NOT NULL,
     DISPLAY_ORDER              numeric(3, 0)     NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKTIME_POINT_ATTRIBUTE PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (TIME_POINT_ATTRIB_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
TIME_POINT_ATTRIB_ID numeric(3, 0) NO The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TIME_POINT_ATTRIB_TEXT varchar(100) NO Time Point category. Examples:

1 Layover
2 Relief
3 Control
4 Transfer
5 Recovery
6 Pull in
7 Pull out
8 Maximum load point
9 Arrive
10 Depart
11 Schedule Adherence On
12 Schedule Adherence Off
13 Route Adherence On
14 Route Adherence Off
15 Deadhead
16 Road Test


DISPLAY_ORDER numeric(3, 0) YES Override the display order of this item for a list.

Primary and Unique Keys

TIME_POINT_CROSSING
Definition The daily schedule where actual information is plugged in by TMCalc as it becomes available.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE TIME_POINT_CROSSING(
     DAILY_TRIP_ID              numeric(10, 0)     NOT NULL,
     UNIQUE_ID                  numeric(15, 0)     NOT NULL,
     CALENDAR_ID                numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     TIME_OF_DAY_ID             numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     ROUTE_ID                   numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID         numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     PATTERN_ID                 numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     GEO_NODE_ID                numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     STOP_OFFSET                numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     SCHEDULED_TIME             numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     ACT_ARRIVAL_TIME           numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     ACT_DEPARTURE_TIME         numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     ODOMETER                   numeric(7, 0)      NULL,
     PLANNED_ADH_WAIVER_IND     varchar(1)         NULL,
     ADHERENCE_WAIVER           varchar(8)         NULL,
     WAIVER_ID                  numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     UPDATE_TIMESTAMP           datetime           NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKTIME_POINT_CROSSING PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED (DAILY_TRIP_ID,UNIQUE_ID)
     ON DAILYLOG_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKDAILY_TRIP_TIME_POINT_X FOREIGN KEY (DAILY_TRIP_ID)
     REFERENCES DAILY_TRIP(DAILY_TRIP_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKSCHED_ADH_WAIV_TIME_PT_X FOREIGN KEY (WAIVER_ID)
     REFERENCES SCHED_ADHERE_WAIVER(WAIVER_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/401] FOREIGN KEY (GEO_NODE_ID)
     REFERENCES GEO_NODE(GEO_NODE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/402] FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE(ROUTE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/404] FOREIGN KEY (TIME_OF_DAY_ID)
     REFERENCES TIME_OF_DAY(TIME_OF_DAY_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/405] FOREIGN KEY (ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID)
     REFERENCES ROUTE_DIRECTION(ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/409] FOREIGN KEY (PATTERN_ID)
     REFERENCES PATTERN(PATTERN_ID),
     CONSTRAINT [R/494] FOREIGN KEY (CALENDAR_ID)
     REFERENCES SERVICE_CALENDAR(CALENDAR_ID)
) ON DAILYLOG_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
DAILY_TRIP_ID numeric(10, 0) NO The service day associated with this time point crossing.
UNIQUE_ID numeric(15, 0) NO A system-assigned value to form a unique primary key.
CALENDAR_ID numeric(10, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TIME_OF_DAY_ID numeric(3, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ROUTE_ID numeric(5, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID numeric(3, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
PATTERN_ID numeric(10, 0) YES A unique identifier assigned by a transit agency for a defined sequence of points, events and activation events along a variation of a route.
GEO_NODE_ID numeric(10, 0) YES A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
STOP_OFFSET numeric(5, 0) YES
SCHEDULED_TIME numeric(5, 0) YES For the MDT file.
ACT_ARRIVAL_TIME numeric(5, 0) YES The arrival time at the time point. Recorded by TMCalc.
ACT_DEPARTURE_TIME numeric(5, 0) YES The actual departure time. Recorded by TMCalc.
ODOMETER numeric(7, 0) YES The odometer reading at this time point crossing. Recorded by TMCalc.
PLANNED_ADH_WAIVER_IND varchar(1) YES
ADHERENCE_WAIVER varchar(8) YES Planned (scheduled exception) or Dispatcher
WAIVER_ID numeric(5, 0) YES A counter within the calendar day, or some other arbitrary number to make a unique record key.
UPDATE_TIMESTAMP datetime YES

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKTIME_POINT_CROSSING PrimaryKey DAILY_TRIP_ID,UNIQUE_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
DAILY_TRIP TIME_POINT_CROSSING Identifying DAILY_TRIP_ID
SCHED_ADHERE_WAIVER TIME_POINT_CROSSING Non-Identifying WAIVER_ID
GEO_NODE TIME_POINT_CROSSING Non-Identifying GEO_NODE_ID
ROUTE TIME_POINT_CROSSING Non-Identifying ROUTE_ID
TIME_OF_DAY TIME_POINT_CROSSING Non-Identifying TIME_OF_DAY_ID
ROUTE_DIRECTION TIME_POINT_CROSSING Non-Identifying ROUTE_DIRECTION_ID
PATTERN TIME_POINT_CROSSING Non-Identifying PATTERN_ID
SERVICE_CALENDAR TIME_POINT_CROSSING Non-Identifying CALENDAR_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP DAILYLOG_DATA

TIME_TABLE_VERSION
Definition Each entry defines a version of a timetable generated by the scheduling/runcutting module.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE TIME_TABLE_VERSION(
     TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID       numeric(5, 0)     NOT NULL,
     TIME_TABLE_VERSION_NAME     varchar(20)       NULL,
     SIGNUP_DATE                 datetime          NULL,
     ACTIVATION_DATE             datetime          NULL,
     DEACTIVATION_DATE           datetime          NULL,
     ROUTES_MERGED               numeric(1, 0)     NULL,
     SCHEDULES_MERGED            numeric(1, 0)     NULL,
     ROUTE_VERSION               numeric(8, 0)     NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKTIME_TABLE_VERSION PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID numeric(5, 0) NO A unique number associated with the concepts, messages and parts of a schedule including all the messages associated with the scheduling business area.
TIME_TABLE_VERSION_NAME varchar(20) YES Name of a time table, e.g., \"summer\".
SIGNUP_DATE datetime YES The signup date associated with a version of the schedule. Typically this will occur quarterly.
ACTIVATION_DATE datetime YES The date a public transportation staff, service, facility or asset is placed in service, becomes operational or is registered. This may refer to a Stop Point, timetable, roster, operator logon, equipment installation, etc.
DEACTIVATION_DATE datetime YES The date a public transportation person, place or thing is taken out of service, decommissioned or deregistered. This may refer to an Stop Point, timetable, roster or transit employee logoff, etc.
ROUTES_MERGED numeric(1, 0) YES Flag indicating that the Patterns and Routes have been loaded into the database for a TimeTableVersion.

0 = no
1 = yes
SCHEDULES_MERGED numeric(1, 0) YES SCHEDULES_MERGED: Flag indicating that the Blocks, Trips, and Runs have been
loaded into the database for a TimeTableVersion.

0 = no
1 = yes
ROUTE_VERSION numeric(8, 0) YES

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKTIME_TABLE_VERSION PrimaryKey TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
TIME_TABLE_VERSION BLOCK Non-Identifying BLOCK_ID
TIME_TABLE_VERSION CURRENT_VERSION Non-Identifying TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID
TIME_TABLE_VERSION PATTERN Non-Identifying PATTERN_ID
TIME_TABLE_VERSION ROSTER Non-Identifying ROSTER_ID
TIME_TABLE_VERSION ROUTE Non-Identifying ROUTE_ID
TIME_TABLE_VERSION ROUTE_GROUP Non-Identifying ROUTE_GROUP_ID
TIME_TABLE_VERSION RUN Non-Identifying RUN_ID
TIME_TABLE_VERSION TRIP Non-Identifying TRIP_ID
TIME_TABLE_VERSION WORK_ASSIGNMENT_CONFIGURATION Non-Identifying CONFIGURATION_ID
TIME_TABLE_VERSION WORK_PIECE Non-Identifying WORK_PIECE_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

TRANSIT_DIVISION
Definition A transit service type category characterized by specific right-of-way, technological and operational features.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE TRANSIT_DIVISION(
     TRANSIT_DIV_ID        numeric(3, 0)     NOT NULL,
     TRANSIT_DIV_TEXT      varchar(100)      NOT NULL,
     DISPLAY_ORDER         numeric(3, 0)     NULL,
     DEACTIVATION_DATE     datetime          NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKTRANSIT_DIVISION PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
TRANSIT_DIV_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TRANSIT_DIV_TEXT varchar(100) NO A transit service type category characterized by specific right-of-way, technological and operational features.

AG - Automated Guideway
CC - Cable Car
CR - Commuter Rail
DR - Demand Responsive
FB - FerryBoat
HR - Heavy Rail
IP - Inclined Plane
JT - Jitney
LR - Light Rail
MB - Bus
MO - Monorail
PB - Publico
TB - Trolleybus
TR - Aerial Tramway
VP - Vanpool
OR - Other
DM - Dual Mode
MM - Multi-mode
PRT - Personal rapid transit
DISPLAY_ORDER numeric(3, 0) YES Override the display order of this item for a list.
DEACTIVATION_DATE datetime YES The date that an item is removed from display within the system (ie. logical delete).

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKTRANSIT_DIVISION PrimaryKey TRANSIT_DIV_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys

TRANSIT_DIVISION GEO_NODE_INTERVAL Non-Identifying INTERVAL_ID
TRANSIT_DIVISION PATTERN Non-Identifying PATTERN_ID
TRANSIT_DIVISION ROSTER Non-Identifying ROSTER_ID
TRANSIT_DIVISION ROUTE Non-Identifying ROUTE_ID

TRIP
Definition A one way movement of a transit vehicle in revenue service between two points. It can also be defined as a scheduled (timed) pattern.

Or, the scheduled traversal of a bus over a pattern.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE TRIP(
     TRIP_ID                      numeric(10, 0)     NOT NULL,
     EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID     numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     WORK_PIECE_ID                numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     TRIP_TYPE_ID                 numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID        numeric(5, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     TRANSIT_DIV_ID               numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 1 NOT NULL,
     BLOCK_ID                     numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     TRIP_SERIAL_NUMBER           numeric(7, 0)      NULL,
     TRIP_SEQUENCE                numeric(7, 0)      NULL,
     REMARK                       varchar(2000)      NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKTRIP PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (TRIP_ID)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKANNOUNCEMENT_TRIP FOREIGN KEY (EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID)
     REFERENCES ANNOUNCEMENT(ANNOUNCE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKBLOCK_TRIP FOREIGN KEY (BLOCK_ID)
     REFERENCES BLOCK(BLOCK_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTRANSIT_DIV_TRIP FOREIGN KEY (TRANSIT_DIV_ID)
     REFERENCES TRANSIT_DIVISION(TRANSIT_DIV_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTRIP_TYPE_TRIP FOREIGN KEY (TRIP_TYPE_ID)
     REFERENCES TRIP_TYPE(TRIP_TYPE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTT_VERSION_TRIP FOREIGN KEY (TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID)
     REFERENCES TIME_TABLE_VERSION(TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKWORK_PIECE_TRIP FOREIGN KEY (WORK_PIECE_ID)
     REFERENCES WORK_PIECE(WORK_PIECE_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
TRIP_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID numeric(5, 0) YES External announcement for this trip.
WORK_PIECE_ID numeric(10, 0) NO Work piece associated with this trip.
TRIP_TYPE_ID numeric(3, 0) YES Trip category.
TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID numeric(5, 0) NO Schedule version.
TRANSIT_DIV_ID numeric(3, 0) NO Transit division associated with this trip.
BLOCK_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TRIP_SERIAL_NUMBER numeric(7, 0) YES Property-assigned identification for a trip for Section 15 reporting sample.
TRIP_SEQUENCE numeric(7, 0) YES A number to order the trips within a block.
REMARK varchar(2000) YES A free-form text field to record general information regarding a trip.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKTRIP PrimaryKey TRIP_ID

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
ANNOUNCEMENT TRIP Non-Identifying EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID
BLOCK TRIP Non-Identifying BLOCK_ID
TRANSIT_DIVISION TRIP Non-Identifying TRANSIT_DIV_ID
TRIP_TYPE TRIP Non-Identifying TRIP_TYPE_ID
TIME_TABLE_VERSION TRIP Non-Identifying TIME_TABLE_VERSION_ID
WORK_PIECE TRIP Non-Identifying WORK_PIECE_ID
TRIP DAILY_TRIP_SAMPLE Identifying CALENDAR_ID
TRIP MDT_FILE Non-Identifying BLOCK_ID
TRIP TRIP_PATTERN_XREF Identifying TRIP_ID
TRIP DAILY_TRIP Non-Identifying DAILY_TRIP_ID
TRIP PASSENGER_COUNT Non-Identifying PASSENGER_COUNT_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

TRIP_PATTERN_XREF
Definition Association of one or more patterns to a trip.
Note
DDL Code CREATE TABLE TRIP_PATTERN_XREF(
     TRIP_ID                      numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     PATTERN_ID                   numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     GEO_NODE_ID                  numeric(10, 0)     DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
     PATTERN_GEO_NODE_SEQ         numeric(7, 0)      NOT NULL,
     TRIP_PATTERN_SEQ             numeric(7, 0)      NOT NULL,
     EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID     numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     TIME_POINT_ATTRIB_ID         numeric(3, 0)      DEFAULT 0 NULL,
     CROSSING_TIME                numeric(10, 0)     NULL,
     INTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID     numeric(5, 0)      NULL,
     TIME_POINT_IND               varchar(1)         NULL,
     CONSTRAINT XPKTRIP_PATTERN_XREF PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED (TRIP_ID,PATTERN_ID,GEO_NODE_ID,PATTERN_GEO_NODE_SEQ,TRIP_PATTERN_SEQ)
     ON MAIN_INDX,
     CONSTRAINT FKANNOUNCE_TRIP_PATTERN_X FOREIGN KEY (INTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID)
     REFERENCES ANNOUNCEMENT(ANNOUNCE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKANNOUNCE_TRIP_PATTRN_X FOREIGN KEY (EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID)
     REFERENCES ANNOUNCEMENT(ANNOUNCE_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKPATRN_GN_X_TRIP_PATRN_X FOREIGN KEY (PATTERN_ID,GEO_NODE_ID,PATTERN_GEO_NODE_SEQ)
     REFERENCES PATTERN_GEO_NODE_XREF(PATTERN_ID,GEO_NODE_ID,PATTERN_GEO_NODE_SEQ),
     CONSTRAINT FKTP_ATTRIB_TRIP_PATRN_X FOREIGN KEY (TIME_POINT_ATTRIB_ID)
     REFERENCES TIME_POINT_ATTRIBUTE(TIME_POINT_ATTRIB_ID),
     CONSTRAINT FKTRIP_TRIP_PATTERN_X FOREIGN KEY (TRIP_ID)
     REFERENCES TRIP(TRIP_ID)
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
TRIP_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
PATTERN_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique identifier assigned by a transit agency for a defined sequence of points, events and activation events along a variation of a route.
GEO_NODE_ID numeric(10, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
PATTERN_GEO_NODE_SEQ numeric(7, 0) NO The sequence in which geo nodes are crossed along the pattern.
TRIP_PATTERN_SEQ numeric(7, 0) NO The sequence in which the patterns are run for the trip.
EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TIME_POINT_ATTRIB_ID numeric(3, 0) YES The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
CROSSING_TIME numeric(10, 0) YES The time value associated with a time point for a particular trip.
INTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID numeric(5, 0) YES The unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TIME_POINT_IND varchar(1) YES Indicates if this node is a time point or not. If the node is not a time point, then it is simply a stop. This can vary by route.

Primary and Unique Keys
Key Name Key Type Keys
XPKTRIP_PATTERN_XREF PrimaryKey TRIP_ID,PATTERN_ID,GEO_NODE_ID,PATTERN_GEO_NODE_SEQ,TRIP_PATTERN_SEQ

Foreign Keys
Parent Table Child Table Type Foreign Keys
ANNOUNCEMENT TRIP_PATTERN_XREF Non-Identifying INTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID
ANNOUNCEMENT TRIP_PATTERN_XREF Non-Identifying EXTERNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_ID
PATTERN_GEO_NODE_XREF TRIP_PATTERN_XREF Identifying PATTERN_ID,GEO_NODE_ID,PATTERN_GEO_NODE_SEQ
TIME_POINT_ATTRIBUTE TRIP_PATTERN_XREF Non-Identifying TIME_POINT_ATTRIB_ID
TRIP TRIP_PATTERN_XREF Identifying TRIP_ID

Storage
STORAGE OPTION STORAGE VALUE
FILEGROUP MAIN_DATA

TRIP_TYPE
Definition A set of classifications of the one-way movement of a public transportation vehicle between two points.
Note

     TRIP_TYPE_ID          numeric(3, 0)     NOT NULL,
     TRIP_TYPE_TEXT        varchar(100)      NOT NULL,
     DISPLAY_ORDER         numeric(3, 0)     NULL,
     DEACTIVATION_DATE     datetime          NULL,

     ON MAIN_INDX
) ON MAIN_DATA
go

Columns
ColumnName Domain Datatype NULL Definition
TRIP_TYPE_ID numeric(3, 0) NO A unique, system-assigned identifier for each record.
TRIP_TYPE_TEXT varchar(100) NO Type of transit service provided.

1 Regular,
2 Express,
3 Circular,
4 Radial,
5 Feeder,
6 Jitney,
7 Limited,
8 Non-revenue,
9 Unknown,
10 Charter Service,
11 School Service,
12 Special Service,
13 Operator Training,
14 Maintenance Service,
15 No Service,
16 Stand-by,
17 Extra
DISPLAY_ORDER numeric(3, 0) YES Override the display order of this item for a list.
